subject: Join us for a free branding workshop tomorrow
body:
VIEW IN BROWSER 
View in Your Browser
 
GROW AS A MENTEE 
BECOME A MENTOR 
EMPOWER TEAMS 
 
It's not too late to register!
Join us tomorrow for our free webinar:
Grow Your Brand with Keith Allen West
 
Date
: March 19th
Time
: 11am MT 
Location
: Zoom
Your brand isn’t your colours or your logo; it’s a perception that’s formed by the experiences and interactions someone has with you. 
When you’re intentional about your online (and offline!) presence, you can shape that perception and align it to your goals, while being authentically and uniquely you.
A solid personal brand will help you:
Earn promotions
Nail interviews
Land client projects
Grow an audience online of more than 250,000 people
Seriously increase your income
Build a network of talented mentors you can lean on for support and advice
GROW YOUR BRAND 
 
Keith Allen West is a branding expert, boutique social media influencer, blogger, public speaker and an actor. He is known for his energetic presentations on real world branding and public relations for small business success.
West spends his time between Los Angeles (CA), Savannah (GA), and Albuquerque (NM) when not traveling globally promoting scenic destinations, luxurious hotels, fashion/beauty brands, and the entertainment industry. 
 
He’s been featured in People Magazine, USA Today, VOGUE, Huffington Post, The Guardian, LA Times, NY Times, FOX, CNN, AOL, MSN, NPR and many more media outlets. His small business reality series THE STARTUP on AOL Small Business reached 24 million subscribers. 
 
West has reached the Inc. 500/5000 list with two of his cosmetics companies by growing revenue over 1,000%. Urban Fresh Cosmetics sales ballooned from $200,000 to $5.1 million in just three years. He consults with other quality brands to grow their sales with his trusted methods.
REGISTER 
 
 
 
 
 
HAVE QUESTIONS? VIEW FAQ. 
LISTEN IN: PODCASTS 
THE REAL MENTORS BLOG 
LOGIN TO YOUR ACCOUNT

body:
A look into the ‘WTF’ business philosophy ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏  ͏ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­  
 
C-Suite to Main Street
VIRTUAL EVENT
How Brian Scudamore Built an Empire on Failure
April 3 | 12pm ET
Ever dreamed of turning a simple idea into a massive success?
 Brian Scudamore, the founder and CEO of 1-800-GOT-JUNK?
, did just that. Starting with a single truck, he built a multi-million dollar enterprise with hundreds of franchises. But his story isn't just about the money; it's about the journey, the risks, and a willingness to learn from every stumble.  
‌
Join us on 
Thursday, April 3 at noon ET
 as Brian shares his insights into the power of failure and how it can transform you into the best entrepreneur you can be. 
REGISTER NOW
 
  
  
Here's a sneak peek at what Brian will cover: 
  
Turning Failure into
a Positive
Discover how to reframe setbacks and extract valuable lessons from every mistake. Brian will share practical strategies for transforming negative experiences into positive momentum.
  
Key Employee Traits
Learn what crucial quality Scudamore values above all else when hiring. This insight alone could revolutionize your hiring process and help you build a stronger, more resilient team.
  
Essential Advice
Hear Brian's top tips for those just starting their entrepreneurial journey. He'll provide actionable advice on navigating challenges, taking calculated risks, and staying motivated.
  
WHY SHOULD YOU ATTEND?
Here are just a few reasons: 
‌
Gain valuable insights from a seasoned entrepreneur.
 
Learn how to cultivate a "Willing to Fail" mindset.
 
Discover practical strategies for overcoming challenges and building a successful business.
 
‌
Don't miss this opportunity to apply Brian's “WTF” (Willing to Fail) philosophy to your day-to-day life. 
Register now to secure your spot!

subject: April 21st: Join Visionary Leaders at the Creative Spirit Gala 2025
body:
Help us reach our goal—one million fair-wage opportunities for neurodivergent professionals by 2030.
 
 
 
Join Us on April 21, 2025
at The Board Room at the New York Stock Exchange 
Honoring Our 2025 Corporate Champions of Neurodiversity
 
 
Donna Murphy 
CEO, Havas Creative & Health Networks
 
 
Raja Rajamannar 
Chief Marketing & Communications Officer, Mastercard
Will You Join Us?
 
We have set a brilliant goal: To empower neurodivergent individuals by creating one million fair-wage integrated opportunities by 2030—paving the road to financial independence.
Creative Spirit was founded in 2017 to connect neurodiverse professionals with fair-wage jobs at the best companies in the world. Creative Spirit's unique approach, anchored by first-of-its kind coaching, mentoring, and job placement services, boasts a 95% retention rate. 
We work
 
directly with organizations and neurodivergent individuals to create life-altering career growth and lasting success. We believe companies are most successful and innovative when neurodivergent employees are fully included in the workforce. 
Providing these expert services is costly, and the Creative Spirit gala fundraiser provides 95% of the funding needed to serve our candidates at no cost to them. Your support is critical and greatly appreciated. 
Buy Tickets, Donate, Sponsor
 
Sincerely,
Lori Falcone & Martha Riley
Creative Spirit Gala Co-Chairs

 to buy tickets, donate, and sponsor.

subject: 80s Rooftop Party Alert! Are You In?
body:
Step into 1985 for a night of painting, mystery, and nonstop fun—high above the city!
MYSTERY IN MINNEAPOLIS: THE ULTIMATE '80S PAINT & SIP!
 
Big hair. Bold colors. A neon-soaked rooftop party with a mystery to solve! 
Step into 1985 for a night of non-stop fun, painting, and intrigue—set 50 floors above the city at 
Wind
ows at Marquette
, Downtown Minneapolis, in the IDS Building!
 
Your mission? Grab a brush, crack the clues, and uncover the truth before time runs out!
 
What’s in store?
 
Paint your own 80s masterpiece—no experience needed!
Snag a rad 80s goody bag!
Light refreshments included to keep you fueled!
Bar with drinks available for purchase!
Prizes for best dressed & top detective—so dress to impress!
 
This is NOT your average paint night—this is an interactive, high-energy, totally tubular experience you don’t want to miss! 
.
LEARN MORE
 
 
OYA ARTS STUDIO TURNS ONE, LET'S CELEBRATE!
SATURDAY MARCH 22: 6 - 8 PM
Join us as we celebrate one year of creativity, community, and unforgettable experiences at Oya Arts!
 
Our first birthday party will be a night to remember, featuring:
Live steel pan music
Delicious Caribbean bites from Chana Kitchen
Special discounts & prizes to be won!
 
Whether you've bought art, painted with us, taken a workshop, or just stopped by to say hello—we’d love to celebrate with you!
 
If you haven’t booked your ticket yet, this is your last chance!  Don't miss out—RSVP now!
GET YOUR FREE TICKET

subject: Register for our free branding workshop on March 19th!
body:
VIEW IN BROWSER 
View in Your Browser
 
GROW AS A MENTEE 
BECOME A MENTOR 
EMPOWER TEAMS 
 
Join us on March 19th for our free webinar:
Grow Your Brand with Keith Allen West
Date
: March 19th
Time
: 11am MT 
Location
: Zoom
Your brand isn’t your colours or your logo; it’s a perception that’s formed by the experiences and interactions someone has with you. 
When you’re intentional about your online (and offline!) presence, you can shape that perception and align it to your goals, while being authentically and uniquely you.
A solid personal brand will help you:
Earn promotions
Nail interviews
Land client projects
Grow an audience online of more than 250,000 people
Seriously increase your income
Build a network of talented mentors you can lean on for support and advice
REGISTER 
 
Keith Allen West is a branding expert, boutique social media influencer, blogger, public speaker and an actor. He is known for his energetic presentations on real world branding and public relations for small business success.
West spends his time between Los Angeles (CA), Savannah (GA), and Albuquerque (NM) when not traveling globally promoting scenic destinations, luxurious hotels, fashion/beauty brands, and the entertainment industry. 
 
He’s been featured in People Magazine, USA Today, VOGUE, Huffington Post, The Guardian, LA Times, NY Times, FOX, CNN, AOL, MSN, NPR and many more media outlets. His small business reality series THE STARTUP on AOL Small Business reached 24 million subscribers. 
 
West has reached the Inc. 500/5000 list with two of his cosmetics companies by growing revenue over 1,000%. Urban Fresh Cosmetics sales ballooned from $200,000 to $5.1 million in just three years. He consults with other quality brands to grow their sales with his trusted methods.
REGISTER

subject: Light the Darkness Honoree Highlight
body:
Learn more and join us May 29th!
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
 
 
Honoree Highlight: Representative Lindsey LaPointe
 
Join us in honoring Representative Lindsey LaPointe, one of four honorees at our Light the Darkness gala on Thursday, May 29, 2025, at The Geraghty Chicago. Learn more about 
R
epresentative LaPointe
 and purchase your tickets to celebrate her 
here
.
State Representative Lindsey LaPointe is a social worker turned public policy professional with a breadth of experience in human services, state government, policy advocacy, and community and political work. She serves the far Northwest side of Chicago and brings a social worker’s accessibility and compassion to constituent services and policy making. Before taking office in July of 2019, Lindsey served in a variety of direct service social work roles. After earning an MSW at the Jane Addams College of Social Work in 2011, she transitioned to policy work, focusing on the creation of a more rehabilitative and just criminal justice system.  
In the neighborhood, she works alongside neighbors on various projects including homelessness and affordable housing, the environment, and senior issues. In Springfield, she champions accessible and affordable behavioral healthcare, increased housing options, and a fully resourced human service system. Today, she Chairs the Mental Health & Addiction Committee in the Illinois House and sits on the Medicaid Working Group. She resides in the heart of the 19th district - Portage Park. Celebrate Representative LaPointe with us—buy your tickets below.
Buy Now

subject: Spring Into Unforgettable Events
body:
Spring Meetings in Denver, Houston, Omaha, St Louis & Dallas
 
 
  
  
About 
 |  
Global Sales Team
  |  
Collection
 
SPRING HAS SPRUNG! MEETINGS AND EVENTS AT MAGNOLIA PROPERTIES 
 
Planning group events in the spring brings a refreshing energy and sense of renewal. The season’s blooming landscapes, mild temperatures, and longer days set the perfect stage for memorable gatherings. From charming garden venues and seasonal culinary delights to outdoor adventures and local festivals, each Magnolia property offers a unique backdrop to enhance any event. Meeting planners can embrace the vibrancy of spring to create engaging, inspiring, and dynamic group experiences. By incorporating seasonal activities into your agenda, you’ll add a touch of freshness, creativity, and natural beauty that will leave a lasting impression on attendees.
BE MATCHED TO YOUR PERFECT VENUE
 
5 Spring-Inspired Activities for Group Events at Magnolia Properties:
 
Botanical Garden Strolls
 – Organize a visit to nearby botanical gardens to witness the vibrant spring blooms. For instance, guests at Magnolia Houston can explore the Houston Botanic Garden, while those at Magnolia Denver might enjoy the Denver Botanic Gardens. These serene environments offer a peaceful retreat and a chance to connect with nature.
 
Outdoor Team-Building Challenges
 – Take advantage of the pleasant spring weather by arranging team-building activities such as scavenger hunts or obstacle courses in local parks. Magnolia Omaha, located near the Gene Leahy Mall, provides an excellent setting for such engaging outdoor events.
 
Seasonal Farm-to-Table Tastings
 – Celebrate the flavors of spring with a farm-to-table dining experience. Magnolia St. Louis offers menus featuring locally sourced, seasonal ingredients, allowing attendees to savor the region's freshest produce.
 
Spring Festival Excursions
 – Immerse your group in local culture by attending spring festivals. Magnolia Dallas, situated in the heart of downtown, offers easy access to various cultural events and arts festivals, providing attendees with a taste of the local arts scene.
 
Al Fresco Networking Receptions
 – Host networking events in outdoor spaces to enjoy the mild spring evenings. Magnolia Denver's rooftop patio offers a stunning backdrop of the city skyline, creating a memorable setting for social gatherings.
 
START PLANNING
 
MAGNOLIA DENVER, A TRIBUTE PORTFOLIO HOTEL
DENVER, COLORADO
 
Springtime Events in Denver:
Denver Botanic Gardens Spring Blossoms:
 From March through May, the gardens showcase tulips, daffodils, and cherry blossoms in full bloom. A guided tour or group yoga session among the flowers makes for a refreshing outdoor experience.
 
Five Points Jazz Festival:
 This free, day-long festival in May celebrates Denver’s rich jazz heritage with live performances, food vendors, and a lively street fair—perfect for a team outing with music and culture.
 
Red Rocks Amphitheater Concerts & Hiking:
 Spring is an ideal time to catch a concert at this iconic venue or take a group hike along the scenic trails surrounding the amphitheater for an unforgettable outdoor adventure.
 
LoDo & Dairy Block Patio Dining:
 Take advantage of the city’s vibrant culinary scene with group happy hours or networking dinners at one of the many trendy outdoor patios in Denver’s historic Lower Downtown district.
 
Cherry Creek Trail Biking & Walks:
 This scenic, urban trail runs through downtown Denver, offering a great way for groups to explore the city on foot or by bike while enjoying the crisp spring air and mountain views.
PERSONALIZE YOUR OFFER | REACH OUT TO YOUR GSO
MAGNOLIA HOUSTON, A TRIBUTE PORTFOLIO HOTEL
HOUSTON, TEXAS
 
Springtime Events in Houston:
Azalea Trail at Bayou Bend Gardens:
 Every March, this stunning estate bursts into color with thousands of blooming azaleas. A guided tour through the historic gardens offers a picturesque and relaxing group experience.
Houston Art Car Parade & Festival:
 This one-of-a-kind spring event showcases hundreds of wildly creative, decorated vehicles. Groups can enjoy live music, food vendors, and a fun, vibrant atmosphere perfect for team outings.
Discovery Green Concerts & Outdoor Activities:
 Just minutes from Magnolia Houston, this urban park hosts free spring concerts, art installations, and yoga sessions—ideal for casual team gatherings or post-meeting relaxation.
Spring Patio Dining & Craft Cocktails in Downtown Houston:
 Take advantage of Houston’s mild spring weather by organizing a group happy hour or dinner at one of the city’s many scenic rooftop patios or garden-inspired restaurants.
Buffalo Bayou Park Walks & Kayak Tours:
 Groups can enjoy a guided nature walk, a scenic bike ride, or even a team-building kayak excursion along the bayou, offering a refreshing way to explore the city’s natural beauty.
PERSONALIZE YOUR OFFER | REACH OUT TO YOUR GSO
MAGNOLIA OMAHA
OMAHA, NEBRASKA
 
Springtime Events in Omaha:
Lauritzen Gardens Spring Blooms:
 From mid-March through May, Omaha’s premier botanical garden comes alive with vibrant tulips, daffodils, and cherry blossoms. A guided tour or self-led stroll through the seasonal displays makes for a refreshing and picturesque group outing.
Omaha Farmers Market at The Old Market:
 Kicking off in early May, this bustling outdoor market features fresh local produce, artisan goods, and live entertainment. A morning visit allows groups to explore the lively atmosphere while supporting local vendors.
Jazz on the Green at Midtown Crossing:
 Beginning in late spring, this free outdoor concert series offers an inviting space for groups to gather, relax, and enjoy live music in a beautiful park setting. Bring a picnic or take advantage of nearby dining options for a laid-back networking opportunity.
 
Spring Wine Walk in the Old Market:
 Groups can indulge in a curated wine-tasting experience at some of Omaha’s best local wineries and tasting rooms. The charming brick streets and mild spring weather create the perfect backdrop for an engaging social event.
Trails & Outdoor Adventures at Heartland of America Park:
 With its scenic lake, fountains, and walking trails, this downtown oasis is ideal for a morning group walk, casual networking jog, or even a guided bike tour. The fresh spring air and waterfront views make it a rejuvenating addition to any meeting agenda.
PERSONALIZE YOUR OFFER | REACH OUT TO YOUR GSO
MAGNOLIA ST. LOUIS, A TRIBUTE PORTFOLIO HOTEL
ST. LOUIS, MISSOURI
 
Springtime Events in St.Louis:
Missouri Botanical Garden in Bloom:
 From March through May, the garden bursts with colorful tulips, azaleas, and cherry blossoms. A guided group tour offers a serene and inspiring way to experience the beauty of spring.
 
Soulard Farmers Market Excursions:
 One of the oldest markets in the U.S., Soulard is a vibrant spot for group outings. Attendees can explore fresh produce, artisanal goods, and local delicacies while enjoying live music and a lively atmosphere.
 
Twilight Tuesdays at the Missouri History Museum:
 Starting in late spring, this free outdoor concert series features live music in a relaxed park setting. Groups can unwind after a day of meetings with great tunes and local food vendors.
 
Spring Rooftop Gatherings at Three Sixty:
 Just a short walk from Magnolia St. Louis, this rooftop bar offers panoramic city views, craft cocktails, and a chic setting for networking or casual post-meeting relaxation.
 
St. Louis Riverfront & Gateway Arch Park Walks:
 Spring is the perfect time for a group stroll along the Mississippi River, culminating in breathtaking views of the iconic Gateway Arch. Add a riverboat cruise for a unique team experience.
PERSONALIZE YOUR OFFER | REACH OUT TO YOUR GSO
MAGNOLIA DALLAS
DALLAS, TEXAS
 
Springtime Events in Dallas:
Dallas Arboretum & Spring Blooms Festival:
 From March through April, this annual festival showcases thousands of tulips, daffodils, and azaleas in full bloom. A guided group tour or a private picnic in the gardens makes for a refreshing and scenic outing.
 
Deep Ellum Arts Festival:
 Taking place in early April, this lively event features local artists, live music, and food vendors. Groups can explore murals, shop for handmade goods, and experience Dallas' creative energy together.
 
Patio Dining & Live Music in Uptown:
 Spring’s mild temperatures make it the perfect time for al fresco gatherings. Plan a networking dinner at one of Uptown’s many patio restaurants or enjoy live music at a rooftop bar with stunning city views.
 
Dallas Farmers Market Tasting Tour:
 A short distance from Magnolia Dallas, this market offers farm-fresh produce, artisan food vendors, and wine tastings. A guided group experience provides a delicious and interactive way to support local businesses.
 
Trinity Skyline Trail & Margaret Hunt Hill Bridge Walks:
 Encourage team bonding with a scenic group walk or bike ride along the Trinity River, featuring skyline views and green spaces perfect for a springtime break from meetings.

subject: This is *exactly* how to tip.
body:
In 3 countries you’ll probably visit.͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌  
 
 
Here’s a little something extra. 
“To tip or not to tip?” is a question you’ve likely asked yourself while traveling. The answer is it depends. Every country has its own guardrails around gratuity. We made a cheatsheet to help you get it right in some of the world’s most popular destinations. 
Read our guide 
 
Our top tipping tips (say that three times). 
Mexico: cash is king.
 
Put those extra pesos in your back pocket - you’ll need them later. Mexican eateries and accommodations prefer cash tips. Rule of thumb is to leave notes, not coins. 
 
 
🚕 Taxis:
 Not required 
(but MX$10 - 20 appreciated)
🍽️ Restaurants:
 10 - 20% of bill 
(15 - 20% in tourist areas)
🍸 Bars:
 10 - 20% of bill 
(or MX$20 per round)
🧽 Housekeeping:
MX$25 - 50 per day
🛎️ Concierges:
MX$100 - 150
France: it’s already on the bill.
 
Local law requires restaurants, hotels and taxis to include a 15% service charge. But if you’re the generous type (or just really loved your chatty waiter) feel free to leave a few extra euros. 
 
 
🚕 Taxis:
 Not required
(but €1 - 2 appreciated)
🍽️ Restaurants:
 Not required
(€2 - 5 for exceptional service)
🍸 Bars:
 Not required
(but €1 - 2 appreciated)
🧽 Housekeeping:
€1 - 2 per night
🛎️ Concierges:
€5 - 10 for exceptional service
Japan: keep it hush-hush (or don’t tip at all).
 
Tipping is rare here and sometimes even refused. Still, you can tip your private guide, ryokan or housekeeper. If you do, use clean bills, place them in an envelope and present it to the recipient with both hands. 
 
 
🚕 Taxis:
Do not tip
🍽️ Restaurants:
Do not tip
🍸 Bars:
Do not tip
🧽 Housekeeping:
 Tip discretely
(in an envelope with a thank-you note)
🛎️ Concierges:
Do not tip

MIDNIGHT 
OIL
EDITION 295
RESOURCES & TIPS
 
Applying for a business loan: what you need to know
A business loan can be a powerful tool, but securing one requires careful planning and research. Before diving in, 
discover the types of loans
 available, how to prepare your application, and our tips for increasing your chances of approval. 
  
[GUIDE] Manage your finances like a pro
Setting up your accounting correctly from the very beginning of your business journey will save you countless headaches and ensure a clear picture of your financial health as you grow. 
Use this step-by-step guide
 to establish your accounting processes and set yourself up for financial success.
  
Smart ways to boost sales on Pinterest
Pinterest is not just a pretty platform; it's a goldmine for driving engagement and inspiring sales. With a wide range of tools at your fingertips, 
use these tips
 to turn your Pinterest presence into a powerful asset that connects you directly with your audience.
  
A MESSAGE FROM WALMART BUSINESS
 
Tax-Exempt Shopping Made Easy
Imagine a world where managing your organization's budget is easier, faster, and more transparent. With Walmart Business and the WTEP, that vision becomes a reality. Walmart Business offers a streamlined solution that simplifies tax-exempt purchasing, both online and in-store, saving you time and money. 
‌
Enjoy simple tax-exempt shopping with Walmart Business – easily apply your status in-store or online with Walmart Pay in the Walmart Business app.
‌
Eligible organizations, terms apply.
Learn More
 
  
QUOTABLE MOMENT
“If you choose bootstrapping versus raising capital from outside investors, you need to be prepared to go slow and steady. You must focus on building a sound, robust business that makes more than it spends from Day 1.”
— Aaron Davidson, Chief Executive Officer of Cronometer, 
guides entrepreneurs on leading startups to success without external investors
.
CO— EVENTS
 
[RSVP] How failure can propel you to success
April 3 | 12pm ET
Brian Scudamore, the visionary behind 
1-800-GOT-JUNK
?, transformed a single truck into a multimillion-dollar empire with hundreds of franchises. However, his remarkable journey wasn't paved with effortless victories — it was a long road of risk-taking, big dreams, and a willingness to learn from mistakes.
‌
Tune in to C-Suite to Main Street: The Power of Failure in Building Business Success on 
April 3
 to learn more about how failure can become your greatest competitive advantage.
Register Now
 
  
BY THE NUMBERS
  
17
Are you new to accounting or brushing up on terms as a business owner? Here are 
17 must-know financial terms
 to get you started.
  
$7B
The multibillion-dollar greeting card market is booming with new messages that resonate with millennials. 
Here’s how independent makers and startups 
drive this trend with low entry costs, making it an exciting time for innovation. 
  
$100
Take our annual reader survey and tell us about yourself, your business, and your interactions with us for a chance to win a 
$100 Amazon gift card
 as a thank you for your time and insights.
  
GRANTS & AWARDS
The 
Comcast Innovation Fund
 is accepting applications for the 2025 grant year, providing financial support ranging from $3,000 to $150,000 for projects with a one-year duration that advance internet technology and public policy. The 
grant deadline is rolling
 until the funds for the year are exhausted.
‌
The 
U.S. Department of Education (DOE)
 has various grants available to small businesses in the education sector. Each grant has unique eligibility criteria, with some opportunities set aside for public schools, state agencies, or nonprofit organizations; however, others allow applications from for-profit private sector companies. Deadlines for currently available DOE grants run through 
March 17
.
‌
Honeycomb Credit is offering a 
$10,000 Breakthrough Grant
 to support small businesses in achieving their next big milestone, such as opening a new location, launching a food truck, or franchising. Eligible applicants must own a small business; no purchase or payment is required to apply. Applications are due 
April 2
.
‌
The 
Rémy Martin This is My City Microgrant
 is awarding $20,000 grants along with one-on-one mentorship from industry experts to emerging creatives who contribute to their local culture through entrepreneurial projects. Chosen candidates will be recognized as honorees and receive guidance from established figures in music, art, or culture. Applications are due by 
April 11
.
‌

subject: Learn from the worst
body:
The weirdest fails for employee recognition in 2025‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­‌   ­
 
View in browser
 
We don't just help you recognize employees- we help you know them
­
Hey 
Briza
,
 
It's that time of year again where we ask everyone to share their strangest examples of employee recognition from the past year. 
 
From mediocre to downright bizarre - it sounds like it's been a tough year out there. Here's some of the highlights...
 
7️⃣  A steak/burger 
branding iron
 with the company logo 🥩 
Goodwill, here I come!
 
6️⃣  A company-wide 
shared login
 to Masterclass 🎓
Ok, we get the sentiment with this one. But don't pat yourself on the back too hard cheapskate. 
 
5️⃣  One-time lottery for one 
$25 gift card
 among 50 people 🫣
Please keep this company in your thoughts and prayers.
 
4️⃣  A sheet of 
branded stickers
 for meeting a major revenue milestone 🙏
You know, so you can put our logo on your water bottle and tell everyone how proud you are to work here!
 
3️⃣   A shared birthday cake with the 
CEO’s face
 on the frosting 🧁
Not sure if this is an inside joke or not...Yum!?
 
2️⃣  The "opportunity" to compete in a 
push-up competition
 at work 💪
Ok now this is just getting insane!
 
And the number 1️⃣ worst employee recognition goes an Executive at a very recognizable tech company who said, 
"not being laid off in the last round was the most meaningful recognition anyone could get."
 👀
And as a bonus, our favorite from years past…
Free use of the microwave for one month if you win Employee of the Month. (Apparently they charge to use the microwave.) 🌶🌶🌶
 
It seriously doesn’t have to be this way! 
 
Knowwn helps you know your team and enables you to give them a top-notch employee recognition experience at scale. 
See your team's Care Profiles - FREE
 
With joy,
­
PS: Interested in more bespoke recognition solutions for your team? 
Talk to us!
­

1311 Vine Street, Cincinnati, Ohio 45202

subject: Take Your Events to New Heights
body:
Exclusive flight simulator & skyline bites 
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
 
MEETINGS THAT
TAKE FLIGHT
Host your next event at Colorado Springs’ newest hotel, Hotel Polaris, designed for seamless and inspiring gatherings. With over 36,000 square feet of flexible indoor and outdoor space - all conveniently on one floor - our meeting venues are filled with natural light and breathtaking mountain views. Attendees will enjoy spacious guestrooms, a state-of-the-art fitness center, a full-service spa with an indoor/outdoor relaxation suite, a heated outdoor pool, and bocce ball courts. Unique to Hotel Polaris, our exclusive in-house F-16 and 737 flight simulators offer a one-of-a-kind team-building experience.
 
Between sessions, guests can explore six distinctive dining options, including the area’s most exciting rooftop bar with panoramic views of the U.S. Air Force Academy. For off-site activities, we’re minutes from Top Golf, Overdrive indoor karting, I-Fly, and Nerf Dart Wars. Located on the north end of Colorado Springs with easy access to I-25, we’re a short drive from both Denver International Airport and Colorado Springs Airport. With vibrant orange sunsets and a backdrop of the Rockies, Hotel Polaris offers an unforgettable setting where business meets inspiration.
 
Book a program in 2025, that takes place in 2025 and receive the following concessions:  
20% allowable attrition
Complimentary Wi-Fi in the meeting space up to 3 MBS
One suite upgrade for every 75 rooms booked on peak
One complimentary flight simulator experience for up to 2 hours
GET STARTED!
 
GO ON A VIRTUAL TOUR
 
*This promotion cannot be combined with other discounts and excludes gratuities and taxes. Polaris reserves the right to modify or discontinue the offer, as well as adjust eligible dates, without notice. The offer is not valid for previously booked programs.

ACCOMMODATIONS

subject: Unleash Your Team’s Potential with Fresh Adventures! - Let’s Roam
body:
Hey Briza! 🚀
We’re gearing up for an exciting season of bonding, brainstorming, and big wins—and we’ve got fresh 
team-building experiences
 ready to take your crew to the next level. Ready to explore fresh ways to connect with your team? Let’s jump right in! 
Kickstart the Collaboration🫱🏻‍🫲🏽
There’s no better moment to recharge and reconnect! Transform ordinary workdays into extraordinary adventures—host lively brainstorming sessions, get playful with quick-fire icebreaker rounds, or dive into a shared project that challenges everyone’s creativity. Looking for something truly out of the box? For something truly out of the box, our 
Let’s Roam scavenger hunts
 and 
virtual office games
 are tailor-made to spark energy and elevate teamwork. Let’s raise the bar for synergy! 
Fresh Perspectives with “Radical Candor” 🌱
Looking for a game-changer in team unity and communication? Check out 
Radical Candor by Kim Scott
. The core idea is simple yet powerful: care personally about the people you work with, while also challenging directly when giving feedback. This balanced approach helps everyone address challenges head-on, learn from mistakes faster, and celebrate wins more meaningfully. 
Here are a couple of quick ways to start practicing in your team: 
1. 
Be Immediate and Specific:
 Offer feedback right when it counts—no need to wait for formal reviews. 
2. 
Use the “SBI” (Situation-Behavior-Impact) Model:
 Clearly state the context, the behavior, and how it impacts outcomes. 
3. 
Ask for Feedback:
 Show genuine curiosity about how you can improve. This encourages open, two-way conversations. 
Try this fun icebreaker: 
“If our team had a theme song, what would it be and why?”
 Sing it out with your team! Don't be shy and let those creative answers spark new ideas! 
 
Small Shifts, Big Uplifts 🌟
One timely suggestion—or a quick bit of honest feedback—can transform a looming deadline from panic mode to power mode. Don’t underestimate the impact of small, thoughtful gestures. Encouraging Radical Candor on even the smallest tasks can create a ripple effect of trust, efficiency, and innovation across the team. 
Let’s Roam: Did You Know? 🤔
A recent study found that organizations with strong collaborative cultures can see up to a 50% drop in employee turnover. That’s huge! It shows that happy, well-connected teams stick around—and everyone wins. 
Let’s Roam scavenger hunts
 bring excitement, creativity, and teamwork to the forefront, helping you build those connections that keep teams together for the long haul. 
Team Triumph Starts Now 💡
Why wait on stronger team unity? Turn the energy and ideas from this newsletter into action! Whether you opt for a high-octane city scavenger hunt or a dynamic online challenge, Let’s Roam has you covered. 
Don’t miss this chance to 
enjoy an unforgettable team-building experience
 and elevate your workplace vibe! 
Cheers to your team’s success,
 
Let’s Roam 
RESERVE NOW
 
Let's Roam, LLC, 4023 Kennett Pike, #50241, Wilmington, DE 19807, United States, 1-(833)-202-ROAM (7626)

Offer valid for stays completed January 1 - April 30, 2025 (“promotion period”) at any hotel or resort within the Hilton Portfolio. Hilton Honors™ members must first register at 
HiltonHonors.com/DoubleYourStay
 prior to completing a stay within the promotion period. 
Registered Hilton Honors members checking in before January 1, 2025, will receive Bonus Points for their stay if the stay is completed on or after January 1, 2025, and prior to or on April 30, 2025. 
Registered Hilton Honors members will earn Double Points per stay during the promotion period. “Double Points” means members will receive Bonus Points equal to the number of Base Points earned during a stay. 
There is no limit to the total amount of Bonus Points that may be earned during the promotion period with this offer. However, there are restrictions on the number of Base Points that can be earned on a single stay at certain brands. 
For examples and further details, please see the 
FAQ page
. 
This offer may be altered or terminated without notice. Bonus Points do not count toward elite tier qualification. Please allow six to eight weeks from completion of your stay for Bonus Points to appear in your account. A 'stay' is defined as the total number of consecutive nights spent at the same hotel, whether or not a guest checks out and checks back in again. Offer is not valid for groups and cannot be combined with other select offers. subject: Your Questions Answered: Executive Orders and Compliance
body:
Now is the time to amplify your efforts with proven expertise. 
 
 
Recent executive orders (EOs) have raised pressing questions about their implications in the workplace — and HR professionals need clear, reliable guidance to address these questions effectively. 
Join SHRM today
 to engage with SHRM experts as they provide insights, actionable guidance, and key considerations to help you prepare your workplace with confidence. Whether you’re navigating compliance challenges, workplace policies, or operational shifts, this webinar will equip you with the knowledge and tools you need to adapt and lead effectively. 
A 
SHRM membership
 will give you immediate access to our EO Impact Zone and First 100 Days hub pages, compliance resources, expert analysis, and strategies to help you stay compliant, safeguard your teams, and adapt to change without missing a step. 
Webinar attendees will also receive 1 PDC toward SHRM-CP
®
 or SHRM-SCP
®
 recertification.
 
 
 
JOIN SHRM
 
 
Key Takeaways
 
Implications of Executive Orders:
 Understanding their impact on the workplace. 
 
HR Guidance:
 Clear, reliable insights to address workplace challenges. 
 
Compliance and Policy Support:
 Assistance with navigating legal and operational shifts. 
Opportunity for Engagement:
 A chance to interact with industry leaders and gain clarity. 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
Meet the Speakers
 
 
 
 
Jim Link, SHRM-SCP
CHRO, SHRM
Jim Link is the CHRO at SHRM. In his most recent role as CHRO for Randstad North America, Link led a global team of 150 HR professionals who were instrumental in transforming the company into an award-winning, inclusive, and sustainable global leader.
 
 
 
 
Tamla Oates-Forney
CEO, SHRM Linkage 
Tamla Oates-Forney is the CEO of SHRM Linkage, a global leadership development firm committed to advancing women and accelerating inclusion in leaders and organizations. She is an innovative thought leader, speaker, women’s advocate, wellness champion, philanthropist, and investor. 
 
 
 
 
Anuradha Hebbar, J.D.
President, SHRM CEO Action for Inclusion & Diversity
Anuradha Hebbar is the president of SHRM CEO Action for Inclusion & Diversity. She is a strategic business leader and human capital executive with a demonstrated history of designing and executing transformational change in global, Fortune 500, midsize and private-equity-backed organizations.

Which AI App You Choose Matters Less Than Getting Really Good at How AI Works
This space will be won by those who roll their sleeves up and get to work.
Chris Zvirbulis
Mar 10
 
READ IN APP
 
The AI space moves fast.
DeepSeek is the latest name to hit the scene...
Claude has passed ChatGPT in usage...
And every week, the media is fixated on the next shiny object.
The temptation? 
Rotate between them. Chase the latest model. Get excited about each new app. Spend a bunch of time figuring out which one is "best."
But here’s the thing—these models are all pretty similar. And they always will be.
The real skill isn’t picking the best one...
It’s getting really good at how LLMs (Large Language Models) work in general.
Avoid paralysis by analysis—and simply dive in.
The Bigger Skill: Mastering the Tool
Instead of bouncing between models, invest time in building practical AI skills:
1. Learn how to prompt effectively.
The right phrasing can mean the difference between mediocre and incredible results.
Experiment. Refine. Adapt.
One example, particularly when using an AI bot for sales and marketing content?
AI is great at building a "persona" of your ideal client profile.
Tell your LLM exactly who your perfect customer is. With as much detail as possible.
Then, give it your draft marketing email or sales script...
And ask it to rip it to shreds and make it better so it connects better with the prospect you have in mind.
This takes a bit of time—all good prompting does. But it's worth it.
2. Learn how to validate AI-generated answers.
These models make mistakes—often with extreme confidence.
Knowing when to trust and when to verify is a critical skill.
An easy tip?
When it gives a stat, ask: "Where did you find that number? I need a reputable source."
It'll often apologize... and issue a correction.
3. Learn how to connect APIs and understand API billing.
Many businesses are wasting money on inefficient API calls...
Or failing to leverage integrations that could save hours of work.
This area is a bit more technical, for sure.
So if you need help, don't be afraid to "phone a friend" with some IT expertise.
4. Reimagine workflows around automation.
Instead of just using AI as a faster Google, rethink entire processes.
What can be automated? Where can AI replace, augment, or accelerate work?
If a process is being done in the same way over and over...
It's likely that AI can help.
This Will Be Won by the Doers
If we find ourselves reading about AI more than using it...
We’ve got a problem.
The advantage won’t go to the person who can name the latest models.
It will go to the person who actually knows how to use them.
So get hands-on.
Because the future belongs to those who dive in—not those who just watch.

subject: AIG to Report Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Financial Results on February 11, 2025 and Host Conference Call on February 12, 2025
body:
January 21, 2025 04:16 PM Eastern Standard Time NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--American International Group, Inc. (NYSE: AIG) will report financial results for the fourth quarter and full year ended December 31, 2024, after the market closes on Tuesday, February 11, 2025. AIG’s press release and financial supplement will be available in the Investors section of AIG’s website at 
https://www.aig.com
. AIG will also host a conference call on Wednesday, February 12, 2025, at 8:30 a.m. ET to review these results. The live, listen-only webcast is open to the public and can be accessed in the Investors section of 
https://www.aig.com
. A replay will be available after the call at the same location. About AIG American International Group, Inc. (NYSE: AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. AIG provides insurance solutions that help businesses and individuals in approximately 190 countries and jurisdictions protect their assets and manage risks through AIG operations and network partners. For additional information, visit 
www.aig.com
. This website with additional information about AIG has been provided as a convenience, and the information contained on such website is not incorporated by reference into this press release. AIG is the marketing name for the worldwide operations of American International Group, Inc. All products and services are written or provided by subsidiaries or affiliates of American International Group, Inc. Products or services may not be available in all countries and jurisdictions, and coverage is subject to underwriting requirements and actual policy language. Non-insurance products and services may be provided by independent third parties. Certain property casualty coverages may be provided by a surplus lines insurer. Surplus lines insurers do not generally participate in state guaranty funds, and insureds are therefore not protected by such funds. Contacts Quentin McMillan (Investors): 
quentin.mcmillan@aig.com
 Claire Talcott (Media): 
claire.talcott@aig.com

body:

SECURE YOUR SPOT AT SHRM25 BEFORE PRICES GO UP! Only

subject: See You May 15th at ELE's Milwaukee Talent Conference at Manpower
body:
Get ready to transform your leadership development and talent management approach with actionable insights from top professionals.
 
 
Connect With Great Minds: 
ELE Community 
  
🌟 SAVE THE DATE! 🌟 MAY 15, 2025 🌟
ELE's Talent Development Conference
at Manpower (Milwaukee, WI)
Briza, 
In today's fast-paced world, fresh ideas and time for reflection have become precious commodities. At ELE, we understand this reality, which is why our one-day program is specifically designed to allow you and your team to step back from daily routines and immerse yourselves in intensive personal and professional growth.
This year, we’re thrilled to host our Milwaukee conference at Manpower, a venue at the forefront of global workforce innovation. This location is not only centrally accessible but also renowned as a hub for pioneering talent development strategies and their impactful World of Work Research.
 
 
Join us to learn and share "best and next" practices for 'Workplace Agility in the AI Era':
Date: May 15, 2025
Agenda: 
Preview online
Location: Manpower, 100 Manpower Place, Milwaukee, WI
Explore & Sign-up:  
ELE's Conference and Registration Event
READY TO INSPIRE? 
SHARE YOUR PERSPECTIVES 
Have a practical idea that could transform the future of HR and Talent development? Your story deserves the spotlight! We're inviting you to share your vision on the ELE stage and ignite meaningful conversations with leaders in the field - @ 
#ELEWISE2025
Embrace this unique opportunity to engage with thought leaders and peers who are shaping the future of our industry by connecting with
 
 
Dirk Tussing
. 
Register today and be part of the conversation that drives real change. 
🚀
 
The Power Of ELE
Want to understand the power of ELE’s collective intelligence with forward-thinking peers?
Schedule a walk-through
 
 
 
 
 
 
Access Our On-Demand Talent Solutions
Our 
ELE Insights
 lets you learn on-demand from your peers either on your computer or mobile devices. Slides, podcasts, videos and more! Here are links to the four most recent events with post-sharing multimedia recordings.
Strategic Re-skilling: Explore How AI is Transforming Workforce Capabilities
Microlearning in the AI Age: Building Adaptive, Personalized Learning Experiences
AI Practical Lab: Building a High-Performance Coaching Assistant
Strategic DEI Reimagined: From Employee Groups to Business Impact in 2025 and Beyond
 
UPCOMING EVENTS & LIVE DISCUSSIONS
These sessions feature experts sharing the latest research and insights on navigating leadership challenges, leveraging AI, and boosting retention
. 
Register now
 
to secure your spot!
 
Explore Upcoming Events | Fresh Ideas & Discussions
 
 
It's time to add our ELE Meetup events to your agenda.
      
Mar 19: 
ELE Chicagoland Meetup | Arlington Heights
 
Connect with fellow colleagues in an engaging conversation where Talent Development Innovation Meets Practice.
Grab a co-worker, and we'll see you at Cooper's Hawk Winery & Restaurants
 
Why Invest Your Time and Energy in ELE?
Stay Ahead of the Curve:
 ELE’s hybrid shift is a strategic breakthrough that aligns with the future of work. Gain insights from our community to stay ahead of talent development trends.
Expand Your Network: 
Connect with like-minded professionals, exchange ideas, and build a network that transcends borders. The power of collaboration within our trusted community is limitless.
Get Practical Tips and Tools:
 Receive actionable takeaways for enhancing your talent development initiatives. ELE’s journey provides practical tips and tools for immediate implementation.
WE’RE ALWAYS READY TO ANSWER.
Questions? Please contact 
help@ele.llc
 or 
book time with me
.
Our goal is to exceed your expectations with our Brand Promise.
Connect and Share for Stronger Business Impact
Learn new skills and explore talent development capabilities through ELE’s HR platform of peer-shared insights, for improved business performance.

subject: Triton Digital Releases the October 2024 U.S. Podcast Ranker
body:
NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Triton Digital®, the global technology and services provider to the digital audio, podcast, and broadcast radio industries, announced today the release of its October 2024 reporting period (September 30, 2024 – November 3, 2024), U.S. Podcast Ranker, as measured by Triton’s Podcast Metrics measurement service. iHeart Audience Network earned the #1 spot again on the Top Sales Networks Report for the month of October, with 68.7M Average Weekly Downloads and 19.3M Average Weekly Users. NPR came in at #2 with 25.3M Average Weekly Downloads and 6.7M Average Weekly Users, followed by Wondery at #3 with 20.2M Average Weekly Downloads and 7.0M Average Weekly Users. For this reporting period, the top three podcasts based on downloads included NPR News Now (NPR) again at #1, Up First (NPR) again at #2, and The Dan Bongino Show (Cumulus Podcast Network) climbing to #3. For listeners, the top three podcasts included NPR News Now (NPR) again at #1, Up First (NPR) climbing to #2, and Morbid (Wondery) climbing to #3. There were several debuts for the month of October including Kill List (Wondery), Wiser Than Me with Julia Louis-Dreyfus (Lemonada Media), The Colin Cowherd Podcast (iHeart Audience Network), Two Girls One Ghost (Audioboom), The Political Scene | The New Yorker (Soundrise/PRX) and more debuting for both downloads and listeners. Club 520 Podcast (iHeart Audience Network), Welcome to Night Vale (Soundrise/PRX), Greg Laurie Podcast (Harvest Christian Fellowship), Felger & Massarotti (Beasley Media Group), Search Engine (Audacy Podcast Network), Car Talk (NPR) and more debuted for downloads. All The Smoke (iHeart Audience Network), The NoSleep Podcast (Audioboom), Make Me Smart (American Public Media Group), True Crime All The Time (Wondery), Dave & Chuck the Freak: Full Show (Beasley Media Group) and more debuted for listeners. In October we welcomed a new network to the U.S. Podcast Ranker—Lemonada Media. This reporting period does not include SiriusXM data. The publisher’s inclusion in last month’s ranker concluded its appearance in Triton’s monthly Podcast Ranker, which organizations can choose to opt-in to make their listenership insights available to the public. The Top Sales Network Reports are ranked by Average Weekly Downloads and Average Weekly Users in accordance with v2.1 of the IAB Podcast Technical Measurement Guidelines. Participating Sales Networks include content owners/creators and sales representation organizations. Certified by the IAB Tech Lab, Triton’s Podcast Metrics eliminates inconsistent measurement practices and self-reported data, providing content creators, marketers, media buyers, and the audio industry at large with validated and transparent podcast audience data. Any sales network or publisher with an audience in the United States is eligible to participate in the U.S. Podcast Report. To learn more, contact: 
solutions@tritondigital.com
. About Triton Digital Triton Digital® is the global technology and services leader to the digital audio, podcast, and broadcast radio industries. Operating in more than 80 countries, Triton provides innovative technology that enables broadcasters, podcasters, and online music services to build their audience, maximize revenue, and streamline their day-to-day operations. In addition, Triton powers the global online audio industry with Webcast Metrics®, the leading streaming audio measurement service and Podcast Metrics, one of the first IAB certified podcast measurement services in the industry. With unparalleled integrity, excellence, teamwork, and accountability, Triton remains committed to connecting audio, audience, and advertisers to continuously fuel the growth of the global audio industry. For more information, visit 
www.TritonDigital.com
. Contacts For more information, press only: Moxie Communications Group for Triton Digital 
tritondigital@moxiegrouppr.com

Terms and Conditions
1. Earn 130,000 Hilton Honors Bonus Points and One Free Night Reward
You can earn 130,000 Hilton Honors Bonus Points and one Free Night Reward from Hilton Honors after you spend $3,000 (the "Threshold Amount") on eligible purchases on your Card in your first 6 months of Card Membership starting from the date that your account is opened. Eligible purchases include those made by both the Basic and Additional Card Members on the Card Account. Eligible purchases are purchases for goods and services minus returns and other credits. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchase of traveler’s checks, purchase or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or other cash equivalents. Additional Card Members on your account are not eligible for this offer. To receive Bonus Points, your Card account must not be cancelled or past due at the time of fulfillment. Hilton Honors Bonus Points will be credited to your Hilton Honors account 8-12 weeks after the Threshold Amount has been reached. Bonus Points do not count toward elite tier qualification; for more information, visit 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
.
The Free Night Reward will be issued in the form of a redeemable code and sent in an email from Hilton Honors to the email address listed on your Hilton Honors account up to 16 weeks after the Threshold Amount has been reached. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchase of traveler's checks, purchase or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or other cash equivalents. Eligible purchases are purchases for goods and services minus returns and other credits. To receive the Hilton Honors Free Night Reward, your Card Account must not be cancelled or past due at the time of fulfillment. The Free Night Reward can be redeemed any night of the week for a one night standard accommodation, double occupancy, subject to availability at properties in the Hilton portfolio, excluding those listed at 
HiltonHonors.com/freenightreward
. To redeem the Free Night Reward, you must call 1-800-446-6677. Free Night Rewards will expire 12 months from date of issuance. The Free Night Reward will be forfeited if not redeemed for a stay on or before the expiration date. To ensure receipt of the reward e-mail notification, you should confirm the correct email address is listed on your Hilton Honors account profile. You can also check your Hilton Honors account for the status of a Free Night Reward issued to you (including the expiration date) by calling 1-800-446-6677. The Free Night Reward is not transferable and may not be redeemed for cash or Hilton Honors Points. The Free Night Reward may be combined with other Hilton or Free Night promotions in market and may be added to existing paid or Reward stays. The Free Night Reward includes all applicable resort fees and taxes on the cost of the room for the redeemed night. The Card Member is responsible for all incidental charges. The Free Night Reward may be subject to additional policies from Hilton Honors; for more information, visit 
https://www.Hilton.com/en/p/promotions/free-night-terms/.
If you have a history of canceling or downgrading American Express Card accounts within your first year and you cancel or downgrade your new Card account within your first year, we may not credit, we may freeze, or we may take away the Hilton Honors Bonus Points and one Free Night Reward from your account. If we determine that you have engaged in abuse, misuse, or gaming in connection with this offer in any way or that you intend to do so, including if you return purchases you made to meet the Threshold Amount, we may not credit, we may freeze, or we may take away the Hilton Honors Bonus Points and one Free Night Reward from your account. We may also cancel any accounts you have with us.
This offer is not transferable. If your application is not received by 4/29/2025, we will not process your application even if we later receive your application. American Express reserves the right to modify or revoke offer at any time.
2. Hilton Honors Bonus Points on Eligible Purchases
Hilton Honors Bonus Points earned using your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card: 
You will receive 3 Hilton Honors Bonus Points for each dollar of eligible purchases.
You will receive 9 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points, for a total of 12, for each dollar of eligible purchases charged directly with a property within the Hilton portfolio, including bookings and incidental charges. To receive the 9 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for charges made at the time of booking, the booking must be made directly through a reservation channel operated by Hilton. You can receive the 9 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for incidental charges made at the hotel (including charges made at restaurants, spas, and other establishments) if those charges can be and are charged to your room and paid for with your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card at checkout.
You will receive 3 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points, for a total of 6, for each dollar of eligible purchases at the following categories of merchants excluding superstores and warehouse clubs: restaurants located in the U.S., supermarkets located in the U.S. and on gasoline at gas stations located in the U.S.
To get additional Points for a restaurant purchase, the purchase must be at a restaurant located in the United States. You will NOT get additional Points for purchases made at a restaurant owned by a U.S. company but located outside the U.S. (e.g. Hard Rock Café in Paris). You also will NOT get additional Points for restaurant purchases at nightclubs, convenience stores, grocery stores, or supermarkets. You may not get additional Points for purchases at a restaurant located within another establishment (e.g. a restaurant inside a hotel, casino, or event venue). For example, purchases made at a restaurant located within a hotel may be recognized as a purchase at a hotel, not a restaurant.
You will receive 1 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Point, for a total of 4, for each dollar of eligible online retail purchases made on a website or a digital application (an app) from a U.S. retail merchant that sells physical goods or merchandise directly to consumers. To identify eligible online retail purchases, we rely on information provided to us by the merchant. The following are not considered retail purchases: purchases made at restaurants, supermarkets, gasoline stations, or automotive dealers, as well as purchases of travel, entertainment, or other services. Payment must be made online and categorized as an internet transaction by the merchant for the purchase to be eligible. You will not receive additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for purchases made online but paid for in store. Payments made in store using a mobile or digital wallet or a contactless payment device are not considered online purchases. You will not receive additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for purchases made by phone or mail, or by using a third party "buy now pay later" installment program.  
Your Hilton Honors Points are subject to Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions; see 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
. 
Eligible purchases are purchases for goods and services minus returns and other credits. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchases of travelers checks, purchases or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or purchases of other cash equivalents. Hilton Honors Bonus Points you earn with your Card will be posted to your Hilton Honors account up to 12 weeks after the end of your billing period.
Purchases made through a third-party payment account or on an online marketplace (with multiple retailers) will not receive additional points.
Merchants are assigned codes based on what they primarily sell. We group certain merchant codes into categories that are eligible for additional Points. A purchase with a merchant will not receive additional Points if the merchant’s code is not included in a reward category. You may not receive additional Points if we receive inaccurate information or are otherwise unable to identify your purchase as eligible for a reward category. For example, you may not receive additional Points when: a merchant uses a third-party to sell their products or services; or a merchant uses a third-party to process or submit your transaction to us (e.g., using mobile or wireless card readers); or you choose to make a purchase using a third-party payment account or make a purchase using a mobile or digital wallet.
Please visit 
americanexpress.com/rewards-info
 for more information about rewards.
 
3. Hilton Honors Complimentary Gold Status
You will receive complimentary Hilton Honors Gold status with your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card. Please allow up to 12 weeks from account open date for your complimentary Gold status to be applied to your Hilton Honors account. Complimentary Gold status benefit is only available to the Basic Card Member. If your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card is cancelled for any reason, your complimentary Hilton Honors Gold status provided with the Card will be cancelled. American Express reserves the right to change, modify or revoke complimentary Gold status at any time. If your complimentary Gold status is cancelled, you may be able to maintain your Gold status by qualifying under the Hilton Honors Program terms. Gold status benefits are subject to availability and vary by hotel. For more information on Gold status benefits or how to maintain Gold status each year with qualifying stays, nights or Hilton Honors Base Points through the Hilton Honors Program, visit 
HiltonHonors.com/MemberBenefits
, 
Hilton.com/en/Hilton-Honors/benefit-terms/
, 
HiltonHonors.com/SLHTerms
, and 
HiltonHonors.com/AutoCampTerms
. The Hilton Honors Program, including the benefits of Hilton Honors Membership, are subject to Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions; see 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
.
4. Hilton Honors Free Night Reward
Basic Card Members can receive a Free Night Reward from Hilton Honors after the total eligible purchases on their Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card account reach $15,000 in a calendar year. The Free Night Reward will be issued in the form of a redeemable code and sent to the Basic Card Member in an email from Hilton Honors to the email address listed on their Hilton Honors account. The Basic Card Member will receive the Reward email within 8-12 weeks after meeting the purchase requirement. This benefit is only available to the Basic Card Member; however, eligible purchases made by Additional Card Members will contribute to the purchase requirement.
Eligible purchases to meet the purchase requirement are for goods and services minus returns and other credits. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchases of travelers checks, purchases or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or other cash equivalents. If you transfer to a different Hilton Honors American Express Card that has a Free Night Reward benefit, any eligible purchases you made on your old Card Account will count toward the new Card Account’s Free Night Reward purchase requirement, after your first transaction on the new Card Account.
The Free Night Reward can be redeemed for one standard accommodation, double occupancy, subject to availability, at properties in the Hilton portfolio, excluding those listed at 
HiltonHonors.com/freenightreward
. 
To redeem the Free Night Reward, Basic Card Members must call 1-800-446-6677 and mention the code provided by Hilton Honors. A Free Night Reward expires one year from the date of issuance and must be redeemed on or before the expiration date. A Free Night Reward will be forfeited if not redeemed on or before the expiration date.
To ensure receipt of the Free Night Reward e-mail notification, confirm the correct email address is listed on your Hilton Honors account profile. To view the status of any Free Night Rewards issued to you, visit your Hilton Honors Account Dashboard at 
HiltonHonors.com
. 
The Free Night Reward is not transferable and may not be redeemed for cash or Hilton Honors Points. A Free Night Reward may be combined with other Hilton or Free Night promotions in market and may be added to existing paid or Reward stays. A Free Night Reward includes all applicable resort fees and taxes on the cost of the room for the redeemed night at all locations except for a tourism tax at properties located in Malaysia. The Card Member is responsible for all incidental charges and, if applicable, the Malaysian tourism tax. Free Night Reward redemptions may be cancelled pursuant to the Free Night Reward cancellation policy on the Hilton Honors Program website (
HiltonHonors.com
). 
Free Night Rewards are subject to Hilton Terms and Conditions, available at 
https://www.hilton.com/en/p/promotions/free-night-terms/
.
5. $200 Hilton Statement Credit
Basic Hilton Honors American Express Surpass Card Members can receive up to a total of $50 in statement credits each calendar quarter (January through March, April through June, July through September, and October through December), for up to $200 back annually, for eligible purchases charged directly with a property within the Hilton portfolio on their Card Account, including bookings and incidental charges. For a booking to be eligible for a statement credit, the booking must be made directly through a reservation channel operated by Hilton. Bookings or purchases made through a third party other than Hilton, such as an online travel website, will not be eligible for statement credit(s). At certain hotels, if your booking is part of a contract for an event, the purchase may not be eligible for a statement credit. For an incidental charge (including charges made at restaurants, spas, and other establishments within the hotel property) to be eligible for a statement credit, the incidental charge must be charged to your room and paid for with your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass Card at checkout.
Eligible purchases can be made by both the Basic and any Additional Card Members on the Card Account. However, the total amount of statement credits for eligible purchases will not exceed $200 per Card Account per calendar year. Please allow 8-12 weeks after the eligible purchase is charged to your Card Account for statement credit(s) to be posted to the Account. Please call American Express at the number on the back of your Card if statement credits have not posted after 12 weeks from the date of purchase. To receive this benefit, your Card account must not be cancelled or past due at the time of statement credit fulfillment. Statement credit(s) may not be received or may be reversed if the purchase is cancelled or modified, or if you engage in abuse or misuse in connection with the benefit.
American Express relies on the merchant’s processing of transactions to determine the transaction date. The transaction date may differ from the date you made the purchase if, for example, there is a delay in the merchant submitting the transaction to us or if the merchant uses another date as the transaction date. This means that in some cases your purchase may not earn the statement credit benefit for the benefit period in which you made the purchase. For example, if an eligible purchase is made on December 31st but the merchant processes the transaction such that it is identified to us as occurring on January 1st, the January statement credit would be applied. American Express also relies on information provided to us by the merchant to identify eligible purchases. If American Express does not receive information that identifies your transaction as eligible for this benefit, the Basic Card Member will not receive the statement credit. For example, your purchase will not be eligible if it is not made directly with Hilton (e.g., if a purchase is made at a restaurant or convenience store within a Hilton property). Basic Card Members may not receive the statement credit if we receive inaccurate information or are otherwise unable to identify your purchase as eligible, if a transaction is made with an electronic wallet or through a third party (such as an app store), or if the merchant uses a mobile or wireless card reader to process it.

subject: Micropep Technologies Strengthens Leadership Team with CBO Appointment
body: Micropep Technologies, with operations in the US and France, is a global leader in breakthrough micropeptide technology. The company has developed a proprietary AI-powered discovery platform for micropeptides, which are short protein molecules naturally produced by plant cells and have an infinite number of applications. Micropep is building the next generation of natural solutions addressing global challenges in multiple markets, with a key focus in agriculture.

subject: A Legendary Waterfront Venue Awaits!
body:
Host Your Next Event in Style at Pier Sixty-Six 
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Discover Pier Sixty-Six - Fort Lauderdale’s premier destination for unforgettable events
About
  |  
Global Sales Team
  |  
Collection  
|  
Update Preferences
A Waterfront Icon for Unforgettable Events
Collection Spotlight
Allow Us to Introduce 
Pier Sixty-Six 
Pier Sixty-Six Resort, a legendary waterfront destination in Fort Lauderdale, offers an extraordinary setting for meetings and events. With a prime location along the Intracoastal Waterway, the resort boasts 40,000 square feet of versatile indoor and outdoor event spaces, including a stunning grand ballroom, elegant meeting rooms, and picturesque waterfront venues. Attendees can take in breathtaking marina views while enjoying world-class service and modern amenities, making every gathering truly memorable.
Pier Sixty-Six also offers unique team-building experiences that embrace its coastal setting. Groups can enjoy custom culinary experiences led by top chefs or unwind with rejuvenating spa treatments inspired by the sea. If you're hosting a corporate conference, a social gathering, or a wellness retreat, Pier Sixty-Six Resort combines exceptional service, world-class amenities, and breathtaking surroundings to create unforgettable events.
REACH OUT FOR AVAILABILE DATES
 
Featured Review
"This is a great event hotel with lots of banquet space. 
They do an excellent job with events from small to very large. The location is directly on the Intracoastal Waterway and there is an adjacent marina with huge luxury yachts. If you get a drink out in the marina bar, you can watch lots of boats coming and going."
- Gina S on Google
Coastal Cuisine in the Heart of Fort Lauderdale
Calusso offers a refined dining experience that celebrates the flavors of the sea with an elegant waterfront ambiance. Inspired by coastal Italian and Mediterranean influences, the menu showcases fresh seafood, handcrafted pastas, and artfully composed dishes. Start with enticing appetizers like Tuna Carpaccio, Wood-Fired Oysters, or Charred Spanish Octopus. Indulge in signature entrées such as the Whole Branzino, Lobster Tagliatelle, or the decadent Wagyu Striploin. For a shareable delight, the Seafood Tower offers an impressive selection of the ocean’s finest. With a thoughtfully curated wine list and expertly crafted cocktails, Calusso delivers an unforgettable culinary journey.
At a Glance
ACCOMMODATIONS 
| Pier Sixty-Six Resort offers 325 luxurious waterfront guest rooms with modern amenities and stunning views of the Intracoastal Waterway. Each elegantly designed guest room and suite provides a serene retreat with sophisticated coastal-inspired décor.
MEETING SPACE
 | 40,000 square feet of flexible event space, including a grand ballroom, intimate meeting rooms, and stunning waterfront venues. With state-of-the-art technology and breathtaking marina views, Pier Sixty-Six is the perfect setting for conferences, corporate gatherings, and social events.
TEAM BUILDING
 | Engage in unique team-building experiences such as luxury yacht charters, private marina excursions, and rejuvenating wellness activities at Zenova Spa. Designed to foster collaboration and relaxation, these activities create memorable group experiences.
DINING
 | Pier Sixty-Six Resort features three exceptional dining options, from upscale waterfront dining to casual poolside bites. Guests can savor fresh seafood, expertly crafted cocktails, and innovative cuisine, all while enjoying spectacular marina views.
LOCATION
 | Ideally situated in the heart of Fort Lauderdale, Pier Sixty-Six Resort offers direct access to the Intracoastal Waterway, just minutes from pristine beaches, world-class shopping, and Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport.
FIVE-SECOND CONTACT FORM

188 Inverness Dr W UNIT 300,
Englewood, CO 80112

Gate Check 
Destinations that’ll bring you to your knees. 
Literally. We clocked in on the top places that offer a romantic backdrop to your proposal. Whether on a rooftop terrace or overlooking a fjord, here’s where you should go to set the vibe. 
Say I do 
Cue the romantic backdrop. 
 
 
Ireland: Cliffs of Moher.
 
For those in the #5AMClub, hike out early in the morning when it’s quiet and you’re less likely to run into other proposing couples (awkward).
An bposfaidh tu me?
 
 
Germany: Neuschwanstein Castle.
 
You may be planning for your Cinderella moment but the spot you want isn’t the ballroom: it’s the Marienbrücke bridge in the height of fall.
Willst due mich heiraten?
 
 
New York City: Central Park.
 
It’s a classic for a reason. Head to the Bow Bridge for a beautiful spot overlooking the park’s boating lake. Don’t forget your picnic.
Will you marry me?
 
 
Iceland: Underneath the Northern Lights.
 
There’s really no better backdrop than nature’s lightshow. When planning your trip, give yourself time as it may take a few attempts to see the lights.
Viltu giftast mér?

body:
Leading Project Teams for Non-Project Managers
 
Live Webinar
: March 19, 2025 | 60 minutes
 
Leading project teams can be exciting, challenging, and complex! If you’re looking for practical strategies to manage and motivate teams effectively, this session is for you. Learn actionable techniques to navigate team leadership without formal authority and foster an environment of inclusion and collaboration.
This session will introduce essential leadership skills tailored for professionals who find themselves managing project teams, even without a project manager title. You will explore communication tools, organization methods, and best practices to ensure project success.
Reserve Your Spot for This Webinar →
Your Benefits of Attending:
Gain a clear understanding of project team structures and how to align team roles effectively.
Learn to lead teams without formal authority and inspire collaboration.

MIDNIGHT 
OIL
EDITION 294
RESOURCES & TIPS
 
What to know about tariffs impacting small businesses
We talked to small businesses around the country to hear their thoughts on impending tariffs on imported goods. Business owners say tariffs will impact their ability to grow and hire and are already making them less profitable. 
Find out how business owners like you
 are strategizing to handle potential cost increases and maintain competitiveness in their industries. 
  
6 accounting tasks to complete quarterly
Running a small business? Dedicate time each quarter to 
these six key accounting tasks
 to maintain a clear financial picture, identify potential issues early, and be well-prepared for tax season.
  
[RECAP] A masterclass for a changing business landscape
At our latest virtual event, Saeju Jeong, Co-Founder and Executive Chairman of Noom, shared insightful strategies for navigating business transformations. 
Watch the full event replay
 to see how businesses can build stronger brands and adapt to shifting market dynamics.
  
A MESSAGE FROM FEDEX
 
Budget-Friendly Shipping Options for Your Business
Make your shipping easier and more affordable with FedEx One Rate* — the option that lets you know the price upfront. Plus, save up to 42% on shipments within the U.S. when you join the free FedEx Advantage* program. Learn more and get started today!
‌
*Limitations may apply. Discounts are off list rates.
Start Saving
 
  
QUOTABLE MOMENT
“Thought leadership is more than a marketing strategy—it's a comprehensive approach to building influence, fostering connection, and creating lasting impact in your industry. By sharing valuable insights consistently, you not only elevate your brand but contribute to the collective growth of your professional community.”
— Ashley Graham, Founder of The Conscious Publicist, 
encourages businesses to embrace thought leadership to elevate their industry presence
.
CO— SURVEY
 
Have you taken our reader survey?
To best serve you with relevant content and events, we'd love to gain insight into your business needs. Want ideas on how to market your business? Looking for resources to simplify processes? Take our brief reader survey (it should take no more than five minutes) to tell us more about your business, and 
enter to win a $100 Amazon gift card
!
Take the Survey
 
  
BY THE NUMBERS
  
5
Embarking on a real estate career can be highly rewarding, especially as market demands and home sale prices rise. To get started, 
consider these five steps
 to launch your own real estate business and elevate your professional journey.
  
$1M+
Discover how Supercuts, PuroClean, and Urban Air Adventure Park franchise entrepreneurs 
successfully built multimillion-dollar businesses
 by leveraging strategic growth, exceptional service, and consistent branding.
  
68%
Research indicates that nearly three-quarters of coworking space members report better focus and improved productivity. If you’re contemplating a coworking space for yourself or your team, 
use this guide
 to understand how these spaces operate and their benefits.
  
GRANTS & AWARDS
The 
Comcast Innovation Fund
 is accepting applications for the 2025 grant year, providing financial support ranging from $3,000 to $150,000 for projects with a one-year duration that advance internet technology and public policy. The 
grant deadline is rolling
 until the funds for the year are exhausted.
‌
The 
U.S. Department of Education (DOE)
 has various grants available to small businesses in the education sector. Each grant has unique eligibility criteria, with some opportunities set aside for public schools, state agencies, or nonprofit organizations; however, others allow applications from for-profit private sector companies. Deadlines for currently available DOE grants run through 
March 17
.
‌
Honeycomb Credit is offering a 
$10,000 Breakthrough Grant
 to support small businesses in achieving their next big milestone, such as opening a new location, launching a food truck, or franchising. Eligible applicants must own a small business; no purchase or payment is required to apply. Applications are due 
April 2
.
‌
The 
Rémy Martin This is My City Microgrant
 is awarding $20,000 grants along with one-on-one mentorship from industry experts to emerging creatives who contribute to their local culture through entrepreneurial projects. Chosen candidates will be recognized as honorees and receive guidance from established figures in music, art, or culture. Applications are due by 
April 11
.
‌
More grant & program information can be found 
here
.
