subject: We’d love to hear your feedback
body:
Hi Briza,
 
As someone who knows Spoonful of Comfort, you’re invited to be part of a select group of customer voices. We value your experience with us and would love your thoughts on something special we’re working on—a potential subscription program!
 
Our care packages and gifting services are directly influenced by what our customers tell us. So your input about this possible program will help us shape it into something truly meaningful.
 
If you would like to participate, thank you! The 8-question survey will take just a few minutes to complete. To show our appreciation, you’ll be entered to win a free soup package and be among the first to hear about the program when it launches.
 
Your feedback means the world to us—thank you for helping us create something wonderful.
 
Take the Quick Survey
You received this email from Spoonful Of Comfort. If you would like to unsubscribe, 
click here
.

subject: Why We Started GrowthRise
body:
Our new mastermind group for B2B Sales & Marketing leaders is launching this week. Apply by March 11.  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
March 05, 2025   |   
Read Online
Why We Started GrowthRise 
Our new mastermind group for B2B Sales & Marketing leaders is launching this week. Apply by March 11. 
 
Our new mastermind group for B2B Sales & Marketing leaders is launching this week.
Hi Briza —
Hey it’s Ryan Allis. Hello from Austin, TX.‍ 
After 18 months of scaling 
SaasRise
 to 500 members (all SaaS CEOs and Founders), this week we are launching
 GrowthRise
, the mastermind community for B2B Sales & Marketing Leaders. 
GrowthRise is a mastermind community for all the revenue-facing leaders inside a B2B company.‍ Here we’re focused on the full revenue lifecycle from awareness to acquisition to expansion. 
SaasRise = For SaaS CEOs & Founders
GrowthRise = For B2B Sales & Marketing Leaders 
So send your CMO, CRO, Head of Marketing, Head of Growth, Head of Sales (or even your growth-focused founder) – and we’ll take good care of them. 
This is an inner circle – just for 
B2B Sales & Marketing Leaders
 who are focused on rapid growth and building predictable revenue machines. — where we help each other grow faster. 
» 
Apply to join us today
 by 
Tuesday, March 11
All your revenue-focused teams working together to scale rapidly. That’s what we’ll help train you and your team how to do through our community and masterminds. 
Apply to Join GrowthRise 
Why Did We Start GrowthRise?
We wanted to build a community that was pushing the boundaries and on the leading edge of AI-driven digital sales and marketing, from ABM list building to outbound and paid ads that make your brand omnipresent within your ICP – to scaling up your SDR, AE, and CSM teams to build a revenue powerhouse and pass that $10M, $100M, and even $1B revenue milestone. 
I’m a huge fan of Napoleon Hill’s business mastermind concept. 
I’ve seen SaasRise grow rapidly from 0 to 500 members over the last 18 months — and I’ve witnessed firsthand just how powerful a community of experienced peers is in helping a company implement the latest revenue growth techniques. 
I see the power of niche mastermind communities to spread critical knowledge and expand your business growth. 
Before founding
 GrowthRise
 and
 SaasRise
, I was the CEO and co-founder of an email marketing software company called iContact for ten years. 
I founded iContact while in college at UNC-Chapel Hill in 2002. We were one of the first SaaS email marketing platforms in the world. Over the next ten years, we built iContact to $50M+ in annual revenues, 300 employees, and 70,000 paying customers. We scaled up to a 75 person sales, marketing, and success team. 
It was quite a ride. We exited iContact in 2012 for $169 million to a public company. 
After that I did a two year MBA at Harvard Business School as I wanted to learn how just how to be an entrepreneur but how to scale larger companies. Now, over the last decade I’ve been coaching CEOs and helping B2B firms scale up revenue from $5M to $200M in ARR. 
Today, I'm 40 and a dad living in Austin with my family. And I'm focused professionally on building mastermind communities that help companies grow like
 SaasRise
 and now
 GrowthRise
. 
At iContact we were constantly innovating with our GTM approach – and we acquired 70,000 customers because of our inner circle of sales and marketing experts who helped us dominate our niche. 
Because of what I went through in the process of building iContact and SaasRise, I knew a community like this was needed. 
If you’re wanting to grow quickly – you need to be using the latest GTM and RevOps strategies for outbound, inbound, content creation, profitable paid ads, and sales and success team structure and scaling. It’s as simple as that. 
And that’s why this week we are launching GrowthRise. 
Who's Invited to Join GrowthRise?
All B2B Sales & Marketing Leaders
 (including growth focused-founders) are invited to join. 
We don’t do B2C here – just B2B sales and marketing. 
My companies have done over $600M in online sales so far → all because of great products and great teams combined with great sales and marketing. 
How we’ve done it is by surrounding ourselves with great peer marketing leaders who always keep us on the leading edge.‍ 
To keep my knowledge fresh, I created and show up weekly to this GrowthRise mastermind. 
And I’ve recruited some of the best revenue leaders and marketers out there into GrowthRise to help each other grow. 
Now you can
 apply to join us
 too. 
Inside, you’ll find some of the most talented B2B marketers and sales leaders in the world, sharing their secrets and best scaling systems and processes techniques privately. 
I wanted to form a group of sales heads, marketing leaders and growth experts who could support each other in achieving one thing: faster revenue growth. 
I decided to build a community of CROs, Heads of Sales, CMOs, Heads of Marketing, Heads of Growth, Success Leaders, and even Growth-focused founders who would support each other through the unique process of growing and scaling their revenues – and the unique mental and health challenges that come along with being a GTM leader. 
That's why I've built this community: To create a growth mastermind community you can turn to when making the key growth decisions. 
A community that saves you a lot of time and a lot of money as you go about staying on the edge of what works. 
When you join GrowthRise you’ll have immediate access to the entire community and all of our growth resources. You'll see all the posts, forums, past webinars, Slack group, WhatsApp channel, and our member directory. 
Plus, you'll be invited to join our optional weekly peer masterminds designed to help you grow faster and solve the challenges you’re currently facing. 
So if you're committed (yes, actually committed) to your success and are willing to show up to support your fellow community members, come join us. 
It takes about 90 seconds to apply… 
With one small action forward by applying right now, your path to faster predictable revenue growth begins. Let’s go. 
‍High five from Austin TX.‍ 
Carpe diem and I’ll see you inside. 
So send your Sales & Marketing leaders to join us at 
www.growthrise.com
 and we'll take good care of them!
All the best,
Ryan Allis
CEO & Founder
SaasRise
 & 
GrowthRise
P.S. - If you'd like your head of marketing or sales to join, please have them apply at 
www.growthrise.com
 by March 11
. The cost to join the group is $97/month (for the first 50 members who join), with a 30 day free trial. I will personally be facilitating the Tuesday 2pm ET mastermind calls.
Here's 
an overview video
 from me…
An overview of our new mastermind community for B2B Sales & Marketing Leaders
Watch the Overview Video 
Apply to Join GrowthRise 
  
About The Author
Ryan Allis is the founder of 
SaasRise
, the mastermind community for growth-focused SaaS CEOs & Founders with $1M-$100M in ARR and 
GrowthRise
, the community for B2B Sales & Marketing leaders. He is a three time INC 500 CEO. He was previously CEO of iContact and grew the firm as founder/CEO to 70,000 customers, 1 million users, 300 employees, $50M per year in sales, and an exit for $169M to Vocus (NASDAQ:VOCS). 
Since the sale of iContact, Ryan has been the CEO coach to high-growth B2B firms including Instantly, Tatango, Seamless.ai, Pipeline, Datalyse, Green Packet, Revenue Accelerator, Galleon, Clearstream, YouCanBookMe, Retreaver, and EventMobi. Ryan has been part of the EO, YPO, and Summit Series communities.
He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School, where he was Co-President of the Social Enterprise Club and a member of the Harvard Graduate School Leadership Institute. He’s passionate about helping B2B firms grow and exit.
We’ll see you next week with more great SaaS growth and scaling content!

Nosara, Guanacaste 50206, Costa Rica

We don't just help you recognize employees- we help you know them
­
Hey, 
Briza
!
 
We know sometimes it's hard to find the exact right words. 
 
Here's some meaningful things to say to your employees this week on Employee Appreciation Day specifically tailored to your Core Values.
 
💙 Innovation.
 "Your 
creativity and bold thinking
 push us forward in ways big and small. Every idea you share, every problem you solve, and every risk you take helps us grow. Thank you for embracing the challenge of innovation and shaping the future with your brilliance."
 
💙 Collaboration.
 "The way you 
support each other
, lift each other up, and tackle challenges together is what makes this team special. Your willingness to collaborate, listen, and share makes us stronger than we could ever be alone. Thank you for being a team that truly works as one."
 
💙 Growth.
 "
Every challenge is an opportunity
, and this team never backs down from learning, evolving, and improving. Your curiosity, resilience, and drive to grow make all the difference. Thank you for pushing yourselves and each other to be better every day."
⚡ Did you know? 
Employees rate their recognition experience 35% better if it's accompanied by a thoughtful sentiment.
 
💙 Integrity. "
Team, your 
unwavering commitment to doing what’s right
—no matter how tough—sets the foundation for everything we accomplish. Your integrity builds trust, fuels our success, and makes this a place we can all be proud of. Thank you for staying true to our values every day."
 
💙 Excellence. "
Your 
dedication to doing great work
—no matter the obstacle—is inspiring. You never settle, always striving to improve, refine, and raise the bar. Because of you, excellence isn’t just a goal here; it’s our standard. Thank you for giving your best, every day."
 
💙 Resilience. 
"The way this team faces challenges—with 
optimism, grit, and a belief in each other
—is nothing short of inspiring. Your resilience keeps us moving forward, no matter what. Thank you for bringing your energy, your heart, and your unwavering spirit."
 
 
Need an easy way to nail this? We got you.
Employee Appreciation Day is Friday, March 7
Pre-Schedule Your EAD Gifts 
 
With joy,
­
PS: Interested in more bespoke recognition solutions for your team? 
Talk to us!
­

 ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏ ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏  ﻿͏
Dear Friends,
In these times of social challenges, the Institute for Racial Justice (IRJ) continues to bridge gaps between scholarly insight and community transformation, aligning with Loyola University Chicago's Jesuit, Catholic mission which demands that all Ramblers contribute to the expansion of knowledge in the service of humanity through learning, justice, and faith. The talented team at IRJ—our staff, students, postdoctoral fellows, faculty affiliates, and community partners—brings diverse expertise and a shared commitment to justice, which fuels everything we do. Our collective work remains focused on fulfilling Loyola’s mission which calls us to advance justice by connecting relevant research to partner-driven action. 
This edition of IRJ newsletter offers a snapshot of our approach to racial justice, from Dr. Vincent Singleton's compelling documentary on Richard Hunt's monument to Ida B.Wells to Dr. Gilbert Michaud and his rigorous approach to researching environmental issues, our scholars' exploration of critical issues and policies affecting marginalized communities speaks to IRJ's scholarly breadth and depth. Our research is not reserved for the ivory tower as it directly engages with the community, as shown by our Faculty Mixer, Racial Justice Salon, and Black History Month panel. 
We are particularly proud of Jessica Brown, whose humility and transparency are an important aspect of social justice work. Also, as the newly appointed co-leader of the Chicagoland Chapter of the Scholars Strategy Network, I'm excited about our expanded potential to connect IRJ research with other scholars across Chicago and surrounding areas in support of meaningful policy change. 
In this moment of complexity, our interdisciplinary approach is more crucial than ever. By helping our partners turn research into action, we continue to create pathways toward a more just and equitable society. I invite you to explore the rich content in this newsletter and join us in our ongoing mission of transformative research and community empowerment. 
Sincerely,
Malik S. Henfield, PhD  
Founding Dean and Full Professor  
Institute for Racial Justice
 
Here’s some research by our faculty affiliates and postdoctoral fellows, tackling critical issues like climate justice, political displacement, economic mobility, and the power of storytelling—bridging the gap between research and action to drive meaningful change.
Policy Shifts & Advanced Energy
Dr.Gilbert Michaud
Faculty Affiliate
Climate Change & Essential Workers 
Dr. Urooj Raja
Faculty Affiliate
Film & Art to Advance Justice
Vincent Singleton
Faculty Affiliate

Dr. Farzaneh Khayat

Dr. Kwabena Krah
Postdoctoral Fellow 
Read more
Read more
Read more
Black History Month Panel: Resistance & Resilience
Faculty Affiliate Dr. Tikia Hamilton co-hosted a conversation with Dr. Kelli Carter Jackson on the history of civil rights and political violence. The event explored how history informs today’s racial justice work.
Read more about the panel
 
Faculty Mixer: More Than Just Networking
Faculty, staff and students came together for a mixer that went beyond small talk. Through lightning-fast research presentations and deep discussions, the event sparked new collaborations across disciplines—because tackling racial injustice takes teamwork.
Read more about the mixer
 
The Right Use of Power Lunch 
IRJ faculty, staff, and community partners came together for a deep dive into power—how it operates, how it’s often misused, and how it can be a force for justice. 
Through thought-provoking discussions and real-world applications, participants explored ethical ways to navigate power dynamics in leadership, advocacy, and daily interactions. The session reinforced a core IRJ belief: justice isn’t just about shifting power but using it with purpose.
 
Racial Justice Salon
: Where Big Ideas Take Root
Great research doesn’t live in silos. Faculty gathered for an IRJ Racial Justice Salon, exchanging insights on equity and justice. These cross-disciplinary conversations fuel the kind of innovation that drives real change. 
 
Writing Workshop with Dr. Leanna Boychenko
Writing is more than words on a page—it’s a tool for change. Last month, faculty and affiliates gathered for a writing workshop led by IRJ faculty-affiliate Dr. Leanna Boychenko, creating a space to reflect, share struggles, and find inspiration. Participants introduced their writing goals, explored ways to overcome creative roadblocks, and brainstormed formats for ongoing support. After a dedicated writing session, they came back together to celebrate wins, discuss challenges. 
NPEA on the Road: Education, Race & Equity in Chicago

subject: Charge Ahead: Unleash Your Team's Power with Let's Roam
body:
When you start a chat with your team make sure to... 
 
Hi Briza, 
  
A winning team thrives on a foundation of positive energy, trust, and clear communication. Team building is the magic formula that transforms individual skills into a united force. With Let’s Roam, every activity is an opportunity to ignite enthusiasm, spark creativity, and build lasting bonds. 
Team Tune-Up🔧 
Inspired by the power-packed lessons of 
The Energy Bus by Jon Gordon
, it’s time to recharge your team’s spirit. Adopt the mindset that “
enthusiasm is contagious
” and let go of negativity. Our scavenger hunts are more than just fun—they’re an opportunity to apply these key tips by engaging in challenges that build trust, spark communication, and unleash creative problem-solving. With 
Let’s Roam’s scavenger hunts
, every activity is a chance to refuel and drive your team to success! 
Integrating play into your work routine isn’t just fun—it’s a game-changer. Let’s Roam’s 
virtual office games
 and 
team building scavenger hunts
 transform routine days into memorable adventures. These activities help break down barriers, boost morale, and create a vibrant, collaborative environment. 
Tip of the Week📅 
Let’s kick off the week with this fun little exercise: 
If your team had a mascot, what would it be and why?
 This question adds an extra layer of creativity to your morning routine, encouraging everyone to think outside the box and bond over imaginative ideas. 
Start a fun conversation! 🎉 Copy and paste this into your team chat: 
 
Let’s Roam Fun Fact: Positive Energy Drives Success!🫱🏽‍🫲🏻 
Research shows that teams that celebrate every win and consistently share positive affirmations not only boost productivity but also reduce stress and foster better collaboration. With a charged, supportive atmosphere, every challenge transforms into an opportunity for growth. Keep that momentum going and enjoy a journey of continuous improvement and shared success! 
Make It Happen All Year 🚀 
Great energy deserves great action. Ensure that the positive vibes extend beyond just conversations by planning regular team activities that inspire creativity and collaboration. With every initiative, you'll witness how a committed, energized team drives success all year long. 
Embrace the adventure ahead! 
Don’t Miss Out—Join the Fun
 and energize your team like never before. 
  
To future triumphs and the adventures that await you,
 
Let's Roam 
 
 
 
 
Let's Roam, LLC, 4023 Kennett Pike, #50241, Wilmington, DE 19807, United States, 1-(833)-202-ROAM (7626)

subject: Celebrating 25 Years with Client Stories
body:
We celebrated our 25th anniversary in December with our clients. Here are their stories of working with Highand. 
Click here
 to view this message in a browser window.
 
Welcome!
At Highland, we help ambitious leaders launch digital products, reimagine customer experiences, and find new markets for growth
This month, we’re highlighting some incredible client experiences shared by a panel of our clients at our 
25th Anniversary Celebration
 in December. Their stories showcase the power of strategic design, human-centered innovation, and trust-based partnerships. From financial institutions and government agencies to non-profits and global associations, our clients have shared how working with Highland has reshaped their organizations in meaningful ways.
Talk soon,
Jon
Jon Berbaum
 | President | 
Schedule a call
Reimagining Impact: How Make-A-Wish Illinois Transformed Wish Granting
Stephanie Springs, CEO, Make-A-Wish Illinois
At 
Make-A-Wish Illinois
, the focus had always been on delivering magical, high-quality wish experiences to children and their families. But what about the lasting impact of the wish? Through a strategic partnership with Highland, the organization realized they needed to shift their mindset: What if a wish wasn’t just a single moment, but an entire journey with meaningful moments along the path?
“Highland challenged us to rethink our approach. We weren’t just granting wishes—we were creating lifelong impactful experiences. Through experience mapping and deep conversations with families, we saw that the most transformative experiences weren’t necessarily only about the trip or the event itself, but the emotional and relational journey before, during, and after.”
This new framework didn’t just change Make-A-Wish Illinois—it reshaped how Make-A-Wish operates grants wishes nationally. Today, every wish granted by chapters across the county uses  the Wish Journey Model, a concept that was born out of this collaboration.
And it didn’t stop there. The organization continues to refine every stage of the journey, ensuring that each wish leaves a lasting imprint on the lives of 
both recipients and their familie
s.
From Startup to Scalable Success: The Power of Open Dialogue
John Iberl, Electronic License Service (ELS)
When John Iberl first launched 
Electronic License Service
, he had 
a vision but needed the right partners
 to bring it to life. Over a cup of coffee at a local Starbucks, he met 
Highland’s Brian Sutherland
, who saw the potential for ELS to 
revolutionize vehicle registration.
Fast forward, and ELS has processed 
over 30 million transactions worth billions of dollars
 for government agencies. But the secret to success wasn’t just technology—it was the 
culture of collaboration and continuous learning
 Highland helped foster.
“We built a system with real-time transactions, inventory tracking, print-on-demand stickers, and full financial reporting. But what really made the difference was the way we worked together. Highland brought mentorship, open dialogue, and an iterative approach that allowed us to pivot and grow. 
If we made a mistake, we fixed it. If we missed something, we owned it.
 That’s the kind of partnership that leads to success.”
This transparent, problem-solving mindset has allowed ELS to scale seamlessly while maintaining 
accountability and innovation at its core.
Bringing Order to Chaos: Scaling ISACA’s Membership Strategy
Liz Pisney, ISACA
With 
180,000 members worldwide
, 
ISACA
 had grown exponentially but struggled to 
scale effectively.
 Different teams were working in silos, moving in different directions, and lacking a cohesive strategy. Enter Highland.
“We were all pulling in different directions. Then we joined Highland’s cohort on 
the future of membership,
 and suddenly, things started to click. We realized we weren’t alone—other associations were facing the same challenges. Having the research and structure from Highland helped us align our strategy and start making meaningful progress.”
The insights from this initiative have helped ISACA move beyond 
reactive growth
 to a 
scalable, future-focused membership strategy.
 And while the transformation is ongoing, Liz credits Highland with helping them shift from 
“chaos mode” to a clear, strategic vision.
Human-Centered Innovation: The Highland Difference
Jeffrey Bojar, Gloo
For 
Gloo’s
 legal and product teams, the challenge wasn’t just about innovation—it was about ensuring that every breakthrough truly served their customers. Enter Highland, whose relentless customer-first approach reshaped how Gloo thinks about product development.
“If there’s one thing Highland has instilled in us, it’s that the customer must always be at the center. It’s easy to fall in love with our own ideas and forget what really matters. But with Highland, every decision, every feature, every strategy starts with deep research and real customer insights. When we prioritize the customer, we always win.”
By embedding experience mapping, user research, and qualitative insights into their process, Gloo has refined its products, deepened user engagement, and fostered a culture of continuous improvement. The result? More impactful innovation, greater customer satisfaction, and a team that doesn’t just build products—but builds with purpose.
25 Years Strategizing about the Future
Highland
 is an innovation and digital consultancy. We are celebrating 25 years of helping ambitious leaders launch digital products, reimagine customer experiences, and find new markets for growth. 
When you have a targeted research, design, or development project to discuss, reply to this email or click 
here
 to tell us about the opportunity you're pursuing.
Contact Us
 
Highland is an innovation and digital consultancy.
We help ambitious leaders launch digital products, reimagine customer experiences, and find new markets for growth.

click here

125 South Clark St., Suite 670, Chicago, IL 60603

Announcing GrowthRise for B2B Sales & Marketing Leaders 
Our new mastermind group for B2B Sales & Marketing leaders is launching this week. Apply by March 11. 
 
Hi Briza —
We are launching a brand new growth mastermind group this week just for 
B2B Sales & Marketing Leaders
 called

.
If you'd like your head of marketing or sales to join, please have them apply at 
www.growthrise.com

. You can forward this message to them.

>> 
Apply here
The cost to join the group is $97/month (for the first 50 members who join), with a 30 day free trial. 
Here's 
an overview video
 from me…
An overview of our new mastermind community for B2B Sales & Marketing Leaders
Watch the Overview Video 
This is a no-brainer for anyone who wants to help their heads of sales and marketing grow professionally as leaders and gain critical skills on the latest ABM, RevOps, AI, and GTM techniques. 
All 
B2B heads of marketing and sales
 (CMOs, CROs, Head of Sales, Head of Marketing, Head of Growth, and even S&M focused founders) are eligible to join. 
In the masterminds and community, we will focus on the full revenue lifestyle from awareness to closing to expansion. 
Just like with 
SaasRise
 (which is just for SaaS CEOs and Founders), we’ll be sharing resources live and in the community (on Circle, Slack, WhatsApp) on how to implement our 
B2B Growth System 
which combines ABM list building + outbound email + warm email + weekly content + LinkedIn + matched audience ads + retargeting ads + lookalike ads to build a predictable revenue growth machine.
Send your Sales & Marketing leaders to join us at 
www.growthrise.com
 and we'll take good care of them!
All the best,
Ryan Allis
CEO & Founder
SaasRise
 & 
GrowthRise
Apply to Join GrowthRise 
  
About The Author
Ryan Allis is the founder of 
SaasRise
, the mastermind community for growth-focused SaaS CEOs & Founders with $1M-$100M in ARR and 
GrowthRise
, the community for B2B Sales & Marketing leaders. He is a three time INC 500 CEO. He was previously CEO of iContact and grew the firm as founder/CEO to 70,000 customers, 1 million users, 300 employees, $50M per year in sales, and an exit for $169M to Vocus (NASDAQ:VOCS). 
Since the sale of iContact, Ryan has been the CEO coach to high-growth B2B firms including Instantly, Tatango, Seamless.ai, Pipeline, Datalyse, Green Packet, Revenue Accelerator, Galleon, Clearstream, YouCanBookMe, Retreaver, and EventMobi. Ryan has been part of the EO, YPO, and Summit Series communities.
He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School, where he was Co-President of the Social Enterprise Club and a member of the Harvard Graduate School Leadership Institute. He’s passionate about helping B2B firms grow and exit.

C-Suite to Main Street
WATCH THE REPLAY
 
Navigating Business Transformation: Key Insights
In today's business landscape, the ability to adapt and transform is essential for survival and sustained growth.
‌
In the latest episode of C-Suite to Main Street, 
Saeju Jeong, Co-Founder and Executive Chairman of health and wellness company Noom
, shared his insights on navigating business transformation and strengthening a brand through change. His advice offers valuable takeaways for businesses of all sizes looking to thrive in evolving markets. 
WATCH THE REPLAY
 
  
  
Jeong emphasized the importance of staying agile and customer-focused throughout periods of transformation. He outlined several key strategies to achieve this: 
‌
Embrace change
: Acknowledge that change is inevitable and prepare your company to be flexible and adaptable. Resisting change can be detrimental to long-term success. 
Prioritize customer needs
: Keep your target audience at the heart of every decision. Understand their evolving needs and tailor your products and services accordingly. 
Experiment and iterate
: Don't be afraid to test new ideas and approaches. Use data to analyze the results and make necessary adjustments. This iterative process allows for continuous improvement and innovation. 
‌
By focusing on customer needs, Noom has managed to stay relevant long term, and Jeong's advice offers a practical roadmap for building a stronger, more resilient brand. 
‌
Catch the full recap
 for more insights on navigating business transformation and thriving through change!

subject: Advanced Excel Tips for Accountants and Payroll Professionals
body:
Professionals Learning
Advanced Excel Skills for Accountants Finance & Payroll Professional
Live Webinar 
Date: 
March 31, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 90 Minutes
Register Now
 
Whether you are creating financial reports or analyzing financial data Excel plays an important role. It helps accountants, payroll professionals, and Human Resources professionals to transform raw data into meaningful reports.
The acclaimed Microsoft Excel expert David H. Ringstrom will reveal how you can apply a variety of lookup functions to work more efficiently in Excel. You will also understand why the INDEX and MATCH combination is often superior to VLOOKUP or HLOOKUP. And, get a preview of the new XLOOKUP function that is added to Microsoft 365. Apart from that, you will be in for something as well. 
Session Objectives:
Contrasting the INDEX and MATCH combination to VLOOKUP or HLOOKUP.
Creating a pivot table to transform lists of data into on-screen reports.
Explaining the new XLOOKUP worksheet function being rolled out to Microsoft 365 users.
Learning about the IFNA function available in Excel 2013 and later.
Transforming numbers stored as text into values by way of the Text to Columns wizard.
Using the HLOOKUP function to look horizontally across rows in any version of Excel.
Utilizing Excel’s IFERROR function to display alternate values when VLOOKUP returns an error.
Expert Speaker:
David H. Ringstrom, CPA, is the president and owner of Accounting Advisors, Inc. based in Atlanta, Georgia. David founded Accounting Advisors in 1991 as a consulting services business. David’s Excel courses cover the software’s features and functions to provide CPAs accounting and financial professionals the knowledge they need to work more efficiently and effectively in Excel.
167 Madison Avenue Ste 205 #227 New York City, NY 10016 | support@professionalslearningcom

Register now during the Double Your Stay Promotion and stay by April 30, 2025 to double your Points.

New ways to dream, stay, and redeem with Hilton.
 
Enjoy boutique retreats at hundreds of unique, high-end properties worldwide.

Offer valid for stays completed January 1 - April 30, 2025 (“promotion period”) at any hotel or resort within the Hilton Portfolio. Hilton Honors™ members must first register at 
HiltonHonors.com/DoubleYourStay
 prior to completing a stay within the promotion period. 
Registered Hilton Honors members checking in before January 1, 2025, will receive Bonus Points for their stay if the stay is completed on or after January 1, 2025, and prior to or on April 30, 2025. 
Registered Hilton Honors members will earn Double Points per stay during the promotion period. “Double Points” means members will receive Bonus Points equal to the number of Base Points earned during a stay. 
There is no limit to the total amount of Bonus Points that may be earned during the promotion period with this offer. However, there are restrictions on the number of Base Points that can be earned on a single stay at certain brands. 
For examples and further details, please see the 
FAQ page
. 
This offer may be altered or terminated without notice. Bonus Points do not count toward elite tier qualification. Please allow six to eight weeks from completion of your stay for Bonus Points to appear in your account. A 'stay' is defined as the total number of consecutive nights spent at the same hotel, whether or not a guest checks out and checks back in again. Offer is not valid for groups and cannot be combined with other select offers. In-Room Internet Access, Fitness Center/Health Club Access and Bottled Water benefits may not be complimentary at properties with a resort charge. Space-available upgrades only available at select brands. Elite status benefits are subject to availability and vary by brand. For more information, please visit 
HiltonHonors.com
.

subject: Briza, Protect Your Financial Future – Complimentary Legal Evaluation
body:
Have you had a recent analysis of your debt to see if you qualify for a reduction based on the newest state laws?
 
Dealing with debt can be stressful, but you don’t have to do it alone.
Hi Briza,
With new consumer protection laws in place, now is the perfect time to review your financial situation. These laws may provide relief and uncover potential violations related to:
Credit Cards
Timeshares
Personal Loans
Medical Expenses
Many financial agreements may involve consumer rights violations, and recent legal updates present new opportunities for protection and resolution.
Claim Your Complimentary Legal Evaluation
As part of our commitment to your financial well-being, we’re offering a 
complimentary consultation
 to help you explore your options. Our specialists will:
✅ 
Review
 what’s reported on your financial records.
✅ 
Identify
 potential fraud or misreporting.
✅ 
Recommend
 legal strategies that could bring you relief.
✅ 
Explore
 options to lower your monthly payments while ensuring legal protection.
We understand that financial challenges can feel overwhelming, but you don’t have to navigate them alone. Our team is here to provide expert guidance and ensure you make informed decisions.
Schedule Your Free Consultation Now
If you have any questions or prefer to speak with one of our certified specialists directly, feel free to reach out.
We look forward to assisting you!
For More Information 
Best Regards,
Terry Clelland
Debt Ambassador

subject: 2025 Compliance Alert: ICE to Focus on I-9 Audits and Immigration Violations
body:
Professionals Learning
2025 Immigration Enforcement: Prepare for ICE I-9 Audits and Raids
Live Webinar 
Date: 
March 12, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 90 Minutes
Register Now
 
Employers face increasing risks with tougher immigration enforcement and skyrocketing fines. Did you know Form I-9 violations can cost up to $2,861 per error and up to $28,619 for hiring unauthorized workers? Join our webinar, presented by our renowned speaker, “Margie Faulk”. Our course covers everything you need to protect your organization: Conduct thorough internal I-9 audits. Implement best practices for I-9 management, Prepare for audits and workplace raids, and Develop an effective immigration compliance policy. Gain practical skills to conduct internal audits, streamline verification processes, and respond confidently to workplace raids. Don’t leave your company vulnerable to costly penalties! Learn the essential tools to stay compliant, mitigate risks, and safeguard your business. 
Expert Speaker:
 Margie Faulk is a senior-level human resource professional with over 15 years of HR management and compliance experience. A current Compliance Advisor for HR Compliance Solutions, LLC, Margie, has worked as an HR Compliance advisor for major corporations and small businesses in the small, large, private, public, and non-profit sectors.
167 Madison Avenue Ste 205 #227 New York City, NY 10016 | support@professionalslearningcom

subject: Why Widely Supported Accounting Systems Are the Smarter Choice for Businesses
body:
The latest insights from AccountingDepartment.com
Not rendering correctly? View this email as a web page 
here
. 
Thought Leadership from the Leaders in Virtual Accounting & Bookkeeping Services
We hope you enjoy these recent posts from our blog...
Why Widely Supported Accounting Systems Are the Smarter Choice for Businesses
Thursday, February 27, 2025 3:25 PM
 
When Bench suddenly ceased operations and left thousands of businesses stranded, it reignited an important conversation about the tools we choose to keep our businesses running. Bench was known for its proprietary accounting system, which unfortunately became an obstacle for its clients during the transition. This event underscores an essential lesson for every business owner and entrepreneur—choosing the right accounting system can make or break your operations. 
Read more »
    
Maximizing Profitability with Job Costing
Wednesday, February 26, 2025 3:41 PM
 
Understanding exactly how much each job or project costs your business is essential for maximizing profitability. However, many business owners struggle to track costs accurately, leading to mispriced jobs and unexpected expenses later on. This is where job costing comes into play.
Read more »

Terms and Conditions
1. Earn 130,000 Hilton Honors Bonus Points and One Free Night Reward
You can earn 130,000 Hilton Honors Bonus Points and one Free Night Reward from Hilton Honors after you spend $3,000 (the "Threshold Amount") on eligible purchases on your Card in your first 6 months of Card Membership starting from the date that your account is opened. Eligible purchases include those made by both the Basic and Additional Card Members on the Card Account. Eligible purchases are purchases for goods and services minus returns and other credits. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchase of traveler’s checks, purchase or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or other cash equivalents. Additional Card Members on your account are not eligible for this offer. To receive Bonus Points, your Card account must not be cancelled or past due at the time of fulfillment. Hilton Honors Bonus Points will be credited to your Hilton Honors account 8-12 weeks after the Threshold Amount has been reached. Bonus Points do not count toward elite tier qualification; for more information, visit 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
.
The Free Night Reward will be issued in the form of a redeemable code and sent in an email from Hilton Honors to the email address listed on your Hilton Honors account up to 16 weeks after the Threshold Amount has been reached. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchase of traveler's checks, purchase or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or other cash equivalents. Eligible purchases are purchases for goods and services minus returns and other credits. To receive the Hilton Honors Free Night Reward, your Card Account must not be cancelled or past due at the time of fulfillment. The Free Night Reward can be redeemed any night of the week for a one night standard accommodation, double occupancy, subject to availability at properties in the Hilton portfolio, excluding those listed at 
HiltonHonors.com/freenightreward
. To redeem the Free Night Reward, you must call 1-800-446-6677. Free Night Rewards will expire 12 months from date of issuance. The Free Night Reward will be forfeited if not redeemed for a stay on or before the expiration date. To ensure receipt of the reward e-mail notification, you should confirm the correct email address is listed on your Hilton Honors account profile. You can also check your Hilton Honors account for the status of a Free Night Reward issued to you (including the expiration date) by calling 1-800-446-6677. The Free Night Reward is not transferable and may not be redeemed for cash or Hilton Honors Points. The Free Night Reward may be combined with other Hilton or Free Night promotions in market and may be added to existing paid or Reward stays. The Free Night Reward includes all applicable resort fees and taxes on the cost of the room for the redeemed night. The Card Member is responsible for all incidental charges. The Free Night Reward may be subject to additional policies from Hilton Honors; for more information, visit 
https://www.Hilton.com/en/p/promotions/free-night-terms/.
If you have a history of canceling or downgrading American Express Card accounts within your first year and you cancel or downgrade your new Card account within your first year, we may not credit, we may freeze, or we may take away the Hilton Honors Bonus Points and one Free Night Reward from your account. If we determine that you have engaged in abuse, misuse, or gaming in connection with this offer in any way or that you intend to do so, including if you return purchases you made to meet the Threshold Amount, we may not credit, we may freeze, or we may take away the Hilton Honors Bonus Points and one Free Night Reward from your account. We may also cancel any accounts you have with us.
This offer is not transferable. If your application is not received by 4/29/2025, we will not process your application even if we later receive your application. American Express reserves the right to modify or revoke offer at any time.
2. Hilton Honors Bonus Points on Eligible Purchases
Hilton Honors Bonus Points earned using your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card: 
You will receive 3 Hilton Honors Bonus Points for each dollar of eligible purchases.
You will receive 9 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points, for a total of 12, for each dollar of eligible purchases charged directly with a property within the Hilton portfolio, including bookings and incidental charges. To receive the 9 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for charges made at the time of booking, the booking must be made directly through a reservation channel operated by Hilton. You can receive the 9 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for incidental charges made at the hotel (including charges made at restaurants, spas, and other establishments) if those charges can be and are charged to your room and paid for with your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card at checkout.
You will receive 3 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points, for a total of 6, for each dollar of eligible purchases at the following categories of merchants excluding superstores and warehouse clubs: restaurants located in the U.S., supermarkets located in the U.S. and on gasoline at gas stations located in the U.S.
To get additional Points for a restaurant purchase, the purchase must be at a restaurant located in the United States. You will NOT get additional Points for purchases made at a restaurant owned by a U.S. company but located outside the U.S. (e.g. Hard Rock Café in Paris). You also will NOT get additional Points for restaurant purchases at nightclubs, convenience stores, grocery stores, or supermarkets. You may not get additional Points for purchases at a restaurant located within another establishment (e.g. a restaurant inside a hotel, casino, or event venue). For example, purchases made at a restaurant located within a hotel may be recognized as a purchase at a hotel, not a restaurant.
You will receive 1 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Point, for a total of 4, for each dollar of eligible online retail purchases made on a website or a digital application (an app) from a U.S. retail merchant that sells physical goods or merchandise directly to consumers. To identify eligible online retail purchases, we rely on information provided to us by the merchant. The following are not considered retail purchases: purchases made at restaurants, supermarkets, gasoline stations, or automotive dealers, as well as purchases of travel, entertainment, or other services. Payment must be made online and categorized as an internet transaction by the merchant for the purchase to be eligible. You will not receive additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for purchases made online but paid for in store. Payments made in store using a mobile or digital wallet or a contactless payment device are not considered online purchases. You will not receive additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for purchases made by phone or mail, or by using a third party "buy now pay later" installment program.  
Your Hilton Honors Points are subject to Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions; see 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
. 
Eligible purchases are purchases for goods and services minus returns and other credits. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchases of travelers checks, purchases or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or purchases of other cash equivalents. Hilton Honors Bonus Points you earn with your Card will be posted to your Hilton Honors account up to 12 weeks after the end of your billing period.
Purchases made through a third-party payment account or on an online marketplace (with multiple retailers) will not receive additional points.
Merchants are assigned codes based on what they primarily sell. We group certain merchant codes into categories that are eligible for additional Points. A purchase with a merchant will not receive additional Points if the merchant’s code is not included in a reward category. You may not receive additional Points if we receive inaccurate information or are otherwise unable to identify your purchase as eligible for a reward category. For example, you may not receive additional Points when: a merchant uses a third-party to sell their products or services; or a merchant uses a third-party to process or submit your transaction to us (e.g., using mobile or wireless card readers); or you choose to make a purchase using a third-party payment account or make a purchase using a mobile or digital wallet.
Please visit 
americanexpress.com/rewards-info
 for more information about rewards.
 
3. Hilton Honors Complimentary Gold Status
You will receive complimentary Hilton Honors Gold status with your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card. Please allow up to 12 weeks from account open date for your complimentary Gold status to be applied to your Hilton Honors account. Complimentary Gold status benefit is only available to the Basic Card Member. If your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card is cancelled for any reason, your complimentary Hilton Honors Gold status provided with the Card will be cancelled. American Express reserves the right to change, modify or revoke complimentary Gold status at any time. If your complimentary Gold status is cancelled, you may be able to maintain your Gold status by qualifying under the Hilton Honors Program terms. Gold status benefits are subject to availability and vary by hotel. For more information on Gold status benefits or how to maintain Gold status each year with qualifying stays, nights or Hilton Honors Base Points through the Hilton Honors Program, visit 
HiltonHonors.com/MemberBenefits
, 
Hilton.com/en/Hilton-Honors/benefit-terms/
, 
HiltonHonors.com/SLHTerms
, and 
HiltonHonors.com/AutoCampTerms
. The Hilton Honors Program, including the benefits of Hilton Honors Membership, are subject to Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions; see 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
.
4. Hilton Honors Free Night Reward
Basic Card Members can receive a Free Night Reward from Hilton Honors after the total eligible purchases on their Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card account reach $15,000 in a calendar year. The Free Night Reward will be issued in the form of a redeemable code and sent to the Basic Card Member in an email from Hilton Honors to the email address listed on their Hilton Honors account. The Basic Card Member will receive the Reward email within 8-12 weeks after meeting the purchase requirement. This benefit is only available to the Basic Card Member; however, eligible purchases made by Additional Card Members will contribute to the purchase requirement.
Eligible purchases to meet the purchase requirement are for goods and services minus returns and other credits. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchases of travelers checks, purchases or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or other cash equivalents. If you transfer to a different Hilton Honors American Express Card that has a Free Night Reward benefit, any eligible purchases you made on your old Card Account will count toward the new Card Account’s Free Night Reward purchase requirement, after your first transaction on the new Card Account.
The Free Night Reward can be redeemed for one standard accommodation, double occupancy, subject to availability, at properties in the Hilton portfolio, excluding those listed at 
HiltonHonors.com/freenightreward
. 
To redeem the Free Night Reward, Basic Card Members must call 1-800-446-6677 and mention the code provided by Hilton Honors. A Free Night Reward expires one year from the date of issuance and must be redeemed on or before the expiration date. A Free Night Reward will be forfeited if not redeemed on or before the expiration date.
To ensure receipt of the Free Night Reward e-mail notification, confirm the correct email address is listed on your Hilton Honors account profile. To view the status of any Free Night Rewards issued to you, visit your Hilton Honors Account Dashboard at 
HiltonHonors.com
. 
The Free Night Reward is not transferable and may not be redeemed for cash or Hilton Honors Points. A Free Night Reward may be combined with other Hilton or Free Night promotions in market and may be added to existing paid or Reward stays. A Free Night Reward includes all applicable resort fees and taxes on the cost of the room for the redeemed night at all locations except for a tourism tax at properties located in Malaysia. The Card Member is responsible for all incidental charges and, if applicable, the Malaysian tourism tax. Free Night Reward redemptions may be cancelled pursuant to the Free Night Reward cancellation policy on the Hilton Honors Program website (
HiltonHonors.com
). 
Free Night Rewards are subject to Hilton Terms and Conditions, available at 
https://www.hilton.com/en/p/promotions/free-night-terms/
.
5. $200 Hilton Statement Credit
Basic Hilton Honors American Express Surpass Card Members can receive up to a total of $50 in statement credits each calendar quarter (January through March, April through June, July through September, and October through December), for up to $200 back annually, for eligible purchases charged directly with a property within the Hilton portfolio on their Card Account, including bookings and incidental charges. For a booking to be eligible for a statement credit, the booking must be made directly through a reservation channel operated by Hilton. Bookings or purchases made through a third party other than Hilton, such as an online travel website, will not be eligible for statement credit(s). At certain hotels, if your booking is part of a contract for an event, the purchase may not be eligible for a statement credit. For an incidental charge (including charges made at restaurants, spas, and other establishments within the hotel property) to be eligible for a statement credit, the incidental charge must be charged to your room and paid for with your Hilton Honors American Express Surpass Card at checkout.
Eligible purchases can be made by both the Basic and any Additional Card Members on the Card Account. However, the total amount of statement credits for eligible purchases will not exceed $200 per Card Account per calendar year. Please allow 8-12 weeks after the eligible purchase is charged to your Card Account for statement credit(s) to be posted to the Account. Please call American Express at the number on the back of your Card if statement credits have not posted after 12 weeks from the date of purchase. To receive this benefit, your Card account must not be cancelled or past due at the time of statement credit fulfillment. Statement credit(s) may not be received or may be reversed if the purchase is cancelled or modified, or if you engage in abuse or misuse in connection with the benefit.
American Express relies on the merchant’s processing of transactions to determine the transaction date. The transaction date may differ from the date you made the purchase if, for example, there is a delay in the merchant submitting the transaction to us or if the merchant uses another date as the transaction date. This means that in some cases your purchase may not earn the statement credit benefit for the benefit period in which you made the purchase. For example, if an eligible purchase is made on December 31st but the merchant processes the transaction such that it is identified to us as occurring on January 1st, the January statement credit would be applied. American Express also relies on information provided to us by the merchant to identify eligible purchases. If American Express does not receive information that identifies your transaction as eligible for this benefit, the Basic Card Member will not receive the statement credit. For example, your purchase will not be eligible if it is not made directly with Hilton (e.g., if a purchase is made at a restaurant or convenience store within a Hilton property). Basic Card Members may not receive the statement credit if we receive inaccurate information or are otherwise unable to identify your purchase as eligible, if a transaction is made with an electronic wallet or through a third party (such as an app store), or if the merchant uses a mobile or wireless card reader to process it.
Please do not reply to this email, as mail sent to this address cannot be answered.
 If you have questions please visit our 
Customer Support
 page and select the applicable contact method.
Hilton Honors™ membership and redemption of Points are subject to 
Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions
.

Cat’s out of the bag. 
Ever taken advice from someone who walks on four legs? Now’s your chance. We passed the mic to our panel of petsperts and asked them to share their favorite places around the world. Good thing they gave us all bark (and no bite). 
Travel by word of snout 
 
Paws and add these to your bucket list. 
 
 
Name: 
Dillon
 
Favorite place:
 Dillon Beach, California (duh)
Trip highlights:
 Feeling the sand between his toe beans and stealing fries off the floors of fish and chip spots.
Find flights
 
 
Name: 
Woola
 
Favorite place:
 North Wales
Trip highlights:
 Beachcombing, forest-exploring … and not getting his feetsies in the snow even once.
Find flights
 
 
Name: 
Stella
 
Favorite place:
 Lake Placid, New York
Trip highlights:
 Trail hikes and lake swims with mom and dad. Is that… an orange kayak? 👀
Find flights

 Riga, Latvia
Trip highlights:
 Realizing that hotels aren’t all that bad (and their carpets are *chef’s kiss* for making biscuits).

 Alternating resort walks and casino nights with hardcore naps back at the room.

subject: 1099 MISC - NEC 2025: Stay Ahead of the Game
body:
Professionals Learning
1099 Filing Simplified for Tax Season 2025
Live Webinar 
Date: 
March 18, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 90 Minutes
Register Now
 
IRS Form 1099-MISC compliance is a surprisingly complex requirement for both businesses and accountants. Learn from our renowned speaker, Jason T. Dinesen, about the tricky areas relating to Form 1099-MISC. This webinar will focus on the two most common types — Form 1099-NEC and Form 1099-MISC — while also covering various other types of forms. Participants will gain valuable knowledge on when the 1099 form should be issued and whether a worker is a contractor or an employee.
Our speaker will elucidate on topics such as determining payment amounts, analysing when corporations receive 1099 forms, identifying the Form 1099-K exception to issuing 1099 forms. This webinar is tailored for accountants, bookkeepers, office managers, human resources professionals, and compliance specialists who require up-to-date knowledge on the latest 1099 rules and regulations. 
Expert Speaker:
 Jason Dinesen is the President of Dinesen Tax & Accounting, P.C., a public accounting firm in Indianola, Iowa. His practice focuses on tax and accounting services for small businesses and individuals. Dinesen has extensive experience working with a third-party administrator of retirement plans and is a prior presenter of multiple 1099 seminars.
167 Madison Avenue Ste 205 #227 New York City, NY 10016 | support@professionalslearningcom

Get the latest: Corporate Transparency Act
As of last week, the Beneficial Ownership Information Reporting requirement has been reinstated. 
Here's everything you need to know

While DIY accounting can save you initial costs, making common mistakes could cost you far more in the long run, ultimately hindering your business's growth. To help you navigate the financial waters, here are

subject: BetterHelp Business | NEW! March Admin Toolkit
body:
Get ready for March with our new Admin Toolkit!
 
Volume #014  |  December 2024
 
NEW! March Admin Toolkit
Women’s Mental Health Equity
for Women’s History Month + International Women’s Day
 
 
Women’s History Month & International Women’s Day both occur in March annually. Women's History Month in March celebrates women's contributions throughout history, while International Women's Day on March 8th focuses on honoring women's achievements globally and advocating for gender equality.
 
Throughout history, the mental health of women and others who do not identify as men has frequently been misunderstood, stigmatized, neglected, and worse. Although progress has been made, there are still challenges and problems to address as we continue to move forward. 
 
March Admin Toolkit
 
Preview of what's inside...
 
Overview Slide
Add this slide to your next all-company meeting to highlight the BetterHelp benefit with an emphasis on resources for Women's Mental Health Equity
Get the slide
 
 
 
Email, Slack, Newsletter Templates
Highlight your BetterHelp benefit to your employees or members with these easy-to-use templates 
Get the templates
 
Guidebook: Tracing the Complex History of Women's Mental Health Care
Get the Guidebook
 
 
& more!
 
 
Enjoy from your BetterHelp 
Business Account Director.
 
Karrie Larson
karrie.larson @ betterhelp . com
Hello, I'm Karrie, Account Director at BetterHelp Business. I assist our clients in maximizing employee benefits through our resources. This includes creating monthly admin toolkits, scheduling our BeWell webinars, and more. Drawing from my experience in mental health benefits, I've learned that frequent, creative discussions about well-being are crucial for engagement. We're here to support you in achieving that. Outside of work, I enjoy hosting wellness events, caring for my cats Kelso and Dolce, and traveling the world whenever possible.
 
 
Looking for more assistance outside of your overall BetterHelp engagement strategy? Reach out to our Partner Success team! 
 
Katie and Jermy can be reached at
partnersuccess @ betterhelp . com
