subject: Outbound 2.0: The Guide to AI-Personalized Outbound Emails
body:
A guide to sending AI-personalized outbound emails that get 5x the results vs. traditional outbound prospecting  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
February 26, 2025   |   
Read Online
Outbound 2.0: The Guide to AI-Personalized Outbound Emails 
A guide to sending AI-personalized outbound emails that get 5x the results vs. traditional outbound prospecting 
 
Hi Briza —
In today’s deep dive guide, I’m going to break down exactly how to do AI-personalized outbound emailing for your B2B company. 
I call this 
Outbound Email 2.0
. 
B2B cold email is not dead—
but lazy, generic cold email is.
  
I’ve found that AI personalization for each recipient based on their LinkedIn Profiles is the key to scaling outreach that 
actually gets clicks and responses.
In my experience, AI-outbound prospecting works very well at any B2B company where you get at least $2,000 per year per customer. 
We’re doing lots of AI outbound email invitations at 
SaasRise
, and it’s improved the click through rate of our outbound email campaigns by 465% compared to the old non-personalized emails. Now, 2/3rds of our new member signups come via AI-personalized email reachouts. 
Below we break down exactly what we do to send out 125,000 automated prospecting emails per month to our target market — and how you gain a big edge on your competition by doing it before they do. 
Below is an overview video and the full 12-page guide. 
Watch the Video on AI-Personalized Outbound 
Watch this 11 minute Loom video on how to do AI Outbound
Read the AI Outbound Guide as a Google Doc 
  
Outbound 2:0: The Guide to Sending AI-Personalized B2B Cold Emails
By Ryan Allis, CEO of 
SaasRise
About the Author: 
Ryan Allis is the CEO and co-founder of 
SaasRise
, the community for SaaS CEOs & founders. Ryan founded and grew iContact as CEO to $50M ARR, sold it for $169M, and earned his MBA from Harvard Business School. Today, Ryan coaches SaaS CEOs in rapidly scaling up revenue, building their teams, and preparing for and executing on $100M+ exits. 
In this deep-dive guide, I’m going to break down exactly how to do AI-personalized outbound emailing.  
Cold email is not dead—
but lazy, generic cold email is.
 AI personalization, combined with 
automated, high-deliverability sending
, is the key to scaling outreach that 
actually gets clicks and responses.
Cold emailing into a target market has long been a staple in B2B Rev Ops, but with AI-driven personalization of each message, it’s now working better than ever for firms with annual contract values (ACVs) north of $2k. 
Today, we’re diving deep into how AI can supercharge cold email strategy and be part of building a predictable revenue machine for the fastest growing B2B firms.  
This guide will walk you through exactly how to do AI-powered cold outreach: 
How to Use Gen AI to Write Personalized Cold Emails with Clay 
Setting Up Instantly for Efficient Cold Email Sending & Deliverability 
Optimizing Your Cold Email Content Strategy to Maximize Replies and Clicks 
We’ll also provide actual examples, video tutorials, and templates. Save this post and pass it along to your CMO/CRO/Head of Growth. 
By the end of this, you’ll have an AI-driven outbound machine that gets 
5x the click and reply rates
 of traditional outbound campaigns. 
These days prospects are bombarded with sales pitches. If your email looks even remotely templated, it’s getting ignored. 
AI personalization changes the game by making your outreach feel tailor-made for every recipient.
Using tools like 
Clay
 and 
Instantly
, you can pull 
real-time data
 from LinkedIn, company websites, and other sources to craft a hyper-personalized opener that makes your email 
impossible to ignore.
What Is AI-Personalized Outbound Prospecting?
What do we mean by AI-personalization of cold email? 
It means that a custom, personalized email message is generated for each recipient, based on their LinkedIn headline, LinkedIn summary, and website homepage.  
We generate this AI-personalized cold email copy using 
Clay
 (An ABM list building tool that integrates with many different data providers and generative AI platforms including Claude, ChatGPT, and Gemini)
Once the AI-personalized emails are written, we send out the emails themselves using our cold emailing tool 
Instantly
.  
Step 1: Building the AI-Personalized ABM Lead List in Clay
Step 1: Building the AI-Personalized ABM Lead List in Clay
Step 2: Set Up Your Message Sequence in Instantly
Step 2: Cold Prospect Email Sequence in Instantly
Example: AI-Personalized vs. Generic Openers
Compare the differences in the below emails. 
🚫
 Generic Email Opener:
"Hi [Name], I noticed you are a [Job Title] at [Company]. Let’s connect and explore synergies."
✅
 AI-Personalized Opener (Generated via Clay):
"Hey [Name], turning a negative 146% margin business into +51% within three quarters is next-level. As a fellow SaaS founder, I’d love to invite you to our private mastermind call next week."
Why it works:
 It highlights a 
specific achievement
 from their LinkedIn profile, making it 
personal, engaging, and relevant.
This is all done at scale via AI — allowing you to easily send out 1000-2000 of these AI-personalized outreaches per day.
While you could do this using 
11x.ai
, the costs there are ~$5000 per month for 3,000 leads. Using the below method you can reach 30,000-60,000 new leads per month for that cost.
The Video Guide On Exactly How to Do AI Outbound
Here is a 27 minute 
video tutorial on how to do AI-personalization for a list built within Clay
. I made it last week. 
And here is 
an 11 minute video tutorial on how to do AI-personalization from any lead list
, regardless of where it was originally built. 
Once you finish your AI-personalization of your list, just import it into a sending tool like Instantly to send out. 
The Exact Steps on How to Do AI-Personalization Outbound
Here are the steps to follow, they are a bit technical so watch the above videos to do it properly. The key is to experiment and learn. 
Import CSV file of your ABM Lead List into Clay (you can create the list in Clay directly or import from Instantly, ListKit, Apollo, ZoomInfo, Lusha, Adapt, Seamless, LinkedIn Sales Navigator etc.) 
Make sure the file has LinkedIn Profile URL as a column already 
If it doesn’t, add a new column called “LinkedIn Profile” and enrich list (use APIs if doing in bulk). Once you have the LinkedIn Profile URL… 
If you don’t have LinkedIn URLs, you can enrich your data using Clay’s built-in LinkedIn profile scraper or third-party tools like Evaboot, Findymail, or Snovio. 
Enrich with “Full Profile” (1 credit) and add LinkedIn Headline and LinkedIn Summary columns (education column optional). 
Then add a column (“Use AI”) and create your custom AI prompt (example below) 
Then use the latest model of Claude (currently 3.5 Sonnet) or ChatGPT (currently 4o) (3 credits or use APIs to save $) 
Test prompt on ~10 records a few times before you run it on all 
When pleased with results, run on full list 
When done, import CSV file to Instantly to send out emails 
How to Set Up AI-Powered Personalization in Clay
Here’s some extra details on how to do this right… 
1. Building a High-Quality ABM Lead List
To get started, you need a 
highly targeted
 Account-Based Marketing (ABM) list in Clay, ListKit, Lusha, Adapt, ZoomInfo, Seamless or a similar tool with the following data: 
Full Name 
Job Title 
Company Name 
LinkedIn URL 
Work Email 
If you don’t have LinkedIn URLs, you can 
enrich your data
 using Clay’s built-in LinkedIn profile scraper or third-party tools like Evaboot or FindEmail. 
2. Generating AI-Personalized Openers
Once your ABM list is loaded into 
Clay
, here’s how to personalize at scale: 
Import Your Lead List
 – Upload your ABM list into Clay. 
Enrich Profiles
 – Use Clay’s data enrichment to extract insights from LinkedIn summaries, company websites, and headlines. 
Craft Your AI Prompt
 – The magic happens here. Your prompt should be 
detailed and specific
 to generate high-quality openers. Example:
"Act as a top-tier cold email copywriter. Generate a compelling, two-sentence email opener using specific insights from the recipient’s LinkedIn profile. Make it engaging, natural, and unique." 
We give a full even longer prompt example below. 
Choose the Right AI Model
 – Use 
Claude 3.5 Sonnet (Anthropic)
 or 
ChatGPT 4.0
 for the best results. 
Run AI Generation
 – Clay will generate 
customized openers for every lead.
 You can do this on 1000 leads in about 20 minutes of background processing. 
Export and Use in Email Campaigns
 – Once finalized, download your enriched lead list and import it into your email-sending platform (like Instantly, SmartLead, Apollo, 
Reply.io
, Outreach, SalesLoft, etc.) 
More Examples of AI Personalized Emails
To grow our 
SaasRise
 community membership, we reach out to CEOs and Founders of SaaS firms to invite them to join. 
Below are examples of AI-generated subject lines, opening lines, and P.S. line, all generated by Claude Sonnet 3.5 based on the lead’s LinkedIn profile (Headline, summary, and education) using 
Clay
 and then sent with 
Instantly
. 
These types of messages, as you’ll see below, are currently getting us 5x the results of our non-AI personalized campaigns. 
AI Generated Subject Line
AI Generated Openers
AI Generated P.S. Lines
amsterdam data ceo meetup 
Hey Leonard, 
Your decade-long journey transforming Crobox from a data analytics startup into a full-scale product discovery powerhouse caught my eye - you'd fit right in with our tight-knit group of SaaS CEOs. 
P.S. Love how you leveraged your data science background to disrupt e-commerce in Amsterdam's tech ecosystem - quite a few of our members made similar bold moves. 
mapping the future since 1991 
Hey Harold, 
From GPS devices to autonomous driving - what a journey TomTom's been on. Bet you'd have some killer stories to share with our group of SaaS CEOs who are all scaling like crazy. 
P.S. Love how you're making Amsterdam's roads smarter. Next time you're in town, let's grab a stroopwafel and talk tech. 
construction speed breakthrough 
Hey Daniel - seeing how your TVD system is disrupting traditional construction workflows, I think you'd gel well with our community of 300+ SaaS CEOs who are equally obsessed with efficiency. 
P.S. Love how you're shaking things up in both construction tech and Dalmatian real estate - that entrepreneurial spirit is exactly what we're about. 
The first email looks like the following inside Instantly.  
What the email looks like before the mail merge variables are filled in from the table
These fields get mailed-merged when sent out, which turns into this final opening email… 
This prospect responded very favorably to the reach out
We’re currently sending out invitations to 35,000 new leads per month (125,000 total emails due to there being 4 emails, 3 days apart, in our sequence) and the overall email strategy is generating 2/3rds of our new members. 
The AI Prompt We Use to Get Great Results
When using AI (whether via Clay, Instantly, or directly on ChatGPT or Claude) you need to put in a prompt explaining what you want to get a good output. 
Here’s the prompt we use. You can modify it for your target market and call to action. Play around with various options before you run it on all your leads.  
(Why do we give so much good stuff away, well, because we want you to 
join our community
 and take our next 
B2B SaaS Growth Program
 starting May 22, 2025) 
#CONTEXT# Act as a great cold email copywriter designed to get these Software-as-a-Service CEOs to join our next weekly mastermind call. I am a peer to them, not a salesperson. I sold my SaaS business for $169M. I am a successful SaaS CEO and founder like them who is inviting them to join my private mastermind group focused on helping them grow their business faster and have an even more successful exit (sale) of their company. We already have 500 members in our community and based on their background they have qualified to join our community as well.


#OBJECTIVE# Write a compelling yet brief two sentence email opener for {{First Name}}, who is the {{Job Title}} at {{Company Name}}, demonstrating that you've done substantial research on them, reviewing their {{Headline}}, {{Summary}}, and {{Company Domain}}. Use specific facts or knowledge about {{First Name gained from their {{Headline}}, {{Summary}}, and {{Company Domain}}. Choose quirky or lesser known facts to highlight that you've done real research and so that your message is memorable and stands out. Be sure to invite them to join next week's growth mastermind call in the second sentence while building credibility by mentioning that I am also a SaaS CEO who exited my company for $169M and now I'm building a community of peers. Keep the email intro to a maximum of two sentences and 30 words.


#INSTRUCTIONS# 1. Research First Name's LinkedIn profile, focusing on their {{Headline}}, {{Summary}}, and {{Company Domain}} to gather unique insights. 2. Create an engaging and personalized email opener. 3. Use a tone that is entrepreneurial and casual, avoiding corporate jargon like leverage.


#EXAMPLES# Example Input: First Name: John, Job Title: CEO, Company Name: Tech Innovations, Headline: "Revolutionizing cloud storage," Summary: "Experienced leader with a passion for cutting-edge solutions.", Company Domain:"techinnovations.com" Example Output: "John, loved how Tech Innovations is democratizing cloud storage. I'm a fellow SaaS CEO and sold my last business for $169M--I'd love to have you join one of our upcoming SaasRise growth masterminds!"
The Results We Got After Switching to AI-Personalized Cold Email
The proof is in the pudding… 
What results did we see after making the upgrade to AI-personalized cold email? 
We saw clickthrough rates (CTRs) on our outbound prospecting email reach outs increase by 465% from a baseline of 2.0% without AI-personalization to 11.3% with AI personalization. Here are the actual results from within our Instantly account. 
Our actual CTR on Instantly, before and after AI-personalization of the messages
After the initial emails go out, we send a short follow-up every 3 days for a total of 4 emails over 9 days (day 0, 3, 6, and 9). 
If the prospect unsubscribes we don’t contact them again, but if they engage (click), we put them on a longer 15 email sequence (with long-form article content like this) designed to provide a LOT of free value to help demonstrate the value of joining the SaasRise growth mastermind community. 
There are 450,000 SaaS CEOs and Founders globally (we know, we built a list of all of them) and so if we can reach 35,000 new leads per month, it will take us one year for us to reach out to all of them using personalized AI. We are working on ramping up our infrastructure so we can go faster. 
Of the 35,191 cold SaaS CEO and founder leads we’ve reached out to over the last month, 3,976 CLICKED on at least one email (11.3% of the leads), resulting in 150 additional qualified applications to join our community per month and 30 additional paying SaasRise members (
resulting in $336k in New ARR in just the last 30 days
). 
This means that in a 12 month period if we keep seeing the same results, this strategy will yield $4.03M in additional annual recurring revenue for our business. 
So yes, this is working.  
Strategy Sidenote: 
We go for clicks as we have a low initial price point ($197/mo) with a free 14 day trial and our goal is to get folks to apply. Other firms with a higher ACV and/or demo-led sales process sometimes will optimize for reply rate instead of click rate.
Combining Cold Email With Digital Ads for B2B Brand Omnipresence
We recently passed 500 paying SaasRise members and people ask me how we’ve grown so quickly (we started the community just 18 months ago). 
The answer: AI-personalized outbound + content + ads → all targeting the same ABM lead list. 
AI cold email alone is helpful – but it’s cold email COMBINED with putting out GREAT CONTENT WEEKLY, and making your brand omnipresent through matched audience ads, retargeting ads, lookalike ads, and thought leadership ads THAT REALLY MOVES the needle. 
Use AI-personalized cold email. Target sending to about 30k-60k new cold leads per month depending on the size of your ABM lead list. 
Show these same people ads everywhere they go on the internet. 
Put out great content (like this) once per week. 
We’ve bootstrapped from $0 to $3.9M in ARR in 18 months using this content-led, invitation led strategy combined with retargeting ads, matched audience ads, and lookalike ads on Meta, LinkedIn, Google, and Adroll (plus some Thought Leadership boosted post ads on LinkedIn which work like jam on hotcakes). 
Our ARR has gone from $0 to $3.9M in 18 months using this strategy
Outbound Campaign Costs 
We are spending about $5k per month on our cold email strategy. This breaks down as: 
Expected costs to send out 125,000 cold AI-personalized emails per month
Here’s an 
Outbound Email Calculator
 you can copy and use that will estimate your costs and ROI depending on your volume. 
Here is our 
Outbound Email Calculator
 you can copy and use that will estimate your costs and ROI depending on your volume. 
Setting Up Instantly for High-Deliverability Email Sending
Why Use Instantly?
AI-personalized openers are 
half the battle
—the other half is 
getting your emails delivered.
 Instantly allows you to send at 
scale
 while keeping deliverability high. 
Step-by-Step Guide to Email Sending with Instantly
1. Setting Up Domains and Inboxes
Using your main domain for cold email? 
Big mistake.
 You need alternative domains to prevent email blacklisting. 
Sign up for Instantly and select “Done-for-You Email Setup” 
Purchase multiple sending domains – Example: 
getsaasrise.co
, 
joinsaasrise.co
, 
meetsaasrise.co
Create 5 inboxes per domain (Instantly’s limit per domain) 
Set up domain forwarding 
2. Enable Email Warm-Up
Before sending real emails, inboxes need to warm up (fake emails sent/received in a closed network to boost credibility). 
Turn on email warm-up for each inbox 
Run warm-up for 7-14 days before sending real emails 
Monitor inbox placement – Ensure 70%+ land in the primary inbox (otherwise tweak settings). 
3. Structuring a Winning Cold Email Sequence
A well-designed sequence maximizes responses: 
Email 1 (AI-Personalized Opener) – The hook 
Email 2 (Value-Driven Content) – Share a free report or webinar 
Email 3 (Short, Reply-Oriented Message) – Example: 
"Hey [Name], I’ve got a SaaS M&A report with 1,000+ data points. Want a copy?"
Email 4 (Long-Form Thought Leadership) – Industry insights or case study 
Email 5 (Final Call to Action) – A soft check-in with a clear ask 
4. Tracking Performance & Optimization
Inside Instantly, monitor these key metrics: 
Click-through rate (CTR) – Aim for 6-10% 
Reply rate – 1-5% is solid 
Bounce rate – Keep below 3% 
Our Marketing ROI 
Our total cost to generate ~$4M in additional ARR per year?  
Well we spend $34k in Sales & Marketing costs per month currently (of which we spend $5k on this cold email strategy and the rest on ads + sales team + software). So we’re turning $34k in S&M costs into about $336k in New ARR per month, a 10:1 ratio of ARR to S&M costs. 
Anytime you’re generating $10 in ARR for every $1 on S&M spend, you’re onto something. Some firms are happy with $1 in ARR for $1 in S&M spend. 
I like to look at the ROI in terms of the entire S&M strategy – as while cold email might generate the lead, it usually takes months of ads + warm email + SDR reach outs to actually get them over the finish line.  
Remember it’s multi-touch that closes the customer – not one particular channel.  
Final Thoughts
Cold email is not dead—
but lazy, generic cold email is.
 AI personalization, combined with 
automated, high-deliverability sending
, is the key to scaling outreach that 
actually gets responses.
Use 
Clay + Instantly
 to transform your outbound strategy, 
get more replies, close more deals, and grow your business faster.
🚀 
Start implementing today and watch your results skyrocket!
  
I hope this guide helped! Let me know your thoughts, and I’ll see you next time with another deep dive. 
Ryan
P.S. - If you want the 
full SaaS Growth Course
, it’s free inside the SaasRise community. 
Apply to join here
 and start your 
two-week free trial today
. 
Join Our Community of SaaS CEOs & Founders
Thanks for reading. We hope this SaaS M&A Report 2025 has been helpful to you. Please take a moment to learn more about 
SaasRise
, our community for SaaS CEOs and Founders. We welcome all CEOs and Founders with $1M-$100M in ARR to join us. We hold three masterminds each week for our members and provide an in-depth library of SaaS growth, fundraising, and exit resources. You can 
apply here
. 
We’re now up to 500 members in SaasRise, representing over $3B in ARR
Apply to Join SaasRise Here 
See you next week with more killer SaaS scaling content! 
  
Join Our Community for SaaS CEOs at $1M+ in ARR
If you like this type of content, please apply to join 
SaasRise
 our community for SaaS CEOs with $1M-$100M in ARR here. It’s a mastermind community of growth-focused SaaS CEOs. Membership is $197 per month – but might just be the difference between your firm making it across the chasm and getting to a successful nine figure outcome from a PE firm or strategic acquirer. 
  
Thanks for reading! If you liked this article, join the SaasRise community at 
www.saasrise.com
 for even more helpful growth content and weekly SaaS CEO masterminds. 
About The Author
Ryan Allis is the founder of 
SaasRise
, the mastermind community for growth-focused SaaS CEOs with $1M-$100M in ARR. He is a three time INC 500 CEO. He was previously CEO of iContact and grew the firm as founder/CEO to 70,000 customers, 1 million users, 300 employees, $50M per year in sales, and an exit for $169M to Vocus (NASDAQ:VOCS). 
Since the sale of iContact, Ryan has been the CEO coach to high-growth SaaS firms including Instantly, Tatango, Seamless.ai, Pipeline, Datalyse, Green Packet, Revenue Accelerator, Galleon, Clearstream, YouCanBookMe, Retreaver, and EventMobi. Ryan has been part of the EO and Summit Series communities.
He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School, where he was Co-President of the Social Enterprise Club and a member of the Harvard Graduate School Leadership Institute. He’s passionate about helping recurring revenue software companies grow and exit.
We’ll see you next time with more great SaaS growth and scaling content!

6 Easy Tips To Nail It For Your Team͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ 
 
View in browser
 
We don't just help you recognize employees- we help you know them
­
Hey, 
Briza
!
 
On Employee Appreciation Day your team will see LinkedIn posts of other companies celebrating. If you don’t acknowledge their hard work, they 
will
 notice (and not in a good way).
 
Here’s six easy tips to get it right-
 
💙 Don’t forget to celebrate.
 Seems easy, but so many leaders get too busy and let the day pass. Even if you do something small or last-minute, please don’t let EAD pass you by.
 
💙 Make it personal.
 A heartfelt message from leadership > a copy-paste template. Employees who get a custom message have a 
34% better experience
.
 
💙 Let them share their feels.
 Give employees the opportunity to share their gratitude for the experience anonymously. We know this might be scary, but we see thousands of these messages and they are universally heartfelt and wholesome.
“I got tea for my wife who's recovering from surgery—she’s a tea addict. Never seen a company go this far to show they care. Love this stuff.” 
- Real Knowwn Recipient
 
💙 Let them 
pick their gift
.
 One branded water bottle ≠ universal joy.
 
💙 Skip the generic gift card.
 If it’s last-minute, a thoughtful pick still wins over a “here’s $15, good luck.”
 
💙 Small budgets, big impact.
 Even a $25 gift can get a five-star reaction. It’s the thought that counts (literally).
 
Need an easy way to nail this? We got you.
Employee Appreciation Day is Friday, March 7
Pre-Schedule Your EAD Gifts 
 
With joy,
­
PS: Interested in more bespoke recognition solutions for your team? 
Talk to us!

View this email in your browser
Stepping Forward with Gratitude and Purpose
Briza
,
Fifteen years ago, I began my journey with NAMI Chicago—then NAMI Greater Chicago—as an intern. At the time, we operated out of a small storefront on Chicago Avenue, a far cry from the dynamic organization we are today. Yet, despite our new home in Old Town, our core remains unchanged: 
a deep commitment to making mental health care accessible, equitable, and rooted in dignity
. Above all, we continue to ensure that individuals, families, and their loved ones are seen, supported, and uplifted through both the challenges of mental health and the joy of recovery.
Today, as I share the news of 
my transition out of the role of CEO
, I do so with a heart full of gratitude and confidence in the future of this incredible organization. Our values—compassion, integrity, and connection—will continue to guide NAMI Chicago through this transition and beyond. These principles have been our foundation, and they will remain the driving force behind everything we do.  
Serving as CEO of NAMI Chicago has been one of the greatest honors of my life. The privilege of walking alongside those navigating the complexities of mental health, working with brilliant minds to challenge broken systems, and witnessing the power of human connection has shaped me in ways I will always carry forward. 
To every person who has mentored me, challenged me, and tested my belief in love and humanity—thank you
. Your kindness, wisdom, and unwavering commitment have left an indelible mark on my heart. 
This is not a departure from the fight for mental health equity—it is a 
renewed commitment to the work that still lies ahead
. We know the challenges in healthcare, mental health access, and justice are immense, but we do not turn away. We meet them with conviction, innovation, and urgency because our communities deserve nothing less. 
NAMI Chicago remains strong, stable, and ready for its next chapter
. As I continue to lead through the summer into early fall, I look forward to supporting the next CEO in stepping into this vital role. Whoever you are, know that this work is waiting for you, and you will have the support of an extraordinary team and community. 
But before I go,
 
I hope you’ll join me for one final 
Light the Darkness
 gala
—where they’re still trusting me with a microphone (bold move, team!). It will be a night to celebrate all we’ve accomplished together, honor advocates and changemakers to reflect on the impact we’ve made, and to rally for the future we’re building.
A special and deep thank you to my friend, my forever teacher, and my soul sister, 
Jen McGowan-Tomke
, who has made this journey the ride of a lifetime. 
To every partner, NAMI Chicago Board Member, advocate, donor, and supporter—your belief in our mission has made NAMI Chicago what it is today
. I am forever grateful for your dedication and for the honor of doing this work alongside you. 
With gratitude and hope, 
Alexa James 
CEO, NAMI Chicago 
Join Us for Light the Darkness

subject: How to build elite finance teams | Part 2
body:
Two hypergrowth CFOs explain talent retention techniques, investments that every company should be making, and metrics that go unnoticed by most CFOs.͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ 
 
FEBRUARY 26, 2025
 
­
Matthew Huo
Editor
You all loved last week’s issue: How to build elite finance teams, Part 1.
 
Once again, we’re borrowing from two unicorn CFOs: Razzak Jallow and Adil Syed.
In case you missed it, Razzak has worked on finance teams at Apple, Adobe, Looker, and Google. Most recently, he’s helped FloQast scale to over $100M in revenues.
Adil helped Rippling grow from <$5M to $100M+ ARR. Prior to Rippling, he spent time at Goldman Sachs, helped scale Snap, and invested at Redpoint Ventures (investing in Twilio, Stripe, and Zendesk).
For more content like this, join our webinar
 with Razzak and Adil on Feb. 27th @ 11am PT  ➡️ 
Register here.
Key takeaways
2 unicorn CFOs:
 Do this to rapidly scale finance teams
Action audit:
 Critical steps for talent retention
Heat map:
 Visualize software engineer salaries in the U.S.
More tariffs:
 President Trump plans 25% import tax on UK steel
🌱 Part 2: Scaling finance teams to $100M
In Part 1, we covered how Adil Syed (Rippling) and Razzak Jallow (FloQast) transformed their finance teams from isolated number-crunchers into strategic business partners.
 
Now, let's dive into how they built the infrastructure, talent, and data capabilities to support hypergrowth.
 
Make data your advantage, not your obstacle
 
As companies scale, 
centralized decision-making becomes increasingly difficult.
 
Both CFOs emphasize that in order to maintain strategic alignment across a rapidly scaling company, finance orgs must create “data democracy.”
What does that mean?
Razzak solved this by creating a 
dedicated business intelligence (BI) team
. "As companies get bigger, it's really hard to centralize decision-making," he explains. "You're hiring all these great smart people. You need to enable them to make the best decisions."
 
His BI team established what he calls "
data democracy
," allowing everyone with access to their BI tool to:
 
Quickly analyze data
Get insights independently
Make better decisions
Stay aligned with company goals
 
Adil took an even more integrated approach at Rippling. He restructured their entire data organization to align with business units, with 
dedicated data analysts
 supporting:
 
Core FP&A and strategic finance
Risk operations
Sales and marketing
R&D teams
Customer experience
 
Adil mentioned that the second they organized the team this way, everything started to take off. 
Finance had clear partners
 to help with decisions in sales and marketing, and there was a clear data analyst that could work with you.
When scaling your finance team, don’t let the lack of data accessibility be the bottleneck for scaling. Take a proactive approach, as establishing effective data teams requires significant time and iterative strategic planning.
The overlooked metrics that matter
Beyond standard financials, the best CFOs track granular operational metrics. Adil breaks these metrics into three levels:
 
Ground level metrics
Individual sales rep performance
Marketing campaign effectiveness
Sales call outcomes
Customer interaction quality
 
Team level metrics
Account coverage
Market penetration
Close win rates
Department efficiency
 
Strategic metrics
Product usage patterns
Customer experience indicators
Net retention drivers
Cross-sell effectiveness
 
But, while diving deep is important, it’s also critical to be able to rally the company around 
a few key metrics 
to actually build momentum—one common measurement that you're all marching towards. 
 
These might focus on adoption, NPS, or other strategic priorities, but they must be consistently discussed in monthly business reviews, quarterly business reviews, and board meetings.
 
Wrapping up
This completes our two-part series on Scaling Finance Teams to $100M.
 
The key takeaway? Build a foundation of strong accounting and embedded finance partners, then amplify their impact through data democratization and alignment on key metrics.
 
This creates a virtuous cycle where better tools enable better talent retention, which in turn drives better business outcomes.
 
👉 Don’t forget to 
register
 for Razzak and Adil’s webinar on this very topic!
📝 Action audit
01
Launch anonymous employee surveys: 
 Focus specifically on time allocation. Have employees estimate their time spent between manual and strategic work, then use this data to identify where technology investment into automation would have the biggest impact.
02
Create a metrics alignment document:
 Work with leadership to narrow down five to nine critical metrics that everyone in the company should ultimately rally behind.
🔥 Hot links
 
Heatmap of software engineer salaries in the U.S.
President Trump plans 25% import tax on UK steel
A guide to tax season for founders, from Rippling & Puzzle
­
📊 Chart of the week
 
 
Software engineer pay heat map (adjusted for cost of living)
Thinking about your engineering payroll? This map might help. It’s no surprise that San Francisco would have the highest average salary for software engineers.
 
But when you adjust for cost of living,
 it’s actually Seattle ($196k/yr) that has the highest 
relative salary for software engineers.
 
In fact, even areas in Alabama ($175k/yr) and Austin ($164k/yr) pay more than San Francisco ($149k/yr) after adjusting for cost of living.
 
Source: 
Levels.fyi

subject: 2025 Employer’s Guide to Wage and Hour Regulations
body:
Professionals Learning
Navigating 2025 Wage & Hour Laws: A Compliance Guide
Live Webinar 
Date: 
March 21, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 90 Minutes
Register Now
 
Wage and Hour laws are important aspects of any business. This webinar will concentrate on federal and state wage and hour requirements that must be followed in the payroll department. By joining this live class, participants will master the intricacies of calculating gross and overtime pay, demystifying the terminology used by the Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) regarding hours worked.
Moreover, our industry-led expert speaker, Vicki M. Lambert will offer you an understanding that will help you determine which law to follow state or federal. And, how does the SECURE Act affect student loan garnishments? She will walk you through the complexities of wage and hour regulations, minimizing risks and ensuring your payroll practices are both accurate and compliant. 
Expert Speaker:
 Vicki M. Lambert, CPP, is President and Academic Director of The Payroll Advisor, a firm specializing in payroll education and training. The company’s website wwwthepayrolladvisorcom offers a payroll news service that keeps payroll professionals up-to-date on the latest rules and regulations.
167 Madison Avenue Ste 205 #227 New York City, NY 10016 | support@professionalslearningcom

subject: [Expensify] Travel and expense, at the speed of chat
body:
tl;dr - Introducing Expensify Travel: fully managed corporate travel via web, app, or chat – now available to every Expensify member
 
Travel and expense should go hand in hand… and now they can! We've long been asked by customers big and small for the ability to: 
Book flights, hotels, rail, and car rentals from inside the app.
Limit what inventory employees see to only what is in the authorized travel policy.
Pay for these bookings using a central virtual card.
Capture the travel receipts into an automatic expense report.
Cut travel costs
In 
New Expensify
, press the green + button 
> Book travel
 (or in 
Expensify Classic
, click the 
Travel
 button along the left side of the screen). It does all the things you expect (in-policy booking results, travel-based spend analysis, out-of-policy notices, approvals before booking, duty-of-care reporting), plus a few tricks you don't – courtesy of the realtime chat framework of the New Expensify superapp: 
Realtime duty of care
, which lets you know where all your employees are at all times. We even connect the traveler and travel manager in a dedicated chat room to discuss all bookings and changes the instant they happen, rather than whenever you get around to checking your inbox.
Realtime expense management,
 where every booking receipt and change fee is recorded as an expense that's submitted up through Expensify's realtime approval and next-day reimbursement engine: book today, get paid tomorrow!
Realtime collaboration
, where shared trip chat rooms are automatically created in New Expensify so that everyone is on the same page. From employees to managers, everything you need to know about your trip, all in one place. 
The instant, chat-first design of New Expensify is why we like to say that Expensify does:
Travel and expense at the speed of chat.
To check it out, open your Expensify app and click 
Travel
, or take a peek below!
It's one of the most exciting times to be at Expensify that I can ever remember. We have a 
lot
 going on, and it's energizing to be sharing it with you after so long in development. Keep an eye out for a ton more on the way!
-david
Founder and CEO of Expensify
Questions? Ask me in the 
#new-expensify-feedback
 room! 
PS: Check out OpenAI's work on building an 
artificial engineer
 to solve Expensify App open source projects!
Sent by: Expensify, Inc. - 548 Market St #61434 - San Francisco, CA 94103
To unsubscribe, please click 
here

subject: Register Today: Navigating Title VII Compliance Amid DEI Policy Changes
body:
Get expert guidance to navigate evolving immigration policies and ICE enforcement actions.
 
 
Following President Donald Trump’s recent executive orders changing diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) initiatives, organizations face a complex and evolving compliance landscape. As you reassess hiring, promotion, and training policies, ensure they don’t unintentionally favor protected characteristics, which could violate Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964. 
Get a front row seat to a conversation with SHRM’s CHRO and two legal experts as they give insights and best practices to navigate policy changes impacting Title VII.
Attendees will also receive 1 PDC toward SHRM-CP
®
 or SHRM-SCP
®
 recertification.
 
 
 
Key Insights
 
Recent Executive Orders: Impact on inclusion and diversity (I&D) initiatives in your organization.
 
Title VII Compliance: Key considerations for aligning with federal anti-discrimination laws.
 
Reviewing Policies: Steps to adjust hiring, promotion, and training to avoid unintentional preferential treatment.
Best Practices: Balancing compliance while fostering an inclusive workplace culture
.
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
Meet the Speakers
 
 
 
 
Jim Link
CHRO, SHRM
Jim Link is the CHRO at SHRM. He previously held leadership positions at General Electric, the Pillsbury Company, and Porsche Cars. In his most recent role as CHRO for Randstad North America, Link led a global team of 150 HR professionals who were instrumental in transforming the company into an award-winning, inclusive, and sustainable global leader.
 
 
 
 
Patricia Timmons-Goodson
Dean and Chief Academic Officer, NCCU School of Law
Patricia Timmons-Goodson serves as the dean and chief academic officer of North Carolina Central University School of Law. Her professional career represents more than three decades of unflinching and powerfully effective public service. After serving as a prosecutor, legal aid lawyer, trial judge and intermediate appellate judge, she was appointed to the Supreme Court of North Carolina by Gov. Michael Easley.
 
 
 
 
Tara Singh Param
Partner, Holland & Knight
Tara Singh Param is a partner at Holland & Knight. She is an experienced trial lawyer and trusted advisor who helps public and private companies navigate complex labor and employment issues. She partners with clients to design and implement strategies that mitigate risk, safeguard business interests, and support corporate transactions.
 
 
Navigating policy changes isn’t just about knowing the rules — it’s about having the right solutions at the right time.
 
 
 
 
SHRM members stay ahead of industry challenges because they have access to trusted resources and support like: 
How-to guides and toolkits to help build and review policies. 
24/7 compliance updates impacting workplaces at the local, state, and federal levels.
Expert advice for their most pressing questions through the SHRM HR Knowledge Advisors. 
The latest workplace news and research so they never fall behind.
A community of nearly 340,000 HR professionals to lean on for various issues, topics, and experiences.
Join SHRM today to ensure you’re equipped for the challenges today and year-round.

subject: Teamwork Just Got an Upgrade—Ready for an Adventure with Let’s Roam?
body:
When you start a chat with your team make sure to... 
 
Hi Briza, 
  
We know that a strong team isn’t built in a day—it’s crafted through shared experiences, genuine connections, and a touch of adventure. That’s why we’re excited to introduce new ways to build your dream team with 
Let’s Roam’s scavenger hunts
! 
Unlock the Magic of Shared Moments✨ 
In today’s fast-paced world, thriving teams aren’t just about hitting targets—they’re about building a culture of trust and creativity. As highlighted in 
The Culture Code by Daniel Coyle
, the most successful teams harness vulnerability, deep trust, and shared experiences to turn challenges into opportunities for growth. When every team member feels valued, innovation and collaboration naturally follow. 
Spotlight: Epic Team Building Adventures🔥 
Ready to transform everyday interactions into memorable experiences? Our latest adventures—from 
virtual escape rooms
 to dynamic 
in-person quests
—are designed to ignite creativity, dismantle barriers, and reveal the unique strengths of every team member. Picture a brainstorming session where every idea is celebrated and every challenge becomes a stepping stone towards success. 
Start a fun conversation! 🎉 Copy and paste this into your team chat: 
 
Tip of the Week: Ignite Your Team’s Spark📆 
Two-Minute Challenge: Kick off your day with a “mystery item” challenge. 
Find an oddball item from your desk—something you rarely notice—and share the story behind its significance
. This fun exercise not only sparks conversation but also uncovers shared values and unexpected connections that can inspire innovative thinking throughout the day. 
The Let’s Roam Advantage🧭 
At Let’s Roam, we believe that genuine connection is the cornerstone of any high-performing team. Our experiences are crafted to: 
• 
Strengthen Communication:
 Break down barriers and build trust through interactive, engaging activities. 
• 
Boost Creativity:
 Inspire out-of-the-box thinking with playful problem-solving challenges.
• 
Foster Lasting Connections:
 Create shared memories that help your team thrive long after the adventure ends. 
Rise & Thrive 🌱 
Every day is a new opportunity to learn and grow together. With Let’s Roam by your side, you can transform routine interactions into exciting experiences that keep your team agile, motivated, and united—ready to tackle any challenge that comes your way. 
Jumpstart your next team adventure! 
Claim Your Tickets
!
 and ignite your team’s energy! 
  
Here’s to many more shared victories and adventures,
 
Let's Roam 
 
 
 
 
Let's Roam, LLC, 4023 Kennett Pike, #50241, Wilmington, DE 19807, United States, 1-(833)-202-ROAM (7626)

subject: Celebrating 25 Years with Client Stories
body:
We celebrated our 25th anniversary in December with our clients. Here are their stories of working with Highand. 
Click here
 to view this message in a browser window.
 
Welcome!
At Highland, we help ambitious leaders launch digital products, reimagine customer experiences, and find new markets for growth
This month, we’re highlighting some incredible client experiences shared by a panel of our clients at our 
25th Anniversary Celebration
 in December. Their stories showcase the power of strategic design, human-centered innovation, and trust-based partnerships. From financial institutions and government agencies to non-profits and global associations, our clients have shared how working with Highland has reshaped their organizations in meaningful ways.
Talk soon,
Jon
Jon Berbaum
 | President | 
Schedule a call
Reimagining Impact: How Make-A-Wish Illinois Transformed Wish Granting
Stephanie Springs, CEO, Make-A-Wish Illinois
At 
Make-A-Wish Illinois
, the focus had always been on delivering magical, high-quality wish experiences to children and their families. But what about the lasting impact of the wish? Through a strategic partnership with Highland, the organization realized they needed to shift their mindset: What if a wish wasn’t just a single moment, but an entire journey with meaningful moments along the path?
“Highland challenged us to rethink our approach. We weren’t just granting wishes—we were creating lifelong impactful experiences. Through experience mapping and deep conversations with families, we saw that the most transformative experiences weren’t necessarily only about the trip or the event itself, but the emotional and relational journey before, during, and after.”
This new framework didn’t just change Make-A-Wish Illinois—it reshaped how Make-A-Wish operates grants wishes nationally. Today, every wish granted by chapters across the county uses  the Wish Journey Model, a concept that was born out of this collaboration.
And it didn’t stop there. The organization continues to refine every stage of the journey, ensuring that each wish leaves a lasting imprint on the lives of 
both recipients and their familie
s.
From Startup to Scalable Success: The Power of Open Dialogue
John Iberl, Electronic License Service (ELS)
When John Iberl first launched 
Electronic License Service
, he had 
a vision but needed the right partners
 to bring it to life. Over a cup of coffee at a local Starbucks, he met 
Highland’s Brian Sutherland
, who saw the potential for ELS to 
revolutionize vehicle registration.
Fast forward, and ELS has processed 
over 30 million transactions worth billions of dollars
 for government agencies. But the secret to success wasn’t just technology—it was the 
culture of collaboration and continuous learning
 Highland helped foster.
“We built a system with real-time transactions, inventory tracking, print-on-demand stickers, and full financial reporting. But what really made the difference was the way we worked together. Highland brought mentorship, open dialogue, and an iterative approach that allowed us to pivot and grow. 
If we made a mistake, we fixed it. If we missed something, we owned it.
 That’s the kind of partnership that leads to success.”
This transparent, problem-solving mindset has allowed ELS to scale seamlessly while maintaining 
accountability and innovation at its core.
Bringing Order to Chaos: Scaling ISACA’s Membership Strategy
Liz Pisney, ISACA
With 
180,000 members worldwide
, 
ISACA
 had grown exponentially but struggled to 
scale effectively.
 Different teams were working in silos, moving in different directions, and lacking a cohesive strategy. Enter Highland.
“We were all pulling in different directions. Then we joined Highland’s cohort on 
the future of membership,
 and suddenly, things started to click. We realized we weren’t alone—other associations were facing the same challenges. Having the research and structure from Highland helped us align our strategy and start making meaningful progress.”
The insights from this initiative have helped ISACA move beyond 
reactive growth
 to a 
scalable, future-focused membership strategy.
 And while the transformation is ongoing, Liz credits Highland with helping them shift from 
“chaos mode” to a clear, strategic vision.
Human-Centered Innovation: The Highland Difference
Jeffrey Bojar, Gloo
For 
Gloo’s
 legal and product teams, the challenge wasn’t just about innovation—it was about ensuring that every breakthrough truly served their customers. Enter Highland, whose relentless customer-first approach reshaped how Gloo thinks about product development.
“If there’s one thing Highland has instilled in us, it’s that the customer must always be at the center. It’s easy to fall in love with our own ideas and forget what really matters. But with Highland, every decision, every feature, every strategy starts with deep research and real customer insights. When we prioritize the customer, we always win.”
By embedding experience mapping, user research, and qualitative insights into their process, Gloo has refined its products, deepened user engagement, and fostered a culture of continuous improvement. The result? More impactful innovation, greater customer satisfaction, and a team that doesn’t just build products—but builds with purpose.
25 Years Strategizing about the Future
Highland
 is an innovation and digital consultancy. We are celebrating 25 years of helping ambitious leaders launch digital products, reimagine customer experiences, and find new markets for growth. 
When you have a targeted research, design, or development project to discuss, reply to this email or click 
here
 to tell us about the opportunity you're pursuing.
Contact Us
 
Highland is an innovation and digital consultancy.
We help ambitious leaders launch digital products, reimagine customer experiences, and find new markets for growth. 
If you do not wish to receive future email, 
click here
.
125 South Clark St., Suite 670, Chicago, IL 60603

Hi Briza,
I wanted to follow up and see if you had any time next week for a quick call regarding HelpOne.
Let me know what works best for you!
Thanks,
Heidi
From: Heidi
Sent: 20 Feb 2025
To: b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
Subject: Briza | Call Request
Hi Briza,
Imagine a Help Desk agent receives a call: an employee needs a PIN or password reset, but they’re also asking to update call forwarding and set a simultaneous ring. The agent quickly realizes they’ll need to escalate this – it’s a job for the UC and telecom teams… or at least, it used to be.
With HelpOne, that story has a new ending. HelpOne enables Tier One Help Desk agents to handle these telecom requests on the spot without needing to involve the UC or IT teams. It’s designed to empower Help Desk agents with configurable access to changes like phone PIN and password resets, call settings, provisioning, and more – all through an intuitive interface that anyone can easily learn.
Changes are instant, taking effect immediately, with an email confirmation sent to the employee in seconds. Compatible with single and multi-vendor environments, HelpOne integrates with UC and telecom systems from 
Cisco®, Microsoft® Teams, Avaya®, and Zoom
, keeping processes consistent and simple.
Ready to see how HelpOne can transform your team’s efficiency?
Let’s schedule a demo to explore its potential capabilities.
Please let me know what time works best for you.
Thanks,
Heidi

subject: How to Host Events That Wow - Without Overspending
body:
Turn Your Next Event Into an Experience They’ll Remember! 
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
  
About 
 |  
Global Sales Team

Collection  
|  
Update Preferences
 
The Secret to Creating Memorable Events with Limited Resources
 
Planning an unforgettable corporate event doesn’t have to mean breaking the budget. The key lies in maximizing your resources by prioritizing experiences that leave a lasting impression. Begin by choosing a venue that offers built-in amenities and services, such as hotels and resorts with meeting-ready spaces, on-site catering, and team-building activities. These venues not only save you time and money by bundling services but also ensure a seamless experience for your attendees. Additionally, focus on details that make the event feel personalized, such as custom signage, branded materials, or interactive icebreakers tailored to your team’s culture. These small touches often have a greater impact than elaborate - and expensive - decor.
 
Another secret to creating memorable events is leveraging the expertise of the venue’s staff. Many hotels and resorts have in-house event planners or coordinators who can help you design a creative itinerary that works within your budget. Collaborate with these experts to take advantage of the property’s unique features, like outdoor spaces for networking under the stars or spa packages for stress relief during retreats. By focusing on thoughtful planning and strategic partnerships, you can deliver a high-impact event that impresses stakeholders and energizes your team, even with limited resources.

subject: Attention Employers: ICE Intensifies Immigration Audits Starting in 2025
body:
Professionals Learning
2025 Immigration Enforcement: Prepare for ICE I-9 Audits and Raids
Live Webinar 
Date: 
March 12, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 90 Minutes
Register Now
 
Employers face increasing risks with tougher immigration enforcement and skyrocketing fines. Did you know Form I-9 violations can cost up to $2,861 per error and up to $28,619 for hiring unauthorized workers? Join our webinar, presented by our renowned speaker, “Margie Faulk”. Our course covers everything you need to protect your organization: Conduct thorough internal I-9 audits. Implement best practices for I-9 management, Prepare for audits and workplace raids, and Develop an effective immigration compliance policy. Gain practical skills to conduct internal audits, streamline verification processes, and respond confidently to workplace raids. Don’t leave your company vulnerable to costly penalties! Learn the essential tools to stay compliant, mitigate risks, and safeguard your business. 
Expert Speaker:
 Margie Faulk is a senior-level human resource professional with over 15 years of HR management and compliance experience. A current Compliance Advisor for HR Compliance Solutions, LLC, Margie, has worked as an HR Compliance advisor for major corporations and small businesses in the small, large, private, public, and non-profit sectors.

body:

Honoree Highlight: Dr. Ngozi O. Ezike
 
Join us in honoring Dr. Ngozi O. Ezike, one of four honorees at our Light the Darkness gala on Thursday, May 29, 2025, at The Geraghty Chicago. Learn more about 
Dr. Ezike
 and purchase your tickets to celebrate her 
here
.
Dr. Ezike became President and CEO of Sinai Chicago in June 2022. Previously, she served as Director of the Illinois Department of Public Health, leading the state through the Covid-19 pandemic. At Sinai, she has advanced health equity by expanding community health programs and investing in cutting-edge technology to enhance care.
Under her leadership, Sinai Chicago’s commitment to uncompensated charity care ranks in the top 10% nationwide. Dr. Ezike, a board-certified internist and pediatrician, holds degrees from Harvard and the University of California, San Diego, and a business management certificate from Harvard Business School. She has received numerous awards, including Crain’s Chicago Business 2024 Women of Note and USA Today’s Inaugural Women of the Year Award for Illinois. subject: ICE Raids Are Rising — Is Your Organization Prepared?
body:
Don’t let your workplace get caught off-guard. Access tools & support from SHRM.
 
 
Imagine this:
 U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agents arrive at your workplace without warning. Would you know what to do? Would your organization be protected? Ensuring I-9 compliance, conducting regular audits, and verifying employment authorization are critical in mitigating risks. 
Yet, more than half of HR professionals (52%) say their organizations are only slightly prepared — or not prepared at all — for the possibility of an ICE raid.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
As a SHRM Member, Get Exclusive Access to:
 
 
 
Checklist: 
Immigration (ICE) Workplace Preparedness Plan
Checklist:
 What to Do During an Immigration (ICE) Workplace Visit
 
Expert Guidance:
 
SHRM HR Knowledge Advisors
 offer expert guidance and resources to help you navigate HR challenges.
What You Need to Know About Form I-9:
 Stay informed as immigration laws evolve, incuding compliance, employment, and authorization.
Without the right resources, a single raid could disrupt your entire organization. With SHRM membership, you’ll have the tools and support you need to lead with confidence, no matter what comes your way. 
Join SHRM today
 and protect what matters most — your people and your business. 
The risks are real. The preparation is simple.

subject: Navigating Title VII: An Exclusive SHRM Webinar
body:
Get expert guidance to navigate evolving immigration policies and ICE enforcement actions.
 
 
Following President Donald Trump’s recent executive orders changing diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) initiatives, organizations face a complex and evolving compliance landscape. As you reassess hiring, promotion, and training policies, ensure they don’t unintentionally favor protected characteristics, which could violate Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964. 
Get a front row seat to a conversation with SHRM’s CHRO and two legal experts as they give insights and best practices to navigate policy changes impacting Title VII.
Attendees will also receive 1 PDC toward SHRM-CP
®
 or SHRM-SCP
®
 recertification.
 
 
 
Key Insights
 
Recent Executive Orders: Impact on inclusion and diversity (I&D) initiatives in your organization.
 
Title VII Compliance: Key considerations for aligning with federal anti-discrimination laws.
 
Reviewing Policies: Steps to adjust hiring, promotion, and training to avoid unintentional preferential treatment.
Best Practices: Balancing compliance while fostering an inclusive workplace culture
.
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
Meet the Speakers
 
 
 
 
Jim Link
CHRO, SHRM
Jim Link is the CHRO at SHRM. He previously held leadership positions at General Electric, the Pillsbury Company, and Porsche Cars. In his most recent role as CHRO for Randstad North America, Link led a global team of 150 HR professionals who were instrumental in transforming the company into an award-winning, inclusive, and sustainable global leader.
 
 
 
 
Patricia Timmons-Goodson
Dean and Chief Academic Officer, NCCU School of Law
Patricia Timmons-Goodson serves as the dean and chief academic officer of North Carolina Central University School of Law. Her professional career represents more than three decades of unflinching and powerfully effective public service. After serving as a prosecutor, legal aid lawyer, trial judge and intermediate appellate judge, she was appointed to the Supreme Court of North Carolina by Gov. Michael Easley.
 
 
 
 
Tara Singh Param
Partner, Holland & Knight
Tara Singh Param is a partner at Holland & Knight. She is an experienced trial lawyer and trusted advisor who helps public and private companies navigate complex labor and employment issues. She partners with clients to design and implement strategies that mitigate risk, safeguard business interests, and support corporate transactions.
 
 
Navigating policy changes isn’t just about knowing the rules — it’s about having the right solutions at the right time.
 
 
 
 
SHRM members stay ahead of industry challenges because they have access to trusted resources and support like: 
How-to guides and toolkits to help build and review policies. 
24/7 compliance updates impacting workplaces at the local, state, and federal levels.
Expert advice for their most pressing questions through the SHRM HR Knowledge Advisors. 
The latest workplace news and research so they never fall behind.
A community of nearly 340,000 HR professionals to lean on for various issues, topics, and experiences.
Join SHRM today to ensure you’re equipped for the challenges today and year-round. 
 
 
JOIN SHRM

subject: 2025 Strategies to Prevent FMLA, ADA and Workers’ Comp Abuse
body:
Professionals Learning
FMLA, ADA & Workers’ Comp: Preventing Leave Abuse in 2025
Live Webinar 
Date: 
February 26, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 90 Minutes
Register Now
 
Gain insights into how to define leave misuse, common ways employees misuse leave time, determining eligibility, and intermittent leave. Understand the key aspects necessary to navigate the FMLA, ADA, and Worker's compensation requirements effectively and ensure compliance within your organization. The speaker will also disclose the complexities of navigating complicated intersections between the FMLA and the ADA, to ensure your organization remains compliant with all relevant regulations while maintaining a productive and supportive workplace.
Coordinating compliance, handling intermittent leave, and determining reasonable accommodations under the FMLA, ADA, and Workers' Compensation laws can be challenging. Learn from our expert, Janette S. Levey, who will provide a working knowledge of how you can minimize your company’s exposure to employee misuse of the FMLA. 
Session Objectives:
Common Ways Employees Abuse Leave Time.
Defining Leave Abuse and Determining Eligibility.
Reasonable Accommodations under the ADA/ADAAA.
Alternatives to leave as tools for curbing FMLA Abuse.
Investigations of Suspected Leave Abuse and Intermittent leave. 
Leave and COVID concerns. 
Expert Speaker:
 Janette S. Levey, Principal Attorney of Levey Law, LLC, is an employment/HR attorney with over 20 years of legal experience. Ms. Levey is a legal wellness professional for employment practices and workforce challenges. She works with employers to craft solid employment practices wellness plans tailored to address an organization’s needs and concerns.

subject: Technology Is Complex. But Your Technology Strategy Shouldn't Be.
body:
How to simplify.
͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­͏     ­
Forwarded this email? 
Subscribe here
 for more
Technology Is Complex. But Your Technology Strategy Shouldn't Be.
How to simplify.
Connor Reece
Feb 21
 
READ IN APP
 
The 1s and 0s of software are complex.
Quantum computing is only fully understood by a handful of people on earth.
And as much as LLMs are "open source"? They are literally rocket science.
In other words...
Technology is complicated.
But our strategy around it shouldn't feel this way.
While the science of our tech tools may require deep expertise to understand...
The business outcomes we seek by leveraging them should be crystal clear for everyone on our team. For our clients. For our vendors.
Recent studies by Boston Consulting Group and McKinsey found that 70% of digital transformation efforts fail—not because of technology, but due to lack of clarity and execution.
In other words, it's not enough to have powerful tools at our disposal.
We need a clear vision for how we intend to use them to differentiate ourselves from our competition.
Here’s how to build a simpler tech strategy:
1) List Out Your Key Business Goals for 2025
If you haven’t already done this...
Now is the time.
Are you aiming to scale? Improve margins? Increase customer retention?
Clear business objectives serve as the foundation for every technology decision we make.
For example, another McKinsey study found that businesses with clear strategic goals aligned to digital transformation are 1.5x more likely to outperform competitors.
2) Define the Key Capabilities and Actions Required to Hit These Goals
Your success in 2025 will depend on people and processes—not just tech.
Where do we need better collaboration? More automation? Faster decision-making?
Most business problems are human performance problems first.
According to a Harvard Business Review study, companies that optimize human collaboration through technology see up to a 20% increase in productivity.
A great example is Slack’s implementation at IBM, which helped reduce internal emails by 30% and accelerated project turnaround times.
Define these needs clearly—
before
 introducing technology solutions.
3) Look at How Technology Can Support These Needs
Only once you've completed Steps 1 and 2 should you evaluate your tech stack.
Where is it already helping?
Where does it need improvement?
Too many businesses buy software first...
And then figure out how to use it.
Flip that around.
Start with the business need. Then find the right tech to fit it.
For instance, Salesforce reports that 57% of sales reps fail to meet their quotas, but teams using AI-driven CRM tools see a 15% boost in sales productivity.
Another example? Automation in finance. AI-driven bookkeeping platforms have reduced manual data entry time by over 40% for mid-sized businesses.
4) Protect Your Cybersecurity Downside
If you get hacked...
Everything else becomes harder.
A single breach can cost customers, cash flow, and credibility.
Cybercrime is expected to cost businesses over $10.5 trillion annually by 2025, according to Cybersecurity Ventures.
And a study by IBM found that the average cost of a data breach is $4.45 million.
Investing in cybersecurity isn’t just about compliance—it’s about protecting our ability to execute on every other goal.
If we've got great tech and a great strategy, but lack a robust defense plan...
We're at serious risk for failing to execute on our vision.
In Conclusion
Technology is complex.
But a technology plan shouldn’t be.
Use a simple framework like this to stay focused.
And save the complicated thinking for your actual technology execution.
(Which, of course, we can help with at Reboot.)
 
Like
Comment
Restack

Reboot Inc.
11 Municipal Drive, Suite 200, Fishers, IN 46038

Terms and Conditions
1. Earn 80,000 Hilton Honors Bonus Points
You can earn 80,000 Hilton Honors™ Bonus Points after you spend $2,000 (the "Threshold Amount") on eligible purchases on your Card in your first 6 months of Card Membership starting from the date that your account is opened. In rare instances, your period to spend $2,000 may be shorter than 6 months if there is a delay in receiving your Card. Also, purchases may fall outside of the 6 month period in some cases, such as a delay in merchants submitting transactions to us or if the purchase date differs from the date you made the transaction. (For example, if you buy goods online, the purchase date may be the date the goods are shipped). Eligible purchases to meet the Threshold Amount of this offer include those made by both the Basic and Additional Card Members on the Card Account. Eligible purchases are purchases for goods and services minus returns and other credits. Eligible purchases to meet the Threshold Amount of this offer do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchase of travelers checks, purchase or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or other cash equivalents. Hilton Honors Bonus Points will be credited to your Hilton Honors account 8-12 weeks after the Threshold Amount has been reached. Additional Card Members are not eligible to receive this offer. Bonus Points do not count toward elite tier qualification; for more information, visit 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
. Your Card account must not be canceled or past due at the time of fulfillment of any offers. 
If you have a history of cancelling or downgrading American Express Card accounts within your first year and you cancel or downgrade your new Card account within your first year, we may not credit, we may freeze, or we may take away the Hilton Honors Bonus Points from your account. If we determine that you have engaged in abuse, misuse, or gaming in connection with this offer in any way or that you intend to do so, including if you return purchases you made to meet the Threshold Amount, we may not credit, we may freeze, or we may take away the Hilton Honors Bonus Points from your account. We may also cancel any accounts you have with us. 
This offer is not transferable. American Express reserves the right to modify or revoke offer at any time.
2. Hilton Honors Bonus Points on Eligible Purchases
Hilton Honors Bonus Points earned using your Hilton Honors American Express Card: 
You will receive 3 Hilton Honors Bonus Points for each dollar of eligible purchases. 
You will receive 4 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points, for a total of 7, for each dollar of eligible purchases charged directly with a property within the Hilton portfolio, including bookings and incidental charges. To receive the 4 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for charges made at the time of booking, the booking must be made directly through a reservation channel operated by Hilton. You can receive the 4 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for incidental charges made at the hotel (including charges made at restaurants, spas, and other establishments) if those charges can be and are charged to your room and paid for with your Hilton Honors American Express Card at checkout. You will receive 2 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points, for a total of 5, for each dollar of eligible purchases at the following categories of merchants: restaurants located in the U.S., supermarkets located in the U.S. and on gasoline at gas stations located in the U.S. Note that purchases of groceries made at superstores, warehouse clubs, and convenience stores, and purchases from meal-kit delivery services will only get 3 Bonus Points per dollar. Purchases of gasoline at supermarkets, superstores, and warehouse clubs will only get 3 Bonus Points per dollar. To get additional Points for a restaurant purchase, the purchase must be at a restaurant located in the United States. You will NOT get additional Points for purchases made at a restaurant owned by a U.S. company but located outside the U.S. (e.g. Hard Rock Café in Paris). You also will NOT get additional Points for restaurant purchases at nightclubs, convenience stores, grocery stores, or supermarkets. You may not get additional Points for purchases at a restaurant located within another establishment (e.g. a restaurant inside a hotel, casino, or event venue). For example, purchases made at a restaurant located within a hotel may be recognized as a purchase at a hotel, not a restaurant. Your Hilton Honors Points are subject to Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions; see 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
.Eligible purchases are purchases for goods and services minus returns and other credits. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchases of travelers checks, purchases or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or purchases of other cash equivalents. Hilton Honors Bonus Points you earn with your Card will be posted to your Hilton Honors account up to 12 weeks after the end of your billing period. 
Merchants are assigned codes based on what they primarily sell. We group certain merchant codes into categories that are eligible for additional Points. A purchase with a merchant will not receive additional Points if the merchant’s code is not included in a reward category. You may not receive additional Points if we receive inaccurate information or are otherwise unable to identify your purchase as eligible for a reward category. For example, you may not receive additional Points when: a merchant uses a third-party to sell their products or services; or a merchant uses a third-party to process or submit your transaction to us (e.g., using mobile or wireless card readers); or you choose to make a purchase using a third-party payment account or make a purchase using a mobile or digital wallet. 
Please visit 
americanexpress.com/rewards-info
 for more information about rewards.
3. Hilton Honors Complimentary Silver Status
You will receive complimentary Hilton Honors Silver status with your Hilton Honors American Express Card. Complimentary Silver status beneﬁt is only available to the Basic Card Member. If your Hilton Honors American Express Card is cancelled for any reason, your complimentary Hilton Honors Silver status provided with the Card will be cancelled. American Express reserves the right to change, modify or revoke complimentary Silver status at any time. If your complimentary Silver status is cancelled, you may be able to maintain your Silver status by qualifying under the Hilton Honors Program terms. Silver status beneﬁts are subject to availability and vary by hotel. For more information on Silver status beneﬁts or how to maintain Silver status each year with qualifying stays, nights or Hilton Honors Base Points through the Hilton Honors Program, visit 
HiltonHonors.com/MemberBenefits
 and 
Hilton.com/en/Hilton-Honors/benefit-terms/
. The Hilton Honors Program, including the benefits of Hilton Honors Membership, are subject to Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions; see 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
. 
4. No Foreign Transaction Fees 
American Express will not charge any foreign transaction fee on the purchases you make outside of the United States with your Card. However, there may be circumstances where ATMs or merchants charge a fee on foreign transactions.

Unlocking Business Potential: The Benefits of Accounting and Controller Services for Entrepreneurs
Thursday, February 20, 2025 12:18 PM
 
In the fast-paced world of entrepreneurship and business management, the importance of maintaining impeccable financial records cannot be overstated. Accounting and controller services are the backbone of a well-oiled business machine, guiding entrepreneurs toward clarity and strategic growth.
Read more »
    
5 Steps to Protect Your Business from Unexpected Accounting Disruptions
Wednesday, February 19, 2025 3:56 PM
 
Accounting disruptions can strike without warning. Whether it’s a provider suddenly shutting down, platform glitches, or other unforeseen issues, these disruptions can leave your business scrambling. With cases like the sudden closure of Bench, which left businesses without their books, it’s more apparent than ever that 
entrepreneurs and business owners need a plan to safeguard their financial processes. 
Read more »

subject: Ready, Set, Roam: Ignite Your Team’s Next Adventure Now with Let’s Roam
body:
Keep your team-bonding spark alive all year long… 
 
Hey Briza,
Valentine’s may be over, but the spirit of connection doesn’t have to end! Keep that team-bonding spark alive with Let’s Roam’s fun, interactive adventures, ensuring every day feels as special as a holiday. 
More Than Tasks—Build True Connection🫱🏽‍🫲🏻 
According to 
Primal Leadership
 by Goleman, Boyatzis, and McKee, fostering positive emotions isn’t just a “feel-good” strategy—it’s the secret sauce behind high-performing teams. 
When leaders nurture morale and emotional intelligence, people feel supported and bring their best ideas forward. Want to keep that spark alive long after the festivities? With Let’s Roam’s 
virtual game nights
 and 
scavenger hunts
 help you create genuine connections, boost collaboration, and cultivate a workplace that grows together every day. 
Tip of the Week 🆕 
Time to infuse fun into your routine! Take two minutes for a lively dance-off or run a quirky office poll to rev up that collective energy. Ready to go bigger? Challenge your team to craft a motto that sums up who you are and why you rock—it’s your battle cry for all your upcoming adventures! 
Here at Let’s Roam, we’re all about those little moments—like a speedy sing-off or a rapid-fire trivia quiz—that spark big, collective energy. Want to take that synergy a step further? Challenge your team to craft a motto that sums up who you are and why you rock! Think of it like a battle cry for your next adventure. Ready, set, let’s hear those rallying words! 
 
Let’s Roam Fun Fact 📖 
Why settle for routine when you can ignite excitement every day? Let’s Roam’s 
immersive experiences
 – virtual or in-person – turn ordinary collaboration into an unforgettable shared adventure. Expect plenty of laughter, creativity, and a renewed sense of camaraderie that fuels bigger wins for your team! 
Looking Ahead to Ongoing Growth: Stronger Every Season 
Now that you’ve discovered how to elevate your team’s spirit, let’s make sure the fun and connection don’t fade. With Let’s Roam’s 
ever-evolving experiences
 bring fresh opportunities each season to challenge your team, spark laughter, and grow closer than ever—long beyond Valentine’s Day! 
Make It Happen All Year🌟 
All the good vibes in the world won’t make a difference unless you take action. Let Let’s Roam help you turn those positive feelings into practice. From brainstorming sessions turned fun challenges to adrenaline-fueled 
scavenger hunts
, we make team-building a natural extension of your day-to-day. 
Elevate your team’s positive energy—reserve your next Let’s Roam adventure and watch real results unfold! 
Here’s to your team’s next grand adventure,
Let’s Roam
Let's Roam, LLC, 4023 Kennett Pike, #50241, Wilmington, DE 19807, United States, 1-(833)-202-ROAM (7626)
