C-Suite to Main Street
VIRTUAL EVENT
Top strategies for thriving through change
February 27 | 12pm ET
Still on the fence about registering for our 
C-Suite to Main Street: Thriving Through Change
 masterclass on 
February 27 at noon ET
? Here are three reasons you should join us: 
‌
Get tips from a proven leader
: Saeju Jeong, Co-Founder of Noom, has navigated rapid growth and change while building one of the most successful brands in the health and wellness space. 
Gain actionable strategies
: You will walk away with clear strategies for testing ideas, keeping a customer-centric focus, and leading your team through transformation. 
It’s only 30 minutes!:
 It doesn’t take a full day to get the insights you need. Give us a half-hour, and we’ll give you invaluable leadership lessons that you can use throughout your entrepreneurial journey. 
REGISTER NOW
 
  
  
ABOUT NOOM
 
Founded in 2008, 
Noom
 is a digital healthcare company that connects people to content, coaching, and other resources to build healthy habits and promote better living. In 2015, Noom became the first app recognized by the CDC as a diabetes prevention program. More recently, the company launched Noom Mood to expand its offerings beyond weight loss, and in 2023, the company introduced Noom Med, a platform for obesity management.

subject: You’ve been visited by the ✨𝓌𝒾𝓃𝒹𝑜𝓌 𝑜𝒻 𝒸𝒽𝒶𝓃𝒸𝑒 ✨.
Master Inclusive Leadership: Sidestep DEI Pitfalls & Drive Real Change
body:
Professionals Learning
The Impact of DEI Rollbacks on Workplace Culture
Live Webinar 
Date: 
March 04, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 60 minutes
Register Now
 
Diversity, equity, and inclusion: this subject wasn't introduced to the workplace and organizations to spark controversies. However, the topic has been hot for a couple of weeks. Due to this reason, numerous organizations are retreating from the DEI policies. Now the question is how organizations can reframe their DEI policies for the modern workplace and avoid the buzz around the subject.
Join our expert speaker Suzanne Lucas she will share her insights and also practical tips on how can your DEI policies create an equal opportunity for your people instead of dividing individuals in the workplace. 
Session Objectives:
Focusing on fairness and opportunity instead of political rhetoric.
Building policies rooted in respect and equity.
Ensuring fair compensation and advancement opportunities for all employees.
Communicating inclusivity as a business strategy rather than a political agenda.
Using transparent and objective metrics to evaluate inclusivity. 
Expert Speaker:
Suzanne Lucas spent 10 years in corporate HR where she hired, fired, managed the numbers, and double-checked with the lawyers. She left the corporate world to advise people and companies on how to have the best Human Resources departments possible.
167 Madison Avenue Ste 205 #227 New York City, NY 10016 | support@professionalslearningcom

subject: FW: Briza
body:
Hi Briza,
I completely understand how hectic things can be, but I’d like to touch base. Could we schedule a quick call today, tomorrow or next week? Let me know what works for you, and I’ll accommodate your schedule.
Thanks,
Doris Robinson
From: Doris Robinson
Sent:19 Feb 2024
To:  b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
Subject: RE: Briza 
Hi Briza,
I am reaching out because you are the Chief of Staff, Office of the CEO at LCW and are responsible for improving the contact center’s overall operations and revenue.
Are you facing immense challenges with your contact center, such as the complexities of optimizing QA activities, leveraging data insights, and effectively training your contact center agents? With 30 years of experience, BPA Quality provides a comprehensive range of services, from expert training to data-driven insights, all aimed at transforming your customer service and achieving your desired customer excellence.
Our Services include Call Center Quality Monitoring, Sentiment Analysis, Expert QA for all Customer Contact Channels, Call Center Compliance, Emotional Intelligence Training, Sales Training, QA Process Improvement, Data Analytics and Business Intelligence, Coaching and Feedback, Contact Center Strategy, and more on demand.
Companies such as
 Samsung, USwitch, Radian, and British Gas
 have experienced significant transformations in their contact center operations, with tangible improvements in customer satisfaction, operational efficiency, and sales performance, all thanks to BPA Quality’s services.
We are eager to understand your current challenges with your contact center. Can we schedule a Zoom call to discuss these issues further?
Please let me know what time works for a call today or next week.
Thanks,
Doris Robinson

subject: Small business financing tips and best practices
body:

MIDNIGHT 
OIL
EDITION 292
Feeling the burn of late nights and early mornings at your business? Welcome to 
Midnight Oil
, a newsletter designed to fuel your entrepreneurial journey at every stage. Each week, we’ll send you a curated selection of timely tips, inspiring stories, and the latest small business news to keep you motivated and moving forward. Consider it your weekly shot of entrepreneurial espresso.
  
RESOURCES & TIPS
 
How to establish and grow your company's credit rating
A good business credit rating unlocks opportunities for securing loans, attracting investors, and negotiating insurance rates. Whether starting, scaling, or seeking investors, 
here's a roadmap
 to help you build a strong company credit rating.
  
Flo-Magic Playbook: From YouTube Viral to Walmart Shelves
In today's digital age, having a strong social media presence can make or break a business. 
Discover the journey
 of Justin Flom, a magician turned social media influencer, who used his carefully curated following to bring his innovative airbrush kit for kids to the masses.
  
A guide to securing small business loans
Turning your big idea into a business requires capital, which, for many startups, can be a difficult first step. Fortunately, a variety of loan options are available. 
This guide will walk you through
 understanding these options and preparing to apply for the loan that best suits your business needs.
  
CO— READER SURVEY
 
Your Voice Matters (and Could Win You $100!)
Are you a business owner, entrepreneur, or decision-maker? Then we need your voice! At CO—, we're dedicated to providing you with the most relevant and insightful content to help your business thrive. To ensure we're hitting the mark, we're inviting you to participate in our quick audience survey.
‌
By sharing your insights, you'll be helping us fine-tune our content to address your specific needs and interests better. Plus, you can enter to win a $100 Amazon gift card! Take our quick audience survey today and help us build a better CO— for you and the entire business community.
TAKE THE SURVEY
 
  
QUOTABLE MOMENT
“If you’re a small business owner, I’d say this: Don’t hesitate to lean on AI. It’s like having an extra set of hands (or an extra brain) to help you tackle the challenges of running a business.”
— Shahla Karimi, Founder of Shahla Karimi Jewelry, 
shares how — and why — small business owners should consider leveraging AI to improve efficiency and boost profitability
.
CO— EVENTS
Register Now for This Month’s Free Small Business Event!
Our newest event series, C-Suite to Main Street, connects you with tangible tips for starting, running, and growing a business from founders and executives at today’s most influential companies. Join us for our first episode on 
February 27 at noon ET
, where we’ll speak with 
Saeju Jeong, Co-Founder and Executive Chairman of digital healthcare company Noom
.
‌
Tune in to hear how this popular app – best known for helping thousands of users lose weight – adapted to massive shifts in the health and wellness industry since its founding in 2008 and get actionable tips for keeping your business nimble and prepped for any challenges and sea changes that lie ahead. 
JOIN US!
 
  
BY THE NUMBERS
  
25%
A quarter of small businesses faced AI-driven scams last year, leading to high cyberattack costs and long recovery times. Here's why 
cyber insurance is essential
 for protecting businesses of all sizes.
  
$101B
The amount in losses from return fraud last year according to the NRF, but AI is helping retailers cut costs by empowering buyers, identifying trusted customers, optimizing logistics, and reducing fraud. 
Explore four AI-driven strategies
 that help merchants slash return expenses.
  
6
Got a great business idea? Next step: funding! 
Use this financing guide
 to understand how to apply and six financing options to bring your vision to life.
  
GRANTS & AWARDS
The U.S. Chamber of Commerce Foundation’s 
Hiring Our Heroes initiative
 connects the military community with meaningful employment opportunities. To further this goal, Hiring Our Heroes’ Small Business Grant Program is awarding a one-time grant of $10,000 to five small for-profit businesses owned by veterans and/or military spouses. Apply by 
February 28
.
‌
Skip is offering its 
$10,000 Growth Grants
 to entrepreneurs across the U.S. to provide financial support for small businesses. To qualify, applicants must be active or trial Skip Plus members, at least 18 years old, and own a business at any stage of development in any industry. Applications are due by 
February 28
.
‌
The 
U.S. Department of Education (DOE)
 has various grants available to small businesses in the education sector. Each grant has unique eligibility criteria, with some opportunities set aside for public schools, state agencies, or nonprofit organizations; however, others allow applications from for-profit private sector companies. Deadlines for currently available DOE grants run through 
March 17
.
‌
Honeycomb Credit is offering a 
$10,000 Breakthrough Grant
 to support small businesses in achieving their next big milestone, such as opening a new location, launching a food truck, or franchising. No purchase or payment is required to apply. Applications are due by 
April 2
.
‌
The 
Halstead Grant
 is an annual award for emerging silver jewelry artists, offering $7,500 in cash, a $1,000 Halstead gift card, and industry recognition. Winners will also receive personalized feedback from industry judges to refine their business approach. Applications are due 
May 1
.
‌
More grant & program information can be found 
here
.

Hi Briza,
Efficient transportation is key to a successful event. Whether it's a corporate gathering, trade show, or large festival, ensuring smooth attendee arrivals is crucial. CharterUP simplifies this with scalable, tech-enabled shuttle solutions, including single-ticketing programs that enhance accessibility and generate additional revenue. 
Single-Ticketing Shuttle Programs
Attendees can pre-purchase transportation, reducing congestion and ensuring a seamless arrival. Large-scale events like BottleRock Music Festival have leveraged this system to improve logistics, increase accessibility, and create a new revenue stream. 
Why Event Organizers Trust CharterUP:
 
• 
Nationwide, Scalable Fleet
 
 
5,000+ vehicles for any event size, from park-and-ride setups to VIP transports.
 
 
• 
24/7 Event Support
 
 
On-site coordination, route planning, and real-time tracking for stress-free operations.
 
 
• 
Live Tracking & Communication 
 
Keep attendees and staff informed with instant updates.
 
From intimate corporate retreats to stadium-sized festivals, CharterUP streamlines logistics, boosts attendance, and now helps organizers 
monetize transportation with ticketed shuttle solutions.
Contact one of our event transportation experts today to talk about how we can support your next event.

subject: Standing Together: Resources & Support from NAMI Chicago
body:
Standing Together: Resources & Support
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
 
 
Dear Briza, 
I know that many of you, your families, friends, and the people we serve are feeling the impact of recent federal policy changes. These decisions are not just policy shifts. They are deeply personal, affecting our lives and identities in profound ways. 
NAMI Chicago does not shy away from our commitment to
 equity, diversity, and inclusion
. We are dedicated to ensuring that everyone - regardless of gender, identity, or immigration status - has access to mental health support. We continue to create spaces where people feel seen, heard, and valued, and we are actively working with community partners to connect those most impacted by these harmful policies to essential mental health resources. 
These are not uncertain times. The strategy behind these policies is clear. It is designed to divide, to disconnect us, and to create fear.  
But we have not lost hope or given up on our mission. Now, more than ever, we continue our work.  
Our 
Helpline
 and 9-8-8- center
 remain open to provide immediate support and connect individuals to trusted local resources.  
We continue to offer 
specialized training and education
 
to equip people with the knowledge and tools they need during this time.  
We are working around the clock to 
help people on their recovery journey
 through 
peer support
 
and other essential services.  
We are actively
 
advocating
 to change a system that too often fails those who need support the most.
You can also make an impact today by 
donating
 to sustain our critical services. 
Donate
 
Thank you for standing with us in this moment. Together, we will continue to provide hope and healing. 
With gratitude, 
Alexa 
YOU'RE INVITED
Light the Darkness 2025 will be held on Thursday, May 29, 2025 at The Geraghty Chicago. Join us to raise funds and awareness for mental health services, which are all the more crucial during these uncertain times. We will be honoring amazing leaders and changemakers, including 
Dr. Ngozi O. Ezike
, 
Representative Lindsey LaPointe
, 
Chicago Public Library
,
 and the 
Institute for Nonviolence Chicago
.

subject: Two unicorn CFOs: How to build elite teams
body:
The office of the CFO is broken. Learn from two CFOs who completely transformed their finance org chart and scaled their companies to over $100M in revenue.͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ 
 
FEBRUARY 19, 2025
 
­
Matthew Huo
Editor
Welcome back. Today we’re taking lessons from two unicorn CFOs: 
Razzak Jallow
 and 
Adil Syed
.
 
Before helping FloQast scale past $100M, Razzak worked on finance teams at Apple, Google, and Looker. He also helped Adobe make their famous switch to a subscription model.
 
Adil helped grow Rippling from <$5M ARR and one outsourced finance person to over $100M supported by a robust finance org. Prior to Rippling, he spent time at Goldman Sachs, played a critical role in scaling Snap, and invested at Redpoint Ventures (investing in Twilio, Stripe, and Zendesk).
 
This newsletter issue shares their advice on unconventional ways to scale elite finance teams.
Key takeaways
From 2 unicorn CFOs:
 How to rapidly scale finance teams
Action audit:
 How to bolster your finance org starting now
New crypto whale:
 Highway patrol association invests in Bitcoin?
Chart of the week: 
Inflation comes in hot, hot, hot
⛓️‍💥 The missing role on your team
Before we dive in, register to join Razzak and Adil for an upcoming webinar on "How to Scale Finance Teams to $100M” on 2/27.  
➡️ 
Register here
 
They'll reveal how traditional finance is broken and how modern finance teams can drive growth rather than just track it. 
 
Until then, let's dive into some advice they've already shared:
 
Leveling up your finance function
 
If you want to scale to $100M, your team needs to have certain capabilities. As mentioned in the first issue of Spendsetters, we see three main levels to the role of the CFO:
 
Level 1:
 Ensuring number accuracy and building basic corporate models
 
Level 2:
 Detailed modeling across functions with embedded business partners
 
Level 3:
 Strategic partnership driving company-wide decisions
 
When Adil and Razzak joined their respective companies, their team could only support Level 1 operations. Below are some key steps they took to bring their finance org from Level 1 to Level 3.
Who to hire first: Accounting and “Finance business partners”
 
First, both Razzak and Adil emphasize the importance of having a strong accounting team as your foundation. Lead with strong accounting and build from there.
 
Once that's in place, look to your next hire: the "
Finance business partner
."
 
When joining their companies, both Razzak and Adil encountered a common problem: Finance was isolated from key business decisions.
 
Razzak discovered finance teams weren't embedded with department heads, while Adil found sales and marketing teams running on "whiteboard targets" with no real financial rigor behind them.
 
This isolation created 
two critical issues
:
 
1. Sales and marketing teams made financial decisions 
without
 finance's input until after the fact.
 
2. Corporate financial models were 
fragile
, built on poorly informed inputs from GTM and sales teams.
 
Razzak didn't have anyone on finance to sit with the head of sales, to sit in the engineering staff meeting, or to speak with the head of product and actually understand and be their lieutenant on their team.
 
If you can have a finance team member sitting with sales, engineering, product, and marketing as they make decisions, you can 
1)
 catch potential waste 
2)
 spot opportunities and optimizations early and 
3)
 innovate (e.g. price structure or incentives).
 
This is the critical role of 
embedded finance partners
.
Both CFOs transformed their organizations by embedding finance throughout the business. 
 
Razzak did this immediately after joining FloQast by creating what are traditionally referred to as FP&A teams. He built two teams in particular:
 
GTM FP&A team serving as lieutenants to revenue leadership
Corporate and G&A FP&A team providing decision support
 
This structure enables finance to offer comprehensive, unbiased views of where teams have their "best bets" and which investments are paying off. 
 
Adil took a similar approach but structured it as a finance and business operations hybrid.
 
These embedded finance partners helped create accurate and vetted financial inputs from all parts of the business for the overall corporate model. This allowed Adil's team to generate truly robust models and analysis across everything from marketing, to sales, to customer experience.
 
This also helped Adil understand the business at a much deeper level than a typical CFO because his team was working directly with the head of sales and the CMO, developing their plans 
with
 them, for them.
 
The key to this evolution is avoiding the "budget cop" mentality. Razzak recommends that everyone focus on understanding how each department delivers value to customers and use your financial expertise to provide actionable insights that help leadership teams make better decisions.
 
This has been Part 1 of Scaling Finance teams to $100M.
 
Stay tuned for next week’s edition where we reveal key points about data, talent retention, and overlooked metrics that most CFOs don’t track. 
 
Don’t forget to 
register
 for the webinar with Razzak and Adil on 2/27!
📝 Action audit
01
Get your hands dirty with sales:
 Break out of the "budget cop" mindset. Take some time to go speak with sales yourself. See if you can partner on initiatives like faster commission payouts or retention-focused incentives to demonstrate finance's value as a growth enabler.
02
Pressure test your models:
 Not sure if you need an embedded finance partner? Pressure test your model. Do you have inputs from GTM, marketing, and sales that are fragile or lack context? If so, setup meetings with department heads to be the embedded finance partner until you can hire one.
03
Aspiring CFOs:
 Get hands-on experience with how different departments operate and build financial models that incorporate cross-functional insights. This shift from "budget cop" to strategic partner will accelerate your career growth.
🔥 Hot links
 
Wyoming’s highway patrol patrol association invests in Bitcoin
Leveraging generative AI for financial analysis
Webinar: How to scale finance teams to $100M
­
📊 Chart of the week
 
 
Inflation prints hot for January
Last week, higher-than-expected inflation data has led markets to significantly reduce their expectations for interest rate reductions. Looking ahead, proposed tariffs could push inflation even higher in the next few quarters.
🤣 Weekly chuckle
🎥 Join our webinar on Feb 27th!
Thought today's content was interesting? There's plenty more where that came from! Join Razzak and Adil for their webinar on unconventional ways to build an elite finance team. It's completely free.

subject: Best Practices for Employers: Ensuring Compliance with the ADA
body:
Professionals Learning
Reasonable Accommodations Under ADA: Effective Interactive Processes for 2025 and Beyond
Live Webinar 
Date: 
March 25, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 90 Minutes
Register Now
 
Is your business ready for the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)? If you have 15+ employees, you must comply with ADA regulations, no matter where they work. Join HR expert Suzanne Lucas for a 90-minute webinar to learn about the ADA and its requirements. She will teach you how to handle job applications, medical paperwork, and accommodations. This webinar will be a complete guide and teach you about when you can say no to requests, and when you can fire or hire someone with a disability. After attending this session, you will be able to recognize the pitfalls and refrain from them while documenting, the importance of the employee appraisal process. Don’t let the ADA intimidate you—gain clarity on how to manage compliance. 
Expert Speaker:
 Suzanne Lucas spent 10 years in corporate HR where she hired, fired, managed the numbers, and double-checked with the lawyers. She left the corporate world to advise people and companies on how to have the best Human Resources departments possible.
167 Madison Avenue Ste 205 #227 New York City, NY 10016 | support@professionalslearningcom

subject: Last chance! SHRM WEBINAR: Preparing Your Workplace for Immigration Enforcement
body:
Get expert guidance to navigate evolving immigration policies and ICE enforcement actions.
 
 
Join SHRM and vetted employment law experts Wednesday to equip yourself with real-time knowledge and tools necessary to proactively manage and support your workforce, including documented and migrant workers, amidst evolving immigration policies and ICE enforcement actions. Currently, the ICE raids seem to be targeting individuals with existing removal orders for quick deportation. Employers are not yet the focus of these raids but are likely to become a focal point in the future.
 
 
Key Discussion Points:
 
 
 
 
Current Immigration Enforcement Landscape:
Summary of recent executive orders affecting immigration, including stricter vetting and changes to birthright citizenship.
Analysis of ICE strategies, focusing on individuals with removal orders and potential shifts to employer-targeted enforcement.
 
 
 
 
Proactive Workforce Assessment:
Methods for identifying Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA), Temporary Protected Status (TPS) holders, or others with temporary immigration status.
Approaches to encourage voluntary status disclosure with confidentiality and trust.
 
 
 
 
I-9 Compliance and Internal Audits:
Best practices for internal I-9 audits to verify employment eligibility.
Guidance on correcting I-9 errors and ensuring federal compliance.
 
 
 
 
Developing a Response Plan for ICE Actions:
Steps to develop an action plan for unannounced ICE visits, plus information on employer rights and responsibilities.
Training for staff on handling ICE interactions with minimal disruption.
 
 
 
 
Support Systems for Migrant Employees:
Resources to help employees navigate immigration status.
Promoting a workplace culture centered around inclusion & diversity that ensures security for migrant workers.
 
 
By attending this webcast, you can proactively prepare and implement robust compliance and support strategies to mitigate risks associated with immigration enforcement actions and maintain a stable, inclusive, and legally compliant workplace for your organization. You will earn 
1 professional development credit (PDC)
 for attending this webinar.
 
 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
 
 
 
About the Speakers
 
 
 
 
Emily M. Dickens, J.D.
Chief of Staff, Head of Government Affairs, and Corporate Secretary, SHRM
Emily M. Dickens is a member of the executive team at SHRM, the world’s largest human resources trade association and fourth largest trade association in the world. Emily leads government affairs, global policy, legal affairs, and the SHRM Foundation.
 
 
 
 
Bo Cooper
Partner, Fragomen
Bo Cooper is a partner in Fragomen’s Washington, D.C. office. He leads the firm’s Government Strategies and Compliance Group and is a member of Fragomen’s Executive Committee.
 
 
 
 
K. Edward Raleigh
Partner, Fragomen
K. Edward Raleigh is a partner in Fragomen’s Government Strategies and Compliance Group based in Washington, D.C. He focuses on strategic risk management, investigations, and disputes.
 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
If It’s a Work Thing, It’s a SHRM Thing
As these critical changes evolve, you need more than just answers. Join SHRM now to access exclusive member resources such as:
Trusted guidance from 
SHRM’s HR Knowledge Advisors
 for your toughest HR challenges.
Industry-leading insights and content that keep you prepared for what’s next. 
Dedicated how-to guides and toolkits to streamline your day-to-day tasks.
Peer discussions via SHRMConnect, available 24/7 for real-time collaboration.
No matter what “work thing” you’re facing, you deserve a partner committed to elevating—and advocating for—all things work, workers, and the workplace.
 
 
 
JOIN SHRM

subject: Recording: How to Raise Revenue-Based Financing in SaaS
body:
The recording and slides from today's webinar on revenue-based financing, hosted by SaasRise CEO Ryan Allis, who previously exited iContact for $169M. With panelists Nathan Latka from FounderPath and Keith Harrington from Novel Capital.  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Recording: How to Raise Revenue-Based Financing in SaaS 
The recording and slides from today's webinar on revenue-based financing, hosted by SaasRise CEO Ryan Allis, who previously exited iContact for $169M. With panelists Nathan Latka from FounderPath and Keith Harrington from Novel Capital. 
 
Watch the webinar recording
Hi Briza —
Today we had a members-only webinar on 
How to 
Raise Revenue-Based Financing in SaaS
. You can 
watch the webinar recording here
. 
While live attendance was just for our SaasRise members (
apply to join us here
), we often send around recordings to our full email list. 
So 
here’s the webinar recording
 and 
slides
 from this week’s webinar as our gift. We hope it’s helpful! 
Watch the Webinar Recording🔥 
See the Webinar Slides🔥 
RBF is a great way to get the capital you need to accelerate investments in growth and R&D as a bootstrapped firm, without experiencing dilution from giving up equity to VC firms. 
Thank you to our excellent panelists today… 
Nathan Latka, CEO and Founder of 
FounderPath
Keith Harrington, COO and Co-Founder of 
Novel Capital
In the 
webinar
, we covered: 
How SaaS founders can scale without selling their souls to venture capitalists 
What is Revenue-Based Financing?
How to strategically use debt to fuel ARR growth
Comparing non-dilutive Revenue-Based Financing (RBF) over traditional venture funding
The story of how SaasRise took a $170k RBF financing in May 2024 to accelerate S&M investment (which led to growing ARR from $1M to $4M)
What lenders look for when 
evaluating SaaS businesses for financing and how best to prepare
Important terms to consider when evaluating RBF providers
Expected effective interest rates for RBF
Common pitfalls to avoid when securing non-dilutive capital
Examples of companies that have successfully used RBF to scale
See slides
See slides
See slides
How SaaS Founders Can Scale Without Selling Their Souls to VCs 
🚀
Venture capital isn’t the only way to grow your SaaS company. In fact, for 95% of founders, it’s not the best way. 
Revenue-Based Financing allows SaaS founders to raise capital against future revenue without giving up equity, control, or board seats. Instead of selling a chunk of your company, you take a loan and repay it as a small percentage of revenue over time. 
It’s fast, flexible, and founder-friendly. 
Why Consider RBF?
💰 
Keep Your Equity
 – Retain ownership and control
⚡ 
Fast Funding
 – Get approved in 
72 hours
📈 
Growth Without Pressure
 – No need to hyper-scale for a VC’s exit timeline
🛠 
Use Funds Where They Matter
 – Invest in marketing, hiring, R&D, and product
🤝 
No Personal Guarantees
 – No risking your house 
My Own Experience with RBF
When building SaaS Rise, we wanted to 
scale sales & marketing
 without raising VC. Instead, we took 
$170K in RBF from FounderPath
 in May 2024. 
📈 We grew from $1M ARR to $4M ARR in 9 months.
📅 Got approved in 72 hours.
🏦 No dilution. No loss of control. Just growth. 
Who Should Use RBF?
✅ SaaS companies with at least 
$350K ARR
✅ Founders with 
positive unit economics
 (LTV:CAC ratio 6:1 or higher)
✅ Teams that want to 
scale smartly without external pressure
VC vs. RBF: The Big Picture
Venture Capital:
 High stakes, high pressure, big dilution
Revenue-Based Financing:
 Keep your equity, grow sustainably, repay as you scale 
Key Takeaways from the Experts
⚡ 
Nathan Latka:
 “We love cockroach SaaS—predictable, steady growth beats hypergrowth with no profits.”
⚡ 
Keith Harrington:
 “Only 0.25% of startups actually 
need
 VC. The rest can thrive with non-dilutive capital.”
⚡ 
Ryan Allis:
 “RBF helped us scale without giving up ownership. SaaS founders have more options today than ever.” 
If you’re a SaaS founder looking to scale 
without selling your soul to VCs
, 
RBF is worth exploring
. 
👀 What’s your take? Would you raise capital via RBF instead of VC? 
Useful RBF Resources
These resources may also be helpful to you as you prepare to raise non-dilutive capital. 
Revenue Based Financing Case Study 
The Guide to Non-Dilutive SaaS Growth Capital 
Video by Ryan Allis on How to Use Revenue Based Financing for Growth
SaaS Growth Course Lesson on Revenue Based Financing
Webinar Recording 
Webinar Slides 
AI Summary of the Webinar on Revenue-Based Financing (RBF)
The webinar, hosted by Ryan Allis, CEO & Co-founder of 
SaasRise
, featured Keith Harrington (COO of 
Novel
) and Nathan Latka (Founder of 
FounderPath
). The discussion focused on how SaaS companies can raise capital using revenue-based financing (RBF) as an alternative to venture capital (VC) and equity financing. 
Key Takeaways
What is Revenue-Based Financing (RBF)?
RBF allows SaaS businesses to borrow capital against future revenue. 
Instead of giving up equity, founders repay the loan as a percentage of revenue over time. 
Typically, companies can raise up to 50% of their ARR using RBF. 
Major players include FounderPath, Novel, and other fintech firms. 
Advantages of RBF Over Venture Capital
Non-dilutive – Founders retain 100% of equity. 
Faster and simpler – Some RBF firms approve loans in 72 hours. 
Less pressure for hypergrowth – Unlike VC, there’s no pressure to scale aggressively. 
Predictable repayment structure – If revenue slows, repayments adjust accordingly. 
Who Should Use RBF?
Companies with recurring revenue models (SaaS, subscription businesses). 
Businesses that have product-market fit but want to scale faster. 
Founders who want capital but don’t want to sell equity or take on VC pressure. 
Typically, companies with at least $350K ARR are eligible. 
How RBF Works
Companies connect their financial data (Stripe, bank accounts, accounting software). 
Lenders assess revenue trends, churn, growth rates, and cash flow. 
Capital is wired within days after approval. 
Repayments are made monthly as a fixed or variable percentage of revenue. 
Comparison: RBF vs. Venture Capital
Venture Capital: High-growth expectations, long fundraising cycles, loss of control, high dilution. 
RBF: No equity loss, flexible payments, ideal for steady-growth companies. 
Challenges & Considerations
Cost of Capital: RBF loans generally have interest rates of 16-23%. 
Payback Structure: Typically 2-4 years with a fixed monthly repayment or revenue-based percentage. 
Not Ideal for Pre-Revenue Startups: Companies need proven revenue to qualify. 
Limited Funding Size: RBF works best for scaling within a sustainable growth model, not large expansions requiring heavy upfront capital. 
Alternative Uses for RBF
Sales & Marketing Expansion (e.g., paid ads, outbound sales). 
Hiring & Product Development (ramping up an engineering or customer success team). 
Debt Consolidation (refinancing high-cost loans). 
Delayed Draw Term Loans (structured funding for acquisitions or growth strategies). 
Case Study: SaaS Rise Using RBF
SaasRise raised $170K in May 2024 from FounderPath. 
Used funds for customer acquisition and scaling. 
Resulted in revenue growth from $1M to $4M ARR in 12 months. 
Key Metrics Lenders Look For
ARR Growth Rate (Steady > Explosive). 
Churn Rate & Retention (Lower churn = better loan terms). 
Profitability & Cash Flow (Ensuring ability to repay). 
CAC vs. LTV Ratio (Efficient capital deployment). 
Final Thoughts
RBF is a great alternative for SaaS founders who want to scale without losing ownership. 
It’s not for everyone—VC might still be ideal for businesses targeting hypergrowth or massive market disruption. 
Lenders like Novel & FounderPath are making RBF more accessible with fast approvals, fair terms, and founder-friendly structures. 
For more information on our community for SaaS CEOs and founders, visit 
www.saasrise.com
. 
We’re here to help you grow and successfully exit!
All the best,
Ryan Allis, CEO & Co-Founder
SaasRise
The #1 Community for Experienced SaaS CEOs & Founders
www.saasrise.com
P.S - If you like great content like this and you’re a CEO or Founder of a software firm with $1M to $100M in ARR, 
apply to join SaasRise here
. 
  
We’re now up to 500 members in SaasRise, representing over $3B in ARR
Join Our Community of SaaS CEOs & Founders
Thanks for reading. We hope this guide has been helpful to you. Please take a moment to learn more about 
SaasRise
, our community for SaaS CEOs and Founders. We welcome all CEOs and Founders with $1M-$100M in ARR to join us. We hold three masterminds each week for our members and provide an in-depth library of SaaS growth, fundraising, and exit resources. You can 
apply here
. 
Apply to Join SaasRise Here 🔥 
  
Thanks for reading! If you liked this article, join the SaasRise community at 
www.saasrise.com
 for even more helpful growth content and weekly SaaS CEO masterminds. 
Join Our Weekly Masterminds for SaaS CEOs/Founders
About The Author
Ryan Allis is the founder of 
SaasRise
, the mastermind community for growth-focused SaaS CEOs with $1M-$100M in ARR. He is a three time INC 500 CEO. He was previously CEO of iContact and grew the firm as founder/CEO to 70,000 customers, 1 million users, 300 employees, $50M per year in sales, and an exit for $169M to Vocus (NASDAQ:VOCS). 
Since the sale of iContact, Ryan has been the CEO coach to high-growth SaaS firms including Instantly, Tatango, Seamless.ai, Pipeline, Datalyse, Green Packet, Revenue Accelerator, Galleon, Clearstream, YouCanBookMe, Retreaver, and EventMobi. Ryan has been part of the EO and Summit Series communities.
He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School, where he was Co-President of the Social Enterprise Club and a member of the Harvard Graduate School Leadership Institute. He’s passionate about helping recurring revenue software companies grow and exit.
We’ll see you next time with more great SaaS growth and scaling content!

subject: 2025 Update: How ICE’s Strengthened Enforcement Will Impact Your Business
body:
Professionals Learning
2025 Immigration Enforcement: Prepare for ICE I-9 Audits and Raids
Live Webinar 
Date: 
March 12, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 90 Minutes
Register Now
 
Employers face increasing risks with tougher immigration enforcement and skyrocketing fines. Did you know Form I-9 violations can cost up to $2,861 per error and up to $28,619 for hiring unauthorized workers? Join our webinar, presented by our renowned speaker, “Margie Faulk”. Our course covers everything you need to protect your organization: Conduct thorough internal I-9 audits. Implement best practices for I-9 management, Prepare for audits and workplace raids, and Develop an effective immigration compliance policy. Gain practical skills to conduct internal audits, streamline verification processes, and respond confidently to workplace raids. Don’t leave your company vulnerable to costly penalties! Learn the essential tools to stay compliant, mitigate risks, and safeguard your business. 
Expert Speaker:
 Margie Faulk is a senior-level human resource professional with over 15 years of HR management and compliance experience. A current Compliance Advisor for HR Compliance Solutions, LLC, Margie, has worked as an HR Compliance advisor for major corporations and small businesses in the small, large, private, public, and non-profit sectors.

subject: Salary Basis & Exempt Employees: How to Stay Compliant in 2025
body:
Exempt Employees: Understanding and Changes for 2025 and Beyond
 
Live Webinar
: March 26, 2025 | 100 minutes
CE Credits
: CPE: 2, HRCI: 1.5, SHRM: 1.5, RCH: 1.5
In this live session, we will cover the four classifications of exempt employees recognized by the Department of Labor: executive, administrative, professional, and outside sales. We'll also review the salary level test, including guidelines for using bonuses and the salary basis test. Additionally, we'll identify what deductions are permissible and which, if done incorrectly, could result in serious compliance issues for your organization.
Payroll professionals may not make classification decisions, but they are responsible for ensuring accurate compensation. This session will provide clarity on the salary basis test, proper payment structures, and what happens when deductions are applied incorrectly.
Reserve Your Seat Today →
Your Benefits for Attending:
 
The four classifications of exempt employees and how they are determined
How the salary level and salary basis tests apply in 2025
Guidelines for using bonuses to meet exemption criteria
Permissible deductions and how to avoid improper wage docking
What to expect from the latest DOL updates on salary levels
How to apply the highly compensated exemption correctly
State-specific exemption rules you need to be aware of
Master the Exempt Employee Changes  →

subject: Creating a B2B Content Machine
body:
This guide by Ryan Allis details the modern approach to B2B content marketing that has allowed SaasRise to grow from $0 to $4M ARR in 18 months. It explains how traditional SEO-driven inbound marketing is dying due to the rise of AI-generated answers and shifts in search behavior. Instead of relying on old passive inbound tactics, SaasRise uses a proactive multi-channel content distribution strategy that combines ABM list building + outbound + newsletters + ads.  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
February 17, 2025   |   
Read Online
Building a B2B Content Machine 
This guide by Ryan Allis details the modern approach to B2B content marketing that has allowed SaasRise to grow from $0 to $4M ARR in 18 months. It explains how traditional SEO-driven inbound marketing is dying due to the rise of AI-generated answers and shifts in search behavior. Instead of relying on old passive inbound tactics, SaasRise uses a proactive multi-channel content distribution strategy that combines ABM list building + outbound + newsletters + ads. 
 
Hi Briza —
This article might just change the entire course of your 2025 B2B marketing strategy. 
You see, we like to create and then give away REALLY helpful content every week.  
It’s our entire marketing strategy. And it’s working, really well. 
We’ve grown 
SaasRise
 from $0 to $4M ARR in just 18 months using this exact strategy. We just passed 500 members today of the community — so we’re giving away the guide to how we’re doing it (below). 
The whole key is to not do passive-marketing, but proactive marketing to your target audience. 
In this free in-depth guide, I’ll be sharing with you exactly how we are doing it. 
All right let’s jump into the full guide BELOW on how to set this up so that you can supercharge your brand awareness and qualified leads pipeline… 
Apply to Join SaasRise Here 
See the Slides on Creating a Content Machine 
  
Now, let’s jump right in to the free guide! Read it below in the email or open it 
as a Google Doc here.
 The 
slides are available here
. 
Creating a B2B Content Marketing Machine
By Ryan Allis, CEO of SaasRise
About the Author: 
Ryan Allis is the CEO and co-founder of 
SaasRise
, the community for SaaS CEOs & founders. Ryan founded and grew iContact as CEO to $50M ARR, sold it for $169M, and earned his MBA from Harvard Business School. Today, Ryan coaches SaaS CEOs in rapidly scaling up revenue, building their teams, and preparing for and executing on $100M+ exits. 
This article details the modern approach to B2B content marketing that has allowed SaasRise to grow from $0 to $4M ARR in 18 months. 
It explains how traditional SEO-driven inbound marketing is dying due to the rise of AI-generated answers and shifts in search behavior. Instead of relying on old inbound tactics, at SaasRise we use a multi-channel content distribution strategy that uses 
ABM list building + outbound + ads + weekly newsletters + LinkedIn thought leadership ads
. 
Have your marketing team copy this model for your own company. 
In our experience it works for any B2B firm with a clear target market. 
Here’s exactly what we did… 
First, we first built a 
comprehensive ABM lead list
 of our target audience of all 500,000 SaaS CEOs and founders in the world (using tools like 
Clay
, 
Apollo
, 
Instantly
, and 
ListKit
). 
Then, we built a 
B2B content machine
—a system that generates super high-quality content that is actually helpful and worth reading (like this), distributes it weekly to this audience across multiple channels, and ensures our target market sees our brand repeatedly (via AI-personalized outbound outreach on Instantly, our weekly email newsletter on BeeHiiv, thought leadership ads on LinkedIn distributed to a matched audience, and retargeting ads on Meta, Google, LinkedIn, and Adroll). 
The result? 2.5 million content impressions per month within our niche, making our brand appear omnipresent within our ICP. These content impressions directly lead to 300 new applications to join 
our community
 per month, which turns into 40 new paying members per month. 
How Many Content Impressions Are You Getting Today
See the slides
So, how exactly do we get 2.5 million impressions per month of our super high-quality content within our tight niche of just SaaS CEOs and Founders? 
Here’s our actual KPI tracker for our content machine results. You can 
copy it / steal it / use it for your company
! 
Our actual KPI tracker for our B2B content machine results. You can 
copy it here
.
Now that we’ve got the basics down, let’s keep going into more and more granular detail. 
Four Steps to B2B Content Marketing Success
B2B content marketing success in 2025 all comes down to doing four steps right… 
Start By Generating Your ABM Lead List 
- Consider this your 
audience
, the people who are likely to have the problem your product/service solves. Find them by observing trends in current customers based on industry, job title, location, employee count, or even the keywords they have in their LinkedIn headline or summary. You can build this on 
Clay
, 
Apollo
, 
Instantly
, and 
ListKit
.  
Once you know who you want to market to, send them outbound prospecting emails using Instantly, outbound LinkedIn reachouts via HeyReach, and start showing matched audience ads to them using Meta, LinkedIn, Google, and Adroll. Don’t passively wait for inbound marketing results. This is B2B. Get proactive and in front of your target market!  
The old Hubspot model of “Inbound” through lots of mediocre-SEO focused content is dying as SEO dies out and is replaced by AI answers at the top of Google and people shifting to ChatGPT and Perplexity for AI-driven results.  
While Inbound SEO worked EXTREMELY well from 2002-2023 to generate B2B leads, it’s now dying out as AI takes over. Welcome to 2025. Time to adjust your B2B marketing methods. Don’t believe me that Inbound SEO is dying? Just take a look at the below screenshot of Hubspot’s organic search traffic over the last six months. Hubspot Organic Traffic has declined 65% in the last 6 months as people move away from search engines toward AI summaries.  
Source: 
SEMRush
Sadly, passive inbound marketing relying on SEO articles is a dying strategy. It’s time for a new B2B content strategy focused on ABM lead list building and multi-channel distribution.
Create One Piece of Great New Content Per Week
 - I produce one flagship piece of high-quality content every Monday (like this article)
Remember, it’s great content that turns strangers at the top of your ABM lead funnel into leads, prospects, customers, and ultimately evangelizers. 
BTW… this very in-depth article was produced in just 2 hours, feeding an AI-generated transcript of a presentation I did on this topic last Thursday into ChatGPT and then taking two hours to add images and manually edit it into something GREAT! (if you want to lead your niche, there’s no use sending out stuff that isn’t world class) 
See the slides
Distribute Across Multiple Channels
 - My team of two (Head of Growth and Head of Sales) distributes and re-purpose that content I create across multiple channels (newsletter, blog, LinkedIn, ads) to our target audience of SaaS CEOs and Founders. 
Using thought leadership ads (aka boosted organic posts) on LinkedIn (way cheaper than regular LinkedIn ads) 
Using matched audience ads on Meta, LinkedIn, and Google
Tracked Content Impressions Monthly 
- I track how many content impressions we’re getting within our by adding up: 
Email Opens (Warm BeeHiiv Emails + Cold Instantly Emails) 
Ad impressions (Meta, LinkedIn, Google, Adroll, Bing) 
LinkedIn organic post impressions with our target market (Thought Leadership Ads to a Matched Audience from our ABM Lead List) 
Video views (Wistia + YouTube) 
Website views  
By executing this playbook, we’re now generating 
2.5M+ impressions per month
 and are adding 
40+ new SaasRise members per month
. 
Total effort? 5 hours per week (3 hours from me to write content plus 2 hours from our team to distribute it on multiple channels). 
Want to go one layer deeper and learn how we do this? Let’s go… 
Here’s exactly how you can do the same inside your company…. Let’s break it down… 
The Details If You’re Actually Going to Do This
See the slides
  
Step 1: Commit to 3 Hours Per Week of Content Creation
The foundation of a great content machine is 
creating one high-value content piece every week
. This doesn’t mean churning out generic, low-effort blog posts (does this post seem low-effort). It means producing 
insightful, actionable, and data-driven
 content that your audience actually wants to consume. 
Create content that is so good your audience can’t turn their eyes away from it.  
I call this Content Porn (cheeky but memorable). Thankfully I’m my own boss so I didn’t have to get that title approved by corporate. 
See the slides
How to Consistently Generate High-Value Content
Focus on 
pain points
 and 
common challenges
 your customers face 
Use customer feedback and sales conversations for ideas 
Look at top-performing competitor content for inspiration 
Use AI tools like 
ChatGPT
 or 
Pressmaster AI
 to interview you to get great content out of your head and into writing or video 
Feed transcripts of interviews with your CEO/Founders or your marketing webinars into ChatGPT to turn them into articles ready for any format/length 
Content Formats That Work Well
Deep-dive guides
 (like this one) 
Case studies
 showcasing real-world results 
Webinars and video breakdowns
Podcast-style discussions
 with industry experts 
Data reports and industry benchmarks 
- everyone loves to compare their firm 
Short Video Snippets 
15-60 seconds that can used as ads
Once the content is created, 
it’s time to distribute it
—and this is where most companies fail. They post one piece of content per month to a small 5,000 person newsletter, put it up on their blog, and call it a day. 
If a reindeer pooped in a forest, would anyone know? (Probably my favorite line in this whole how-to guide).  
In B2B, you can’t just BE a purple cow, you have to also distribute your purple milk to your purple people. 
Thanks to ChatGPT’s Dall-E for an epic image, who says marketing can’t be fun!
Any Seth Godin readers out there? If not: 
Purple Cow = A Brand That Truly Stands Out in the Marketplace 
Purple Milk = Content That Stands Out in the Marketplace 
Purple People = Your Target Audience of Potential Buyers 
The key point: STAND OUT with GREAT content. 
  
Step 2: Master the Art of Content Distribution
Creating great content is just the beginning. The 
real power
 of a content machine is in how well you distribute it. We use a 
multi-channel approach
 to maximize reach. 
How We Distribute Each Content Piece
Newsletter:
 Sent to our 340K+ subscribers every Monday 
LinkedIn Posts:
 2-3 posts per week repurposed from the article 
Retargeting Ads:
 We turn blog content screenshots into retargeting ad creatives 
Webinars:
 We turn content into live and recorded webinars, then distribute the videos 
PDF Lead Magnets:
 Some articles become downloadable reports 
YouTube & Podcasts:
 If video-based, we push content to YouTube and Wistia 
Each of these channels amplifies our content’s reach, ensuring that 
the right people see our content multiple times
. 
Using Paid Ads to Boost Content Reach
David our head of growth is a paid ads expert. 
He runs 
LinkedIn, Meta, Google Display, and Adroll
 to distribute our content even further. Here’s how: 
Retargeting Ads
: Target visitors who engaged with past content 
Lookalike Ads
: Target people similar to our best customers 
Matched Audience Ads
: Serve content to the people on our ABM Lead Lists 
Our 
ad budget is optimized for engagement
, ensuring every dollar is spent on maximizing our content’s impact – but only showing ads to people within our ICP. 
  
Step 3: Track & Optimize Content Performance
What gets measured gets improved. We track five key metrics to refine our strategy: 
Total Ad Impressions
 (How many people saw our content via ads?) 
Total Email Opens
 (How many engaged with newsletters?) 
LinkedIn Post Impressions
 (How far did our organic posts reach?) 
Website Visits
 (How much traffic came from our content?) 
Video Watch Time
 (How long are people consuming our videos? 
Here’s our tracking template that I mentioned earlier. You can 
copy it / steal it / use it for your company
! 
Key Takeaways from Our Data-Driven Approach
You aren’t going to build Rome in one week. Give it time. It took us five months to go from 0 to 1 million content impressions once we 
started tracking
. Now we’re at 2.5 million content impressions per month.
More frequent quality emails (2x per week vs. 1x) increased our new customers from 25 to 40 per month with only 2-3 hours more work.
Boosting organic LinkedIn posts for $35/day dramatically increased our reach. Create a “B2B creator network” of affiliates who agree to re-post your LinkedIn posts in their own words and then pay to boost their posts – giving them AND you more exposure.
Retargeting ads to past visitors delivered the 
highest ROI
 of any channel. 
Tracking these KPIs ensures we’re not just creating content 
for the sake of it
, but actually driving revenue. 
  
Step 4: Scale Your Content Machine with a Lean Team
Building a content machine doesn’t require a massive team. We operate with just 
four key roles
: 
Content Creator (You or a Writer)
 – Writes long-form articles 
Growth Marketer (Ads & SEO Manager)
 – Handles distribution 
Sales Development Rep (SDR)
 – Engages warm leads 
Video & Design Lead
 – Edits videos and creates graphics 
If you’re bootstrapped, 
hire a Virtual Assistant
 for content repurposing and distribution. 
You can get an 80 hour per week well trained EA/VA for just $699/month from 
Wing Assistant
 who can repurpose and distribute your content for you, or if you want even better quality EAs go with 
RooCruit
 (quality + cost balance) or 
Athena
 (best quality and training). 
We have only 5 people in our entire company (at $4M ARR, quite efficient) 
CEO (me, serves as content creator) 
Head of Growth (David, the ads guy) 
VP Member Success (Salman, also helps create some content) 
Head of Sales (distributes content into multiple formats for me) 
SDR (follows-up with warm leads) 
We don’t have any engineers as we use a private labeled community for our software platform (
Circle
) and combine that with Slack + WhatsApp + Zoom. 
  
Step 5: Use AI for Faster Content Editing & Reformatting
AI tools help us scale content production 
without losing quality
: 
Pressmaster AI
 – Helps generate high-quality articles by interviewing you about your article and then generating a first draft that you can then edit (use HQ mode) 
ChatGPT for Content Repurposing
 – Converts articles and blog posts into LinkedIn posts and any other desired format (use ChatGPT 
DeepResearch
 for really complex topics) 
Riverside.fm
 – Generates high-quality podcast and webinar clips 
BeeHiiv
 – Automates email marketing sequences and newsletters 
AI is a tool, not a replacement—use it wisely to 
enhance your content strategy
. Don’t start with an AI generated article as it will just be regurgitated crap. Start with something created by a true expert who understands your market and then use AI to reformat/repurpose/improve the content.  
  
Step 6: The Role of Video & Podcasts in Scaling Engagement
Video is an essential component of a modern content machine. Here’s how we use it: 
Short-form clips
: We turn long-form content into 
15-30 second ad video clips
 for LinkedIn, Instagram, and Facebook using 
Riverside.fm
 Magic Clips 
Video Podcast Interviews
: You can host industry experts monthly to create compelling video content that can be distributed to your weekly newsletter 
Webinar repurposing
: We turn educational webinars into on-demand video content 
We post our content to Wistia (good for linking within your newsletter) and YouTube (good for extra distribution). 
We track 
watch time and views
 to improve video content every month.  
We’re just getting going with video – though last month in Jan 2025 we did have over 1300 hours of video watched in our Wista account (not bad considering there are 730 hours in a month). 
  
Final Takeaways: How to Build Your Content Machine in 120 Days
Build a massive list
 using lead prospecting tools like Clay, Instantly, Apollo, and ListKit 
Send automated outbound sequences
 via email and LinkedIn 
Create one flagship content piece per week
 and distribute it everywhere 
Track key content performance metrics
 and refine based on data 
Use AI tools
 to edit and repurpose content production efficiently 
Invest in a monthly video podcast
 to create great content easily. 
If you follow this playbook, you’ll build a 
dominant content engine
 that generates 
millions of impressions per month 
and establishes your brand as an industry leader. 
I hope this guide helped! Let me know your thoughts, and I’ll see you next time with another deep dive. 
Ryan
P.S. - If you want the 
full SaaS Growth Course

About The Author
Ryan Allis is the founder of 
SaasRise
, the mastermind community for growth-focused SaaS CEOs with $1M-$100M in ARR. He is a three time INC 500 CEO. He was previously CEO of iContact and grew the firm as founder/CEO to 70,000 customers, 1 million users, 300 employees, $50M per year in sales, and an exit for $169M to Vocus (NASDAQ:VOCS). 
Since the sale of iContact, Ryan has been the CEO coach to high-growth SaaS firms including Instantly, Tatango, Seamless.ai, Pipeline, Datalyse, Green Packet, Revenue Accelerator, Galleon, Clearstream, YouCanBookMe, Retreaver, and EventMobi. Ryan has been part of the EO and Summit Series communities.
He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School, where he was Co-President of the Social Enterprise Club and a member of the Harvard Graduate School Leadership Institute. He’s passionate about helping recurring revenue software companies grow and exit.

subject: 2025 Strategies to Prevent FMLA, ADA and Workers’ Comp Abuse
body:
Professionals Learning
FMLA, ADA & Workers’ Comp: Preventing Leave Abuse in 2025
Live Webinar 
Date: 
February 26, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 90 Minutes
Register Now
 
Gain insights into how to define leave misuse, common ways employees misuse leave time, determining eligibility, and intermittent leave. Understand the key aspects necessary to navigate the FMLA, ADA, and Worker's compensation requirements effectively and ensure compliance within your organization. The speaker will also disclose the complexities of navigating complicated intersections between the FMLA and the ADA, to ensure your organization remains compliant with all relevant regulations while maintaining a productive and supportive workplace.
Coordinating compliance, handling intermittent leave, and determining reasonable accommodations under the FMLA, ADA, and Workers' Compensation laws can be challenging. Learn from our expert, Janette S. Levey, who will provide a working knowledge of how you can minimize your company’s exposure to employee misuse of the FMLA. 
Session Objectives:
Common Ways Employees Abuse Leave Time.
Defining Leave Abuse and Determining Eligibility.
Reasonable Accommodations under the ADA/ADAAA.
Alternatives to leave as tools for curbing FMLA Abuse.
Investigations of Suspected Leave Abuse and Intermittent leave. 
Leave and COVID concerns. 
Expert Speaker:
 Janette S. Levey, Principal Attorney of Levey Law, LLC, is an employment/HR attorney with over 20 years of legal experience. Ms. Levey is a legal wellness professional for employment practices and workforce challenges. She works with employers to craft solid employment practices wellness plans tailored to address an organization’s needs and concerns.

VIRTUAL EVENT
A Masterclass in Thriving Through Change
February 27 | 12pm ET
You're invited to our
 C-SUITE TO MAIN STREET
 virtual event! This in-depth discussion features Saeju Jeong, the Co-Founder and CEO of digital healthcare company Noom, who will share his insights on turning business challenges into opportunities for next-level growth. 
REGISTER NOW
 
  
  
ABOUT NOOM
 
Founded in 2008, 
Noom
 is a digital healthcare company that connects people to content, coaching, and other resources to build healthy habits and promote better living. In 2015, Noom became the first app recognized by the CDC as a diabetes prevention program. More recently, the company launched Noom Mood to expand its offerings beyond weight loss, and in 2023, the company introduced Noom Med, a platform for obesity management.  
‌
Register now
 to hear this ever-evolving business’s co-founder discuss key topics like navigating change, focusing on customer needs, and how testing new ideas has helped Noom become a major player in the digital healthcare space.

subject: EXCLUSIVE SHRM WEBINAR: Preparing Your Workplace for Immigration Enforcement
body:
Get expert guidance to navigate evolving immigration policies and ICE enforcement actions.
 
 
Join SHRM and vetted employment law experts Wednesday to equip yourself with real-time knowledge and tools necessary to proactively manage and support your workforce, including documented and migrant workers, amidst evolving immigration policies and ICE enforcement actions. Currently, the ICE raids seem to be targeting individuals with existing removal orders for quick deportation. Employers are not yet the focus of these raids but are likely to become a focal point in the future.
 
 
Key Discussion Points:
 
 
 
 
Current Immigration Enforcement Landscape:
Summary of recent executive orders affecting immigration, including stricter vetting and changes to birthright citizenship.
Analysis of ICE strategies, focusing on individuals with removal orders and potential shifts to employer-targeted enforcement.
 
 
 
 
Proactive Workforce Assessment:
Methods for identifying Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA), Temporary Protected Status (TPS) holders, or others with temporary immigration status.
Approaches to encourage voluntary status disclosure with confidentiality and trust.
 
 
 
 
I-9 Compliance and Internal Audits:
Best practices for internal I-9 audits to verify employment eligibility.
Guidance on correcting I-9 errors and ensuring federal compliance.
 
 
 
 
Developing a Response Plan for ICE Actions:
Steps to develop an action plan for unannounced ICE visits, plus information on employer rights and responsibilities.
Training for staff on handling ICE interactions with minimal disruption.
 
 
 
 
Support Systems for Migrant Employees:
Resources to help employees navigate immigration status.
Promoting a workplace culture centered around inclusion & diversity that ensures security for migrant workers.
 
 
By attending this webcast, you can proactively prepare and implement robust compliance and support strategies to mitigate risks associated with immigration enforcement actions and maintain a stable, inclusive, and legally compliant workplace for your organization. You will earn 
1 professional development credit (PDC)
 for attending this webinar.
 
 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
 
 
 
About the Speakers
 
 
 
 
Emily M. Dickens, J.D.
Chief of Staff, Head of Government Affairs, and Corporate Secretary, SHRM
Emily M. Dickens is a member of the executive team at SHRM, the world’s largest human resources trade association and fourth largest trade association in the world. Emily leads government affairs, global policy, legal affairs, and the SHRM Foundation.
 
 
 
 
Bo Cooper
Partner, Fragomen
Bo Cooper is a partner in Fragomen’s Washington, D.C. office. He leads the firm’s Government Strategies and Compliance Group and is a member of Fragomen’s Executive Committee.
 
 
 
 
K. Edward Raleigh
Partner, Fragomen
K. Edward Raleigh is a partner in Fragomen’s Government Strategies and Compliance Group based in Washington, D.C. He focuses on strategic risk management, investigations, and disputes.
 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
If It’s a Work Thing, It’s a SHRM Thing
As these critical changes evolve, you need more than just answers. Join SHRM now to access exclusive member resources such as:
Trusted guidance from 
SHRM’s HR Knowledge Advisors
 for your toughest HR challenges.
Industry-leading insights and content that keep you prepared for what’s next. 
Dedicated how-to guides and toolkits to streamline your day-to-day tasks.
Peer discussions via SHRMConnect, available 24/7 for real-time collaboration.
No matter what “work thing” you’re facing, you deserve a partner committed to elevating—and advocating for—all things work, workers, and the workplace.
 
 
 
JOIN SHRM
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Already a member?
 Our records indicate that the email address b.cardenas@lcwmail.com isn’t matched to a current membership. Please contact our Customer Experience Team or update your account in the

View this email in your browser
We are excited to welcome groups back to Chinatown for our new season in 2025! Come for the original 
Chinatown
 
Walking Tours,
 or 
Food Tour,
 or many of our cultural workshops such as  
Dumpling-making, Kite-painting, Fan/Umbrella-painting, Paper-cutting
, and 
Martial Arts.
 Private groups only. We give a special discount to K-12 student groups  (CPS Vendor #: 66088) and can customize a program to all age groups. Book NOW! Many of our April and May dates fill up quickly. We look forward to showing your group a wonderful Chinatown experience.
To download the flyer of our K-12 student program and offers, please 
click here.
 
To download the flyer of our adult programs and rates, please 
click here
.  
 
Chinatown Walking Tours 
Experience the rich history and culture behind the Chinatown community with our trained guides.  The 60-minute tour will stop at landmarks such as Pui Tak Center (formerly known as On-Leong Merchants Association Building), Nine Dragon Wall, Chinatown Gate, Buddhist Temple, St Therese Catholic Church, Chinatown Mutual, Zodiac Square, etc. The 90-minute tour will add an additional visit to Ping Tom Memorial Park. We can also help arrange a group lunch after the tour. 
Book Now
 
Dumpling Making 
This hands-on experience making your own dumplings followed by a light meal including the dumplings you made has been very popular with our groups of all ages. The immersive activity gives everyone a fun opportunity to learn and participate in Chinese culture. 
 
Kite Painting 
Kite-making has a history of over 2000 years in China. At this workshop, students will hear kite stories and have a unique experience creating arts on silk kites that were imported from the hometown of kites, Weifang, China. 
 
Fan/Umbrella Painting - 
New
It’s not every day that you can paint or color on traditional Chinese silk fans and paper umbrellas. We continue to be amazed by all the wonderful creativity coming through these workshops. 
 
Paper Cutting 
Ancient Chinese invented paper-making.   Today, folk artists continue to make  different designs and patterns by cutting paper with scissors or blades.  At this workshop, students will have an opportunity to cut designs with their own hands. 
 
Martial Arts Exercise
When talking about Chinese culture, many people will immediately think of Kungfu, or Martial Arts. Follow our   master for a basic intro to the principles of martial arts and do an exercise with him. 
 
Book Now
Chicago Chinese Cultural Institute
Mailing adress: 1245 S Michigan Ave., #219, Chicago, IL 60605 
Tel: 312-842-1988     Email: 
info@chicagocci.com
     
www.chicagocci.com

subject: W-4 Form 2025: Key Updates and How to Complete It
body:
Professionals Learning
Form W-4 Explained: What’s New for 2025
Live Webinar 
Date: 
February 27, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 60 Minutes
Register Now
 
Form W-4 also known as the Employee Withholding Certificate is a Complicated IRS Form that often befuddle employers and payroll professionals alike. But, heave a sigh of relief and relax. Our expert speaker, Dayna Reum will help you out on how to duly process the Form W-4 for 2025. Joining the webinar will offer you invaluable insights on what makes a Form W-4 invalid, and the right way to process a W-4. She will also answer your questions concerning the Form W-4 during the Q&A session. 
Session Objectives:
Understanding the proper way to process a federal W-4.
What should be the proper process for an invalid W-4 in 2025?
Electronic W-4 requirements and what the new form means for employers with electronic W-4 systems.
IRS Form W-4 change requirements and how it affects you as an employer.
Review and examples on the new ways to calculate federal taxation in 2025.
Expert Speaker:
 Dayna is currently the Director of Payroll Operations at a major medical center in Chicago. Dayna has been heavily involved in the payroll field for over 17 years. Starting as a payroll clerk at a small Tucson company, Dayna moved on to be a Payroll Team Leader at Honeywell Inc.
167 Madison Avenue Ste 205 #227 New York City, NY 10016 | support@professionalslearningcom

subject: Join Us March 6th
body:
Young Professional Fundraiser
 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Dear Briza, 
 
Join us on March 6th to support NAMI Chicago through our Associate Board fundraising event. Our Associate Board is made up of young professionals from the nonprofit, corporate, and philanthropic sectors who are all passionate about supporting mental health services in Chicago. This fundraising event is going to be an exciting evening filled with drinks, dancing, and an opportunity to make a real difference in the mental health community.
Event Details
Date
: March 6, 2025 from 5pm - 8pm
Location
: 
The Bassment, 353 W Hubbard St, Chicago, IL 60654

: Business casual

: Limited street parking available

: $80, which includes two drink tickets, appetizers, and access to our FABULOUS silent auction, which includes tickets to the 
Chicago Stars

Seiya Suzuki Cubs jersey
, among other items.
Don’t miss out on the chance to have fun, support a great cause, and connect with others who care. Questions or interested in sponsoring the event? Contact Emily Dehr at 
emilydehr@namichicago.org
. We hope to see you on March 6th!
Janelle Gibney
Associate Board Chair, NAMI Chicago

What Will Drive Stellar Results in 2025?
 
As you plan for 2025, the question on your mind is likely, 
How can I create impactful meetings that inspire connection and drive results?
 It starts with focusing on what attendees truly value—experiences that leave a lasting impression.
 
This year, personalization, technology, and immersion are redefining successful events. Attendees are drawn to tailored experiences such as customized breakout sessions and sustainable catering menus that reflect their preferences. Innovative technology solutions, including virtual site tours, hybrid event capabilities, and engagement-driving apps, are transforming how participants interact. Wellness remains a top priority, with mindfulness breaks, group fitness activities, and curated spa experiences fostering a healthier, more engaging environment. Meanwhile, sustainable practices—like eco-friendly décor and carbon-offset travel options—are becoming essential for meeting success.
 
At our properties, we’re prepared to help you deliver all of this and more. With breathtaking venues, state-of-the-art technology, and a commitment to sustainability and wellness, we’ll help you create meetings that inspire and exceed expectations.
 
Let’s make 2025 extraordinary. Contact us today with your vision, and we’ll handle the rest.
RFP FOR PERSONALIZED OFFERS
 
ARE YOU PLANNING A MEETING NOW OR WILL YOU BE SOON?
Get fast-tracked to our VIP list
YES/POSSIBLY
 
NO

Colorado Springs, Colorado
 
  
 
 
Book your program between January 30, 2025, and May 30, 2025, for meetings taking place in June 2025. Offer valid for new bookings only and cannot be combined with other promotions. Rooms and rates are subject to availability.
 
ELEVATE YOUR 2025 MEETINGS
NOW OPEN |

 is situated at the North Gate of the U.S. Air Force Academy in breathtaking Colorado Springs. With over 40,000 square feet of dynamic indoor and outdoor event space, much of which has unbelievable views of the mountains and valley, its an easy choice. For June 2025 meetings, we have an exclusive offer for you; hurry to avoid disappointment.
 
Offer Includes

20% allowable attrition

Complimentary flight simulator experience for up to 2 hours
CLAIM YOUR OFFER

Terranea Resort
Palos Verdes, California 
 
  
 
 
*Book by September 30, 2025 for meetings between April 1, 2025 and September 30, 2025. Minimum of a 2-night stay and 100 rooms peak per night. Valid for new business only and cannot be combines with any other offers and promotions. Rooms and rates are subject to date availability and blackout dates will not apply.
FROM THE OFFICE - TO THE OCEAN
Discover connection and inspire creativity at Southern California’s premier event destination, 
Terranea Resort
. Experience versatile venues for all occasions with sweeping views of the Pacific Ocean.
Take your brainstorm out of the boardroom and make a splash with coastal adventures, bespoke teambuilding activities, curated dining, and personalized service every step of the way, ensuring your extraordinary event is truly unforgettable.
 
Offer Includes:
Complimentary meeting space

20% off with Five-Star as exclusive audiovisual partner (excludes labor and rigging)
One complimentary room per 30 rooms booked

Complimentary cold/hot beverages and snacks in staff office
 
 CLAIM YOUR OFFER 
 
*Book by September 30, 2025 for meetings between April 1, 2025 and September 30, 2025. Minimum of a 2-night stay and 100 rooms peak per night. Valid for new business only and cannot be combines with any other offers and promotions. Rooms and rates are subject to date availability and blackout dates will not apply.
Pier Sixty Six
Fort Lauderdale, Florida
 
  
 
 
 
A RESORT WITH A STORY | NOW OPEN!
 
We’re excited to announce that 
Pier Sixty-Six
 has officially opened its doors! Nestled along 32 acres of the Intracoastal Waterway in Fort Lauderdale, our legendary property is stepping into a new era, blending history, luxury, and innovation. Offering 325 beautifully appointed guest rooms and suites with stunning views, direct access to a vibrant waterfront promenade, and a range of exciting restaurants and experiences, Pier Sixty-Six is ready to welcome you.
For meetings and events, we feature more than 40,000 square feet of versatile indoor and outdoor space, including one of the largest resort event venues in Fort Lauderdale. 
 
Reach out for introductory rates

subject: Design a Winning Employee Handbook for 2025
body:
Professionals Learning
Employee Handbook 2025: Critical Compliance Updates
Live Webinar 
Date: 
March 12, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 90 Minutes
Register Now
 
Given the sweeping changes introduced by the new administration, this is the right time to overhaul your Employee Handbook. Our speaker, Margie Faulk, will explore the recent NLRB updates that could impact your handbook’s compliance, particularly regarding employees' rights related to workplace discussions on pay, benefits, and safety.
We’ll examine how shifting federal, state, and local regulations may affect your policies, especially in multi-state or remote work environments, where compliance is key. With audits expected to increase in 2025, ensuring your handbook aligns with these new regulations is crucial to avoiding legal trouble and maintaining a compliant, up-to-date workplace. 
Session Objectives:
Participants will learn, identify, and prepare for employee handbook violations.
The course will identify the most common employee handbook violations and how to mitigate them.
Learn how the Department of Labor (DOL), and Equal Employment Opportunity Commission (EEOC) adapted to the changes based on the results of the elections.
Participants will learn which regulatory agency will focus on which regulation and mitigate the risk.
What policies are “must have” for your employee handbook?
Learn why Employers need to follow the National Labor Relations Board and why they should care about policies that can be unlawful with new requirements.
Expert Speaker:
 Margie Faulk is a senior-level human resource professional with over 15 years of HR management and compliance experience. A current Compliance Advisor for HR Compliance Solutions, LLC, Margie, has worked as an HR Compliance advisor for major corporations and small businesses in the small, large, private, public, and non-profit sectors.
167 Madison Avenue Ste 205 #227 New York City, NY 10016 | support@professionalslearningcom
