Product-Market Fit Is Not a One-Time Thing
We've got to constantly evolve.
Chris Zvirbulis
Feb 6
 
READ IN APP
 
Most business books treat "product-market fit" like a milestone.
Something we reach after hard work—and then check off our list.
But that’s not how it works.
Product-market fit isn’t a one-time achievement...
It’s an ongoing process.
Markets shift.
Customer needs evolve.
What worked yesterday might not work tomorrow.
For this reason, we can't ever get complacent.
Here are four thoughts on how to calibrate our product-market fit in an ongoing, continual way:
1) This Requires Brutal Honesty
Markets don’t stand still.
Technologies advance.
Consumer behaviors shift.
Competitors innovate.
Just look at companies like Blockbuster.
Once the king of home entertainment... they clung to a model that stopped fitting the market.
Even tech giants aren't immune.
Remember when BlackBerry dominated the smartphone world?
They failed to adapt to the touch-screen revolution.
Staying relevant means being brutally honest about whether our product still meets current demands, no matter how successful it was in the past.
We have to be willing to throw out yesterday's playbook if we want to remain profitable tomorrow.
2) There Is No Customer Feedback Like Watching What They Will Actually Pay For
Surveys, interviews, and focus groups can offer insights...
But they’re no substitute for observing actual purchasing behavior.
Take Netflix’s data-driven approach—they don’t just ask viewers what they like; they analyze what people watch, rewatch, and abandon.
Real transactions cut through the noise.
If customers aren’t buying, the market is telling you something important.
And it's often something no survey could reveal.
3) Don’t Obsess Over the Competition, But Definitely Watch Them
Focusing too much on competitors can lead to over-reactive responses...
But ignoring them entirely is equally risky.
Think about how Instagram rapidly adapted Stories after Snapchat's success.
They didn’t copy blindly; they integrated the feature into their ecosystem, enhancing user engagement.
Monitoring competitors helps us spot shifts in customer preferences and emerging trends—without losing sight of our own vision.
4) Your Level of Product-Market Fit Should Be Governed by Your Level of Ambition
Not every business needs Amazon-level product-market fit.
A local ice cream truck thrives on serving a specific neighborhood... while Jeff Bezos aimed to meet the needs of a global customer base.
The broader our ambition, the more robust and adaptable our product-market fit needs to be.
Recognizing this helps set realistic goals and resource allocations.
In Conclusion…
Product-market fit isn’t a destination.
It’s a continuous journey.
The businesses that thrive are the ones that stay curious.
Stay honest.
And stay willing to adapt.

Comment

subject: 2x unicorn CFO: How to allocate capital
body:
Learn how Adam Swiecicki uses metrics, psychology, and experience to position his company for high growth that’s sustainable.͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ ͏‌ 
 
FEBRUARY 5, 2025
­
Matthew Huo
Editor
It’s great to meet the 19,381 of you reading this first issue. I’ll keep this short.
 
At Rippling, we see three levels to the game for finance and accounting.
 
Level 1:
 Ensuring accuracy of money in & money out.
Level 2:
 Forecasting, managing the top line, and PnL hygiene.
Level 3:
 Understanding the business drivers and identifying areas for investment and opportunities for the company. Doing things differently.
 
Being at Level 3 is what it means to be a Spendsetter—having a strong foundation to nail the details, plus the strategic mind to constantly evolve and become a trailblazer.
 
If you’re not there yet, this newsletter will help you get there. And if you’re already there, then this newsletter will give you fresh perspectives from your fellow Spendsetters.
 
My job is to make this email an invaluable resource. It’s written and curated with the help of titans of finance who are at the pinnacle of their game. Enjoy.
Key takeaways
Adam Swiecicki:
 How to allocate capital
Efficiency metrics:
 Top five you need track
Deloitte tactics:
 Four tips for growth-oriented cost cutting
Crypto SEC taskforce:
 What it means for the industry
Meme:
 Hopefully one that makes you chuckle
🦄 2x unicorn CFO explains how to allocate capital
 
Adam Swiecicki has raised over $2B in VC funding as the current CFO of Rippling and former CFO of Brex. Safe to say, he’s a Spendsetter.
 
Today we’ll dive into his step-by-step guide to help high-growth companies effectively manage their cash–so you don’t have to go through the same ups and downs that he did.
 
First, prioritize long-term value over market trends. 
Ignore the extremes of investors and market sentiment—either “grow at all costs” or “cut to break even.” You can’t adjust your business as quickly as  investors and markets can change their opinions (which is often overnight). Instead, make decisions based on the long-term “through cycle” earnings power of your business.
Second, emphasize unit economics and track efficiency metrics. 
A data-driven foundation helps you avoid inefficient spending or missteps when scaling. Here are five the most important metrics to track for VC-backed companies in software and fintech like Rippling:
 
LTV/CAC ratio
 (Lifetime Value to Customer Acquisition Cost), which measures whether your customer acquisition costs are justified by the long-term revenue you’ll gain.
CAC payback period
, which measures the time to recover the cost of acquiring a customer.
Burn multiple
, which measures your efficiency of cash burn relative to revenue growth.
Churn rate
, which measures the percentage of customers who leave during a specific time period.
Net dollar retention (NDR)
, which measures revenue retained from existing customers, including upsells, cross-sells, downgrades, and churn.
 
For a usable scorecard of these five metrics that shows the “bad, good, excellent” benchmarks for each one, 
click here
.
 
NDR and churn are especially important concepts because keeping existing customers, or cross selling them, is cheaper and more margin-friendly. Lower churn also reduces the “leaky bucket problem.” I.e. If you’re a $10M business, a churn rate of 20% means you have to acquire $2M of new business to achieve a 0% growth rate. At $100M, this becomes $20M! 
 
Third, remember, not all cash burn is created equal.
Efficient cash burn is about ensuring each dollar drives valuable growth, not just increasing your top line revenue at any cost. For example, with sales and marketing, hold off on significant sales investments until you reach a stable CAC payback period, signaling solid product-market fit.
 
For R&D, use industry benchmarks, like engineering headcount as a percentage of revenue, to gauge appropriate R&D spend based on your company stage. Avoid the trap of over-investing in R&D for a limited opportunity.
 
Fourth, plan for the worst, hope for the best.
Plan at least 24 months in advance, and always have a base case, worst case, and best case scenario—but thoroughly plan for the worst case scenario. Identify your “burn levers,” the expenses you can cut if needed, so you can stay agile if revenue dips or cash burn spikes.
 
Fifth, re-forecast regularly and utilize excess revenue wisely.
You should revise your financial forecasts at least quarterly—or sooner if there’s a significant deviation from the plan.
 
In my experience, costs usually land as expected, but revenue can lag behind. And there’s usually a delay between when costs are incurred and when you see their revenue impact or lack thereof.
 
Conversely, if revenue is growing ahead of your plan, it might be the wrong decision to allow that excess revenue to fall to the bottom line. Instead, take this as a sign that there are areas where you should double down and reinvest to drive even more growth.
 
Sixth, understand the advantages of your cash flow dynamics.
In SaaS businesses, upfront annual subscriptions pull forward revenues to generate higher cash flows than net income for a given period, especially during growth phases. You should leverage this advantage to drive growth. Consider what incentives you can set to collect more cash upfront and lock in customers for longer periods of time.
 
For inventory-based businesses like ecommerce, upfront inventory costs mean cash burn is often higher than net income. Here, in the early stages, be mindful of metrics like inventory turnover, and do whatever you can to shorten the lag between buying inventory and customer sell-through.
 
For an even more in-depth playbook of allocating capital from Adam Swiecicki, 
check out our complete guide
.
 
📝 Action audit
01
Identify
 the five key efficiency metrics mentioned above for your company, and create a plan to improve any lagging metrics
02
Re-evaluate
 your company’s burn levers, and make sure you proactively understand exactly where you can cut costs if needed
03
Search
 for opportunities to improve your cash flow by either collecting more from customers upfront or paying less upfront to vendors

subject: 2025 Compliance: Stop FMLA, ADA and Workers’ Comp Abuse Now
body:
Professionals Learning
FMLA, ADA & Workers’ Comp: Preventing Leave Abuse in 2025
Live Webinar 
Date: 
February 26, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 90 Minutes
Register Now
 
Gain insights into how to define leave misuse, common ways employees misuse leave time, determining eligibility, and intermittent leave. Understand the key aspects necessary to navigate the FMLA, ADA, and Worker's compensation requirements effectively and ensure compliance within your organization. The speaker will also disclose the complexities of navigating complicated intersections between the FMLA and the ADA, to ensure your organization remains compliant with all relevant regulations while maintaining a productive and supportive workplace.
Coordinating compliance, handling intermittent leave, and determining reasonable accommodations under the FMLA, ADA, and Workers' Compensation laws can be challenging. Learn from our expert, Janette S. Levey, who will provide a working knowledge of how you can minimize your company’s exposure to employee misuse of the FMLA. 
Session Objectives:
Common Ways Employees Abuse Leave Time.
Defining Leave Abuse and Determining Eligibility.
Reasonable Accommodations under the ADA/ADAAA.
Alternatives to leave as tools for curbing FMLA Abuse.
Investigations of Suspected Leave Abuse and Intermittent leave. 
Leave and COVID concerns. 
Expert Speaker:
 Janette S. Levey, Principal Attorney of Levey Law, LLC, is an employment/HR attorney with over 20 years of legal experience. Ms. Levey is a legal wellness professional for employment practices and workforce challenges. She works with employers to craft solid employment practices wellness plans tailored to address an organization’s needs and concerns.
167 Madison Avenue Ste 205 #227 New York City, NY 10016 | support@professionalslearningcom

body:
Hi Briza,
I'd be happy to provide more details and explore how BPA Quality can enhance your contact center operations. Please let me know your availability for next week.
Thanks,
Jennifer
From: Jennifer
Sent: 04 Feb 2025
To: b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
Subject: Briza | Available for a Quick Chat?
Hi Briza,
Just checking in to see if you’re available for a brief call to explore how BPA Quality can help enhance your contact center operations. Let me know a time that works for you!
Thanks,
Jennifer
From: Jennifer
Sent: 03 Feb 2025
To: b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
Subject: Briza | Available for a Quick Chat?
Hi Briza,
I’d love to talk with you today or sometime next week about how our BPA Quality can support your customer experience goals.
Do you have some time available?
Thanks,
Jennifer
From: Jennifer
Sent: 31 Jan 2025
To: b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
Subject: Briza | Available for a Quick Chat?
Hi Briza,
Imagine this scenario: Your customers' voices aren't just heard—they're the force propelling your service forward. With BPA Quality's 
360-degree approach to Customer Satisfaction Scores (CSAT) and performance insights
, each customer interaction becomes a blueprint for a better experience.
Picture it:
 you're reviewing last month's data of the usual CSAT scores, and you see the story behind them. One global technology client saw 
an 18% jump in CSAT
 and a 
$2 million reduction in callbacks
 because they had clearer insight. Our Psychometric-backed feedback gave them a picture of the "what" and the "why" behind each customer response. 
Our 360 Approach Means:
Balanced Insights: We blend CSAT, QM, and mystery shopping for a truly balanced view, revealing both the objective "how" and the human-centered "why."
Real, Actionable Change: Each insight is tied to a specific action. Our process saw a 13% improvement in first-call resolution for a leading technology company.
Proven Growth: From better service delivery to increased revenue, our clients consistently report higher customer satisfaction and streamlined operations.
Let's chat about how we can turn customer feedback into a competitive edge for your team. Can you share some available times that work for you?
Thanks,
Jennifer

subject: The Bias Aware Workplace
body:
Developing a more inclusive team culture
 
 
 
High Performance Bias Awareness Training
Learn to bring more authentic curiosity and goodwill to workplace culture, no shaming, blaming or finger pointing. Without creating division, this experiential process offers metacognitive tools to engage relevant self awareness, building cultures where we meet on the common ground of respect. This training opens the door for more of something teams always need: 
unity
.  
View the Program Overview
 
 
Build capacities for recognizing implicit bias and skills for new thinking and awareness. 
 
 
Create the context for more empathy and belonging as foundational values.
 
 
Develop a culture that knows the power of inclusivity with the agility to sidestep bias traps.
 
Unity through Awareness™
Teams thrive and productivity soars when there is a sense of team unity. This doesn’t happen by accident, and courageous leaders know it. Provision your team with skills to maximize alignment, collaboration and goodwill. Through an interactive metacognitive process, your team will build the internal capacity to create a more inclusive culture, driving the potential for everyone to bring their best, while developing and enhancing deeper critical thinking skills.

subject: Celebrate Employee Appreciation Day—Empower Your Team with Let’s Roam!
body:
When you start a chat with your team make sure to... 
 
Hi Briza, 
  
Employee Appreciation Day
 is here—and with it, the perfect opportunity to highlight your team’s dedication, recognize achievements, and spread a little extra gratitude all around. This is your go-to guide for celebrating, connecting, and inspiring the people who keep your organization thriving day after day. 
Cue the Confetti🎊 
Employee Appreciation Week is your chance to go beyond the usual and show genuine gratitude. Celebrate with heartfelt gestures, interactive recognition activities, and 
our classic Scavenger Hunts
, lighthearted 
Coworker Feud
, or thrilling 
Murder Mystery
 experiences. Let’s make this week an uplifting blend of fun, teamwork, and appreciation! 
Weekly Team-spiration🏋🏽 
Looking for fresh ways to recognize and motivate your team? Energize your team with a personal touch! In 
The 5 Languages of Appreciation in the Workplace
, Gary Chapman and Paul White remind us that everyone feels valued differently. Ask each person how they prefer recognition—be it a quick note, public praise, or one-on-one time. Personalized appreciation keeps morale high and productivity soaring! 
Start a fun conversation! 🎉 Copy and paste this into your team chat: 
 
Here at Let’s Roam, we love surprising a teammate with a spontaneous coffee or a simple “thank you” note—it’s like fueling a burst of positivity without the dreaded midday slump! Even the smallest gesture can spark a chain reaction of gratitude. Now it’s your turn: what’s a small act of kindness that truly made your coworker’s day? We’d love to hear how you spread the appreciation! 
Let’s Roam Fun Fact📖 
Did you know that teams who regularly share genuine words of thanks see up to a 65% boost in workplace satisfaction? (Yes, we measured it!) In honor of 
Employee Appreciation Day
, we’d love to hear: 
What’s a small act of gratitude that truly made your coworker’s day?
 Share your stories, and let’s keep the appreciation rolling! 
2025 Game-Changers🚀 
Think bigger, dream bolder, and show your team how appreciated they truly are. This year, we’re rolling out two brand-new games and revamping 
our classic virtual team-building
 with fresh twists—all designed to bring teams together, spark creativity, and make every celebration unforgettable. Get ready for a year full of big ideas and even bigger team wins! 
Plan Your Big Thank-You Moment💌 
Your team deserves a celebration as extraordinary as they are! We’ve got endless ways to shout, 
“You’re amazing!”
 
Ready to turn Employee Appreciation Day into a memorable adventure? Let’s make it happen—
BOOK
 with us today and let the fun begin! 
  
Cheers to your team,
 
Let's Roam 
 
 
 
 
Let's Roam, LLC, 4023 Kennett Pike, #50241, Wilmington, DE 19807, United States, 1-(833)-202-ROAM (7626)

subject: Prepare for Immigration Raids in 2025
body:
Be Prepared: Navigating Immigration Raids in 2025
Live Webinar
 | 1.5 CEUs | SHRM and HRCI Approved
Date:
 February 14, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration: 
90 Minutes
Register Now
 
Why You Should Attend:
Do you know that employers nationwide are facing increased scrutiny with Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) audits, known as "Silent Raids”? Many employers may unknowingly hire unauthorized workers, even with I-9 forms and E-Verify, due to counterfeit documents. 
Learn from our expert Speaker, “Margie Faulk”, about the I-9 verification, storage, and destruction. This webinar will provide valuable insights into the differences between Silent Raids and Forced Raids. Learn how to internally audit I-9s to find and fix patterns of errors. This webinar will teach you how to prepare an immigration component for the employer’s lawful compliance policy. Learn how to mitigate raids by ICE to sensitive locations like hospitals, places of worship, and schools. 
Session Highlights:
Learn how to Make sure I-9 verification, storage, and destruction are being handled meticulously at all sites.
Learn the differences between Silent Raids and Forced Raids.
Learn how to Internally audit I-9s to find and fix patterns of errors.
Learn how enrolling in E-Verify can reduce ICE fines and penalties.
Learn how to prepare an immigration component to the employer’s legal compliance policy.
Learn how to mitigate raids by ICE to sensitive locations like hospitals, places of worships and schools.
About Expert Speaker:
Margie Faulk is a senior-level human resource professional with over 15 years of HR management and compliance experience. A current Compliance Advisor for HR Compliance Solutions, LLC, Margie, has worked as an HR Compliance advisor for major corporations and small businesses in the small, large, private, public, and non-profit sectors.

Hi Briza,
Imagine this scenario: Your customers' voices aren't just heard—they're the force propelling your service forward. With BPA Quality's 
360-degree approach to Customer Satisfaction Scores (CSAT) and performance insights
, each customer interaction becomes a blueprint for a better experience.
Picture it:
 you're reviewing last month's data of the usual CSAT scores, and you see the story behind them. One global technology client saw 
an 18% jump in CSAT

$2 million reduction in callbacks

Our 360 Approach Means:
Balanced Insights: We blend CSAT, QM, and mystery shopping for a truly balanced view, revealing both the objective "how" and the human-centered "why."
Real, Actionable Change: Each insight is tied to a specific action. Our process saw a 13% improvement in first-call resolution for a leading technology company.
Proven Growth: From better service delivery to increased revenue, our clients consistently report higher customer satisfaction and streamlined operations.
Let's chat about how we can turn customer feedback into a competitive edge for your team. Can you share some available times that work for you?
Thanks,
Jennifer

subject: REGISTER TODAY: Navigating Gender & Inclusion Webinar
body:
What you need to know about changes to pay equity efforts in this new landscape.
 
 
Continuing our series on the recent executive orders (EOs) from President Donald Trump, we note that in addition to the DEI mandates, the EOs also recognize only two genders—male and female. Therefore, it’s crucial to understand the implications for workplace inclusion and gender pay equity. These policy shifts may significantly impact organizational strategies aimed at fostering inclusive environments and ensuring fair compensation across genders. 
Join us for an insightful webinar featuring three experts from SHRM and a leading employment law expert as they delve into the nuances of these Eos. The discussion will focus on promoting inclusion through the lens of gender, analyzing how the new directives affect pay equity initiatives, and exploring strategies to navigate these changes while maintaining a commitment to inclusion and diversity for all employees—men and women—taking into account the positive reality that men and women are different. 
Earn 1 PDC toward recertification for attending.
 
 
REGISTER NOW
 
 
Key Takeaways:
 
 
An overview of the recent executive orders and their specific provisions related to gender recognition and DEI programs.
 
Insights into the potential effects on gender pay equity and broader gender-related workplace issues.
 
Practical guidance on adapting organizational policies to comply with new regulations while upholding principles of inclusion and diversity.
 
 
 
About the Speakers
 
 
 
 
Christy E. Kiely, J.D
 
 
Partner, Seyfarth Shaw LLP
 
 
Christy E. Kiely is a Partner in the Labor and Employment Group of Seyfarth Shaw LLP. She focuses on EEO, DEI, OFCCP, and Pay Equity and helps employers manage their workforce efficiently and with minimal risk while honoring their core values.
 
 
 
 
 
Alex Alonso, Ph.D., SHRM-SCP
 
 
Chief Data & Analytics Officer, SHRM
 
 
Alex Alonso leads SHRM’s intelligence, insights, and innovation function. His career portfolio has been based upon practical thought leadership designed to make better workplaces.
 
 
 
 
 
 
Tamla Oates-Forney
 
 
CEO, Linkage, a SHRM eCompany
 
 
Tamla Oates-Forney is an innovative thought leader, women’s advocate, and philanthropist committed to advancing women leaders and inclusion within organizations.
 
 
 
 
 
Anuradha Hebbar
 
 
President, SHRM CEO Action Inclusion & Diversity
 
 
Anuradha Hebbar is a strategic business leader with expertise in HR strategy, DEI, and change management, advising CEOs and C-suite leaders.
 
 
 
 
If It’s a Work Thing, It’s a SHRM Thing
As these critical changes evolve, you need more than just answers.
 
On Feb. 4, SHRM membership increases to $299
. Join SHRM now at the current rate of $264 and access exclusive member resources such as: 
Trusted guidance from SHRM’s HR Knowledge Advisors for your toughest HR challenges. 
Industry-leading insights and content that keep you prepared for what’s next.
Dedicated how-to guides and toolkits to streamline your day-to-day tasks. 
Peer discussions via SHRMConnect, available 24/7 for real-time collaboration.
No matter what “work thing” you’re facing, you deserve a partner committed to elevating—and advocating for—all things work, workers, and the workplace.

|  
Update Preferences
Sky-High Experiences and Mountain-View Meetings: Discover Hotel Polaris!
Collection Spotlight
Allow Us to Introduce 
Hotel
 
Polaris 
Hotel Polaris, situated just outside the North Gate of the U.S. Air Force Academy in Colorado Springs, offers an inspiring setting for events of any size. The dedicated event floor features floor-to-ceiling windows, providing attendees with 
breathtaking views of the 14,115-foot Pikes Peak,
 known as America’s Mountain. Pair this incredible location and breathtaking views with over 40,000 square feet of versatile indoor and outdoor event spaces — including a 12,000-square-foot grand ballroom, a 5,000-square-foot junior ballroom, and a variety of meeting rooms and boardrooms - and your meeting or event is sure to be incredible.
Hotel Polaris offers an array of engaging and decidedly unique 
team-building activities.
 Groups experience the thrill of flight in one of three on-site flight simulators—two F-16s and one 737 MAX - each featuring full cockpit mock-ups with working controls and switches. These simulators provide a tactile and immersive experience and are truly one-of-a-kind.
REACH OUT FOR AVAILABILE DATES
 
Featured Review
"I attended a 3-day 
work conference
 at Polaris! The meeting space was fantastic with 
natural light
, free 
yoga in the morning
, amazing 
banquets & catering
. It basically 
felt like a retreat
! And the 
flight simulator
 - OMG! They also organized a great 
teambuilding event with puppies
. THANK YOU! 
- Nicole S on TripAdvisor
Soar into Flavor at The Aviator 
The Aviator offers a dining experience that combines elegance with bold culinary creativity. Featuring aviation-inspired décor and breathtaking mountain views, The Aviator’s menu is packed with standout dishes designed to delight every palate. Begin with sophisticated starters like Colorado Beet Salad, Charred Spanish Octopus, or Deviled Eggs. Indulge in flavorful mains such as the New England Lobster Roll, Poke Bowl, or the show-stopping Lemay Carpaccio. For a shareable treat, the Davis Platter or the grand Pros Arentane is perfect for groups. With innovative options like Bao Buns and Tuna Nachos, The Aviator delivers a first-class dining journey.
At a Glance
ACCOMMODATIONS 
| The Hotel Polaris features 375 sleek, aviation-inspired guest rooms and suites with stunning views of Pikes Peak and modern amenities, creating a luxurious and relaxing stay.
MEETING SPACE
 | Over 40,000 square feet of versatile event venues, including a grand ballroom, meeting rooms, and boardrooms, all with floor-to-ceiling windows showcasing breathtaking views of the Rockies. Perfect for everything from corporate conferences to intimate gatherings.
TEAM BUILDING
 | Unique activities such as immersive flight simulators, scenic outdoor experiences, and custom group challenges designed to foster connection and collaboration among teams.
DINING
 | Hotel Polaris offers six distinct dining experiences, each with its own unique ambiance and menu. The Aviator serves upscale cuisine with dishes like Charred Spanish Octopus and Poke Bowls, while Polaris Market provides quick bites and on-the-go options. For handcrafted cocktails and a relaxed atmosphere, head to the Flight Deck Bar.
LOCATION
 | Conveniently located just 1 mile from the North Gate of the U.S. Air Force Academy and 20 miles from Colorado Springs Airport, The Hotel Polaris provides easy access to major attractions and awe-inspiring mountain landscapes.
FIVE-SECOND CONTACT FORM
 
CoralTree Hospitality
188 Inverness Dr W UNIT 300,
Englewood, CO 80112
303-799-3830
Coraltreehospitality.com

subject: FW: Briza
body:
Hi Briza,
I’d love to talk with you today or sometime next week about how our BPA Quality can support your customer experience goals.
Do you have some time available?
Thanks,
Jennifer
From: Jennifer
Sent: 31 Jan 2025
To: b.cardenas@lcwmail.com
Subject: Briza | Available for a Quick Chat?
Hi Briza,
Imagine this scenario: Your customers' voices aren't just heard—they're the force propelling your service forward. With BPA Quality's 
360-degree approach to Customer Satisfaction Scores (CSAT) and performance insights
, each customer interaction becomes a blueprint for a better experience.
Picture it:
 you're reviewing last month's data of the usual CSAT scores, and you see the story behind them. One global technology client saw 
an 18% jump in CSAT
 and a 
$2 million reduction in callbacks
 because they had clearer insight. Our Psychometric-backed feedback gave them a picture of the "what" and the "why" behind each customer response. 
Our 360 Approach Means:
Balanced Insights: We blend CSAT, QM, and mystery shopping for a truly balanced view, revealing both the objective "how" and the human-centered "why."
Real, Actionable Change: Each insight is tied to a specific action. Our process saw a 13% improvement in first-call resolution for a leading technology company.
Proven Growth: From better service delivery to increased revenue, our clients consistently report higher customer satisfaction and streamlined operations.
Let's chat about how we can turn customer feedback into a competitive edge for your team. Can you share some available times that work for you?
Thanks,
Jennifer

subject: 2025 Small Business Update: Inflation, taxes, workforce shortages, and more
body:
What you need to prepare for what’s to come
 
Small Business Update
EVENT REPLAY & RESOURCES 
[ICYMI] Key Insights for Small Business Success
 
The U.S. economic landscape presents a mix of opportunities and challenges for small businesses in 2025. In this week's Small Business Update, 
U.S. Chamber Chief Policy Officer Neil Bradley
 provided key insights into these issues and offered a roadmap for small business success in the year ahead. 
WATCH THE REPLAY
 
 
  
The discussion highlights several key areas impacting small businesses, including:
‌
Tax and Regulatory Shifts
: Changes in tax laws and regulations can significantly impact a small business's bottom line. Bradley stressed the need for small business owners to understand potential compliance burdens and explore available resources to navigate these changes. 
Workforce Shortages
: A persistent challenge for many small businesses, the update touched on the importance of exploring innovative recruitment strategies, focusing on competitive compensation and packages.  
  
  
  
Want the latest updates on the Corporate Transparency Act?
Get the Latest >
 
  
The Rise of AI
: Bradley highlighted how small businesses that understand and adapt to technological shifts can strategically leverage AI for efficiency, customer service, and innovation. 
Optimism and Resilience
: Despite the complexities that 2025 may bring, Bradley's message was optimistic. This year will require navigating many complexities, but with the right approach, small businesses can continue to be the driving force of the American economy. 
‌
Catch the full recap
 to stay informed and seize opportunities in the evolving economic landscape!

subject: This is right up your alley—I totally thought of you!
body:
You’re the first person I thought of when I saw this.
 
Dear Oya Arts Family,
January flew by in the blink of an eye! Now, as we step into February—the month of Black history and love—we have an exciting lineup of events ahead. Check out what’s in store below!
ART ESCAPE ROOM IS HERE!
 
FEB - APRIL
Join Oya Arts' 
Art Escape Room Experience
 and embark on an ancient Egyptian adventure! Solve riddles, unlock your painting, and uncover the secrets of a forgotten pharaoh.
No art experience needed—just curiosity! Perfect for solo explorers, groups, or team-building events. 
Early bird specials are live, so secure your spot now!
LEARN MORE 
TOMORROW: WINTER ART CRAWL AT BACHMANS 
 
SAT FEB 1: 10 AM-4 PM, SUNDAY FEB 2: 10 AM-4 PM
Celebrate the creativity of Minnesota artists and the beauty of natural materials at Bachman’s on Lyndale! Visit me at 
Booth 25
 for a weekend filled with inspiration, artistry, and community.
 
LEARN MORE 
THE BLACK VOTE EXHIBITION OPENING 
 
THURS FEB 6: 6 PM-8 PM
 Join us for the opening reception of 
"The Black Vote"
 exhibition. This thought-provoking showcase explores how African Americans gained the right to vote in Minnesota and the rise of Black elected officials in the state. It also commemorates the 
60th anniversary of the Voting Rights Act of 1965.
.
LEARN MORE 
 THE MYSTERY OF THE LOST NOTES 
 
SUN FEB 23: 4 PM-7 PM
Oya Arts is thrilled to partner with 
Queermunity
 for an immersive Black History Month event: 
Hidden Legacy: The Mystery of the Lost Notes.
Step into the glamour of the 1920s, follow clues, solve riddles, and uncover the story of a trailblazing figure whose legacy was lost to history. With each brushstroke, your painting becomes the key to unlocking the past.
Fancy dress is encouraged, and prizes await the most dazzling detectives!
 Grab your tickets today!
LEARN MORE 
FOR THE LOVE OF BLAQ ART
 
THURS FEB 27 - MARCH 1
This three-day cultural event celebrates Black artists in the Twin Cities, featuring visual art from 
Oya Arts, The Tipton Hammond Gallery, Jorie, L Arts, and Seangarrison.
The event kicks off on 
February 27th
 with poetry from 
A.E. Wynter, Jerome Hill Artist Fellow (2024–2028),
 and others, followed by the exhibit opening on 
February 28th.
Don’t miss this immersive art and poetry experience!
LEARN MORE 
MINNESOTA MARDI GRAS
 
 MARCH 1
11 AM-1 PM & 5 PM -8PM
Oya Arts is partnering with 
We Consulting
 to bring the vibrant spirit of 
New Orleans
 to 
Minneapolis!
This unforgettable 
Paint & Sip
 celebration features:
 A lively 
day parade
 with a 
po’boy lunch
 and 
king cake
 An 
evening glow-in-the-dark experience
 with 
gumbo, mocktails,
 and a 
Bourbon Street dance party
Immerse yourself in 
music, color, and authentic NOLA vibes!
 
Tickets are limited—grab yours now!
 
LEARN MORE 
MARK YOUR CALENDERS 
 
SAT MARCH 22: 6.30-8.30 PM
Can you believe Oya Arts Studio is turning one in March? Time has flown! To celebrate, we're throwing a birthday party filled with Caribbean vibes, featuring live steel pan music from the popular SocaHolix and delicious Caribbean food from Chana Trinidadian Kitchen. Plus, there will be a raffle and special discounts to celebrate this milestone. Register below to secure your free ticket! 
GET YOUR FREE TICKET

subject: Best Practices in Accounting Data Management for Entrepreneurs
body:
The latest insights from AccountingDepartment.com
Not rendering correctly? View this email as a web page 
here
. 
Thought Leadership from the Leaders in Virtual Accounting & Bookkeeping Services
We hope you enjoy these recent posts from our blog...
Best Practices in Accounting Data Management for Entrepreneurs
Thursday, January 30, 2025 4:17 PM
 
Effective accounting data management isn't just about tidy spreadsheets and balancing your books. It's about safeguarding your business's financial health while ensuring seamless operations. 
Read more »
    
Utilizing FP&A for More Effective Financial Planning
Wednesday, January 29, 2025 4:40 PM
 
For any business owner, prioritizing the company’s future is essential. Financial planning plays a crucial role in this, enabling business owners to drive growth and broaden their operations.
If a business owner hasn’t focused on this aspect, they need to understand what it is, what it does, and how it differs from regular accounting.
What Is FP&A?
FP&A, or financial planning and analysis, is a set of activities that look into a company’s financial future. It can include multiple elements, such as budgeting and forecasting, annual planning, and financial modeling and reporting.
This process uses income statements, balance sheets, and other financial business records, going beyond the initial review to analyze the in-depth numbers to develop a company forecast.
The goal of FP&A is to enable businesses to track their current performance and forecast future outcomes. While monitoring, the analyst generates reports to assist the business in preparing for anticipated results. FP&A examines historical data and forecasts future trends to aid companies in making informed business decisions.
What FP&A Services Look Like
If company executives plan to hire an accounting firm to perform FP&A services, they may wonder what those services include. FP&A encompasses four aspects of a business.
Descriptive Analysis.
 Using data from the past, descriptive analysis shows what has happened in the business. The analyst will look at the financial statements and any reports generated to determine how the company has performed.
Diagnostic Analysis. 
A diagnostic analysis goes deeper into the past by explaining the why behind the what. It looks at trends in the industry and decisions the company has made over time.
Predictive Analysis.
 The central focus of predictive analysis comprises looking to the future. Therefore, this service predicts what will occur based on the business’s past and current decisions.
Prescriptive Analysis. 
A prescriptive analysis starts with a goal and shows what is required to attain it. The analyst may use different scenarios to show what needs to happen to reach that goal.
Differences Between FP&A and Traditional Accounting Services
Traditional accounting services concentrate on documenting expenses and income to ensure a business complies with regulations and remains operational. Reports are crafted to illustrate past events and how they align with the budget.
On the other hand, 
FP&A services look to the future, using forecasting and financial planning
 to create a strategy that moves the business forward. While accounting tells what is happening with the company, FP&A answers the question of why it’s happening.
FP&A must also adjust to shifts prompted by new information. For instance, a company’s projections might require revision due to fresh data. Real-time updates offer evolving insights into the business, enabling the owner to utilize the information to impact their financial outcomes.
Benefits of FP&A for Businesses
FP&A offers numerous advantages for a business. First, it allows the owner or executive to understand the company's future trajectory if current conditions persist. While forecasting at this stage is fairly simple, the reports must still consider shifts in trends and economic conditions.
Another benefit of FP&A is that it 
helps business owners determine new goals
 and know what it will take to reach them. Through predictive analysis, they can learn what changes must be made in the company’s revenue to expand the business operations. For instance, if the owner wants to add a new location, they’ll need to know how much of an increase in income they will require to purchase the property.
FP&A also tracks how well the company is doing concerning its goals. The analyst can prepare a variance report showing where the company has gone off-track. Then, the executive can take corrective action to reach their goals or adapt them toward a new focus.
Another benefit of FP&A is providing the “why” to what happened. Through descriptive analysis, the business owner understands why they weren’t on budget last month or year. 
They can see where things didn’t work out
 as expected and how to avoid that situation in the future. For example, the owner may notice that spending was higher in one area than what the budget allowed. Perhaps accounts receivable were outstanding longer than expected, which led to poor cash flow.
Through predictive analysis, executives can also better prepare for changes. Therefore, if business owners find that revenue decreases every summer, they can adjust their spending in the spring, giving them more cash to get through the slow season until business picks up in the fall.
Take Your Business to the Next Level
Companies need to develop a solid financial planning strategy
 to succeed, and AccountingDepartment.com can help. It’s time to leverage financial information with FP&A services from AccountingDepartment.com to elevate your business and achieve your goals. Contact us today to learn more.
Read more »

You will receive 4 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points, for a total of 7, for each dollar of eligible purchases charged directly with a property within the Hilton portfolio, including bookings and incidental charges. To receive the 4 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for charges made at the time of booking, the booking must be made directly through a reservation channel operated by Hilton. You can receive the 4 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points for incidental charges made at the hotel (including charges made at restaurants, spas, and other establishments) if those charges can be and are charged to your room and paid for with your Hilton Honors American Express Card at checkout. You will receive 2 additional Hilton Honors Bonus Points, for a total of 5, for each dollar of eligible purchases at the following categories of merchants: restaurants located in the U.S., supermarkets located in the U.S. and on gasoline at gas stations located in the U.S. Note that purchases of groceries made at superstores, warehouse clubs, and convenience stores, and purchases from meal-kit delivery services will only get 3 Bonus Points per dollar. Purchases of gasoline at supermarkets, superstores, and warehouse clubs will only get 3 Bonus Points per dollar. To get additional Points for a restaurant purchase, the purchase must be at a restaurant located in the United States. You will NOT get additional Points for purchases made at a restaurant owned by a U.S. company but located outside the U.S. (e.g. Hard Rock Café in Paris). You also will NOT get additional Points for restaurant purchases at nightclubs, convenience stores, grocery stores, or supermarkets. You may not get additional Points for purchases at a restaurant located within another establishment (e.g. a restaurant inside a hotel, casino, or event venue). For example, purchases made at a restaurant located within a hotel may be recognized as a purchase at a hotel, not a restaurant. Your Hilton Honors Points are subject to Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions; see 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
.Eligible purchases are purchases for goods and services minus returns and other credits. Eligible purchases do NOT include fees or interest charges, cash advances, purchases of travelers checks, purchases or reloading of prepaid cards, purchases of gift cards, person-to-person payments, or purchases of other cash equivalents. Hilton Honors Bonus Points you earn with your Card will be posted to your Hilton Honors account up to 12 weeks after the end of your billing period. 
Merchants are assigned codes based on what they primarily sell. We group certain merchant codes into categories that are eligible for additional Points. A purchase with a merchant will not receive additional Points if the merchant’s code is not included in a reward category. You may not receive additional Points if we receive inaccurate information or are otherwise unable to identify your purchase as eligible for a reward category. For example, you may not receive additional Points when: a merchant uses a third-party to sell their products or services; or a merchant uses a third-party to process or submit your transaction to us (e.g., using mobile or wireless card readers); or you choose to make a purchase using a third-party payment account or make a purchase using a mobile or digital wallet. 
Please visit 
americanexpress.com/rewards-info
 for more information about rewards.
3. Hilton Honors Complimentary Silver Status
You will receive complimentary Hilton Honors Silver status with your Hilton Honors American Express Card. Complimentary Silver status beneﬁt is only available to the Basic Card Member. If your Hilton Honors American Express Card is cancelled for any reason, your complimentary Hilton Honors Silver status provided with the Card will be cancelled. American Express reserves the right to change, modify or revoke complimentary Silver status at any time. If your complimentary Silver status is cancelled, you may be able to maintain your Silver status by qualifying under the Hilton Honors Program terms. Silver status beneﬁts are subject to availability and vary by hotel. For more information on Silver status beneﬁts or how to maintain Silver status each year with qualifying stays, nights or Hilton Honors Base Points through the Hilton Honors Program, visit 
HiltonHonors.com/MemberBenefits
 and 
Hilton.com/en/Hilton-Honors/benefit-terms/
. The Hilton Honors Program, including the benefits of Hilton Honors Membership, are subject to Hilton Honors Terms and Conditions; see 
HiltonHonors.com/terms
. 
4. No Foreign Transaction Fees 
American Express will not charge any foreign transaction fee on the purchases you make outside of the United States with your Card. However, there may be circumstances where ATMs or merchants charge a fee on foreign transactions.

subject: DEI Success Starts Here: Lead Inclusively, Avoid Common Traps
body:
Professionals Learning
The Impact of DEI Rollbacks on Workplace Culture
Live Webinar 
Date: 
March 04, 2025 | 
Time:
 10 AM PT | 01 PM ET | 
Duration:
 60 minutes
Register Now
 
Diversity, equity, and inclusion: this subject wasn't introduced to the workplace and organizations to spark controversies. However, the topic has been hot for a couple of weeks. Due to this reason, numerous organizations are retreating from the DEI policies. Now the question is how organizations can reframe their DEI policies for the modern workplace and avoid the buzz around the subject.
Join our expert speaker Suzanne Lucas she will share her insights and also practical tips on how can your DEI policies create an equal opportunity for your people instead of dividing individuals in the workplace. 
Session Objectives:
Focusing on fairness and opportunity instead of political rhetoric.
Building policies rooted in respect and equity.
Ensuring fair compensation and advancement opportunities for all employees.
Communicating inclusivity as a business strategy rather than a political agenda.
Using transparent and objective metrics to evaluate inclusivity. 
Expert Speaker:
 Suzanne Lucas spent 10 years in corporate HR where she hired, fired, managed the numbers, and double-checked with the lawyers. She left the corporate world to advise people and companies on how to have the best Human Resources departments possible.
167 Madison Avenue Ste 205 #227 New York City, NY 10016 | support@professionalslearningcom

subject: CEO Masterminds on AI & GTM
body:
A recap of what we talked about at this week's five SaaS CEO & founder growth mastermind calls from SaasRise (themes like AI, GTM, outbound, finance, pricing, exit prep, ABM, SDRs, recruiting, and much more)...  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
January 29, 2025   |   
Read Online
CEO Masterminds on AI & GTM 
A recap of what we talked about at this week's five SaaS CEO & founder growth mastermind calls from SaasRise (themes like AI, GTM, outbound, finance, pricing, exit prep, ABM, SDRs, recruiting, and much more)... 
 
A few of the attendees at yesterday’s SaaS Enterprise CEO/Founder Mastermind Call
Join our Weekly SaaS CEO & Founder Growth Masterminds
Hi Briza —
On yesterday’s 
SaasRise CEO Growth Mastermind
 
Call
 we spoke a lot about using AI tools like 
Google NotebookLM
, 
Claude
, and 
ChatBase
 to create custom AI chatbots for both internal team members and external customers. 
These calls are 
60 min growth masterminds
 where everyone is an experienced SaaS CEO or Founder who is committed to revenue growth and working toward a successful eventual exit — and all who are actively running $1M to $100M ARR firms. 
We now do five of these members-only growth mastermind calls each week on Zoom, for all types of SaaS firms (B2C, SMB, Midmarket, and Enterprise). 
So if you’re a CEO/Founder of a software firm with $1M to $100M in ARR, and aren’t already a member, we’d love to have you join the community. You can 
apply to join SaasRise here
 — and we’ll get you in right away with a two week free trial so you can see the community and checkout the masterminds, growth library, and webinars. 
If you care about revenue growth and preparing for a successful exit, these peer masterminds are one of the few with a high enough quality of content and member selection that they are actually worth your time to experience. 
Below I recap what we talked about this week (themes like AI, S&M, GTM, outbound, finance, pricing, exit prep, ABM, SDRs, RBF, recruiting, and much more)…. 
Apply to Join SaasRise🔥 
Existing Members See Event List 📅 
A screenshot from this afternoon’s CEO Growth Mastermind call
❝ 
 
The masterminds aren’t super long monthly forums with slow growth members from your local area — but rather modern fast-pace weekly calls with experienced SaaS CEOs & founders actively in the game of building a rapidly growing firm and prepping for a successful exit.
 
- Ryan Allis, CEO of SaasRise
What We Talked About This Week in the Growth Masterminds…
Below are just some of the topics we talked about in this week’s growth mastermind calls… 
How to create a custom AI chatbot using Claude and Google NotebookLM for internal knowledge sharing with your team
Reviewing all the lead and customer lifecycle stages and their definitions, from subscriber, Lead, MQL, SAL, SQL, opportunity, customer, and evangelist — and how to set up an automated lead scoring system that moves prospects through the stages.
Creating an external AI chat agent using a tool called Chatbase that works with OpenAI, Claude, and Gemini to provide customer support answers via chatbot
Hiring and training SDRs from an offshore placement agency like RooCruit to follow-up with past prospects as well as incoming new leads
How to use InVideo and Google Veo 2 to create short marketing videos generated by AI
Pricing strategies for software sales - whether to reduce pricing, increase pricing, and how to price based on usage, user count, features, and value
Considering a freemium offering for an Enterprise software platform with a high ACV - pros and cons based on the vertical
How to use Claude to write specific custom email messaging for each cold prospect based on their LinkedIn Profile and website
How to do outbound sales using Instantly, SalesLoft, LEMList, and SmartLead
How to build an ABM marketing strategy for going after the 30,000 people in a niche
How to calculate director/founder salaries into EBITDA. Broader context around EBITDA vs ARR calculations for valuations/exit; prepping for an exit with your company financials
How broad to go with your TAM using a matched audience list - whether to break it down by vertical or geography and create customized ads and landing pages for each major segment
Whether any other members had an Outbound SDR Template/Playbook that could be shared (yes!)
Fractional CFO options — where to find and cost expectations 
These are just a few of the topics we cover in any given week. We design the calls so they are actually worth your time as a CEO and founder. We’d love to have you try out our mastermind next week. You can 
apply here
 and once you’re accepted 
start your free trial here
. 
It’s lonely at the top, so come 
join us
 if you haven’t already. 
We’re here to help you grow and successfully exit!
All the best,
Ryan Allis, CEO & Co-Founder
SaasRise
The #1 Community for Experienced SaaS CEOs & Founders
www.saasrise.com
P.S - If you like great content like this and you’re a CEO or Founder of a software firm with $1M to $100M in ARR, 
apply to join SaasRise here
. 
  
We’re now up to 475 members in SaasRise, representing over $2.8B in ARR
Join Our Community of SaaS CEOs & Founders
Thanks for reading. We hope this guide has been helpful to you. Please take a moment to learn more about 
SaasRise
, our community for SaaS CEOs and Founders. We welcome all CEOs and Founders with $1M-$100M in ARR to join us. We hold three masterminds each week for our members and provide an in-depth library of SaaS growth, fundraising, and exit resources. You can 
apply here
. 
Apply to Join SaasRise Here 🔥 
  
Thanks for reading! If you liked this article, join the SaasRise community at 
www.saasrise.com
 for even more helpful growth content and weekly SaaS CEO masterminds. 
Join Our Weekly Masterminds for SaaS CEOs/Founders
About The Author
Ryan Allis is the founder of 
SaasRise
, the mastermind community for growth-focused SaaS CEOs with $1M-$100M in ARR. He is a three time INC 500 CEO. He was previously CEO of iContact and grew the firm as founder/CEO to 70,000 customers, 1 million users, 300 employees, $50M per year in sales, and an exit for $169M to Vocus (NASDAQ:VOCS). 
Since the sale of iContact, Ryan has been the CEO coach to high-growth SaaS firms including Instantly, Tatango, Seamless.ai, Pipeline, Datalyse, Green Packet, Revenue Accelerator, Galleon, Clearstream, YouCanBookMe, Retreaver, and EventMobi. Ryan has been part of the EO and Summit Series communities.
He holds an MBA from Harvard Business School, where he was Co-President of the Social Enterprise Club and a member of the Harvard Graduate School Leadership Institute. He’s passionate about helping recurring revenue software companies grow and exit.
We’ll see you next time with more great SaaS growth and scaling content!
  
Update your email preferences or unsubscribe 
here
© 2025 SaasRise 
Outpost Guiones
Nosara, Guanacaste 50206, Costa Rica

Offer valid for stays completed January 1 - April 30, 2025 (“promotion period”) at any hotel or resort within the Hilton Portfolio. Hilton Honors™ members must first register at

 prior to completing a stay within the promotion period. 
Registered Hilton Honors members checking in before January 1, 2025, will receive Bonus Points for their stay if the stay is completed on or after January 1, 2025, and prior to or on April 30, 2025. 
Registered Hilton Honors members will earn Double Points per stay during the promotion period. “Double Points” means members will receive Bonus Points equal to the number of Base Points earned during a stay. 
There is no limit to the total amount of Bonus Points that may be earned during the promotion period with this offer. However, there are restrictions on the number of Base Points that can be earned on a single stay at certain brands. 
For examples and further details, please see the 
FAQ page
. 
This offer may be altered or terminated without notice. Bonus Points do not count toward elite tier qualification. Please allow six to eight weeks from completion of your stay for Bonus Points to appear in your account. A 'stay' is defined as the total number of consecutive nights spent at the same hotel, whether or not a guest checks out and checks back in again. Offer is not valid for groups and cannot be combined with other select offers. In-Room Internet Access, Fitness Center/Health Club Access and Bottled Water benefits may not be complimentary at properties with a resort charge. Space-available upgrades only available at select brands. Elite status benefits are subject to availability and vary by brand. For more information, please visit

! 👋
 
We crunched the numbers based on real scores from tens of thousands of recipients like yours. Here's our take. 
 
Price per recognition was up by 20% in 2024
But no matter what was spent, recipient feedback scores were consistent
Giving employees a thoughtful and personalized experience is the best differentiator
 
But be cautious with gift cards...
Less isn't always more. When it's been a particularly trying year it’s best to give physical gifts where recipients can’t see a dollar amount.
